loans.name: Rwenyerere Bakyara Kweterana Group, Kihihi

texts.en: N. Aggrey is a hardworking and cooperative 55-year-old man. He is a farmer from Buzaniro that grows cash crops as well as keeping goats and cows for meat and milk. He is married with two children and he takes care of one orphan. His biggest business challenge is changes in the weather that affect his income. He has been in business for 10 years and is able to make 50,000/= in profit every week. Customers come to him because he is trustworthy. He hopes to continue selling good quality products and increasing his income as well as to continue educating all his children. Aggrey needs a loan to help buy more goats for farm expansion.

loans.use: To buy more goats for farm expansion

loans.name: Ifeoma

texts.en:
The selling of kerosene is an interesting and exciting business activity for Ifeoma. She has a tank that she uses to store her kerosene and sells at retail prices to her customers in Lagos, Nigeria. She loves this business because her customers pay in cash when they come to purchase her kerosene.

Ifeoma hopes for a loan of NGN 140,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She is married to a commercial driver and they are blessed with a child who is excelling in school. She duly thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Miled

texts.en:
Miled is a 56-year-old married man. In 2009, he got the idea of putting his extra home up for rental so as to profit from the revenue to satisfy the heavy needs of his family.

Today, Miled is requesting $1,000 to perform general maintenance and modifications needed to the house to make it comfortable and attract more clients in the summer season and to offer a good quality of service to them.

loans.use: To perform general maintenance and needed modifications to his rental house

loans.name: Rwenyerere Bakyara Kweterana Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
T. Mary is 47 years old and married with four children aged from 11 to 5 years.

Mary has operated a grocery shop in Buzaniro trading centre for two years, from which she is able to make 35,000/= as weekly profits. She mostly sells yellow bananas plus other produce and she is mostly affected by the late payments from the customers that take the goods on credit.

Mary ensures that her prices are fair as long as she gets the profits from her transactions. She would like to expand her business so that it can generate more income as well as educating all her children to the highest levels. She needs a loan to be able to improve on her grocery by buying more bananas for sale.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali has worked as a builder since 2003. He started this occupation when he was only 13 years old to help his father in raising his three brothers and sisters.

Ali’s occupation helps him in providing better life conditions. Concerning his young age, he has good experience in his work and he has a great demand from a good number of customers.

Today, Ali is requesting $1,000 to buy a steel cutter and some tools needed to expand his business productivity.

loans.use: To buy a steel cutter and some needed tools

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Cooking oil in Nigeria is used for various things, like cooking and the preparation of local soap called soda. The demand for cooking oil is high. Blessing is happy to be in the business of selling cooking oil because she says that it is highly profitable. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 160,000 to purchase more cooking oil to sell. She hopes to expand and grow her business. She is 38 years old and married with four children. Her children are excelling in school and this makes her happy. Her husband works with the government and he also supports the home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en: Tamer is a 21-year-old single man who lives with his parents and four siblings. He started working as a home painter in 2006, and he services a wide range of clients in the village and its neighborhoods. With the help of the loan request of $1,200, he will buy additional painting tools and special painting machinery to develop his work and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy additional painting tools and special painting machinery

loans.name: Nataly Rosabel

texts.es:
Nataly tiene 24 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a su menor hijo en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el sector Huaca Partida del distrito de Pítipo, a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica al comercio de algarrobina (extracto de la algarroba, fruto del algarrobo), ella nos comenta que aprendió el negocio de su madre, quien también se dedica a esta actividad desde hace muchos años. Ellas recolectan la algarroba en los bosques secos de la zona y la procesan para luego comercializarla en diversos establecimientos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Nataly ha recibido una oferta de pedidos de su producto de la ciudad de Lima, pero no cuenta con la suficiente algarroba como para procesar la cantidad de algarrobina que le han solicitado, por otro lado la algarroba de los bosques de la zona se ha terminado y tienen que comprarla a recolectores que la venden en sacos de 30 a 35 kg. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra del principal insumo para producir algarrobina.

Nataly es una joven conocida y estimada por los vecinos de la zona, quienes la consideran una mujer trabajadora y una madre luchadora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria. En la imagen nos muestra la cocina donde prepara la algarrobina y las etiquetas con las que manufactura su producto.
texts.en:
Nataly is a 24-year-old single mother who lives with her youngest son at her parent's house located in the Huaca Partida sector, District of Pítipo, about 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Nataly has a business selling "algarrobina" (carob fruit syrup). She tells us she learned this business from her mother who had a similar business many years ago. They pick the fruit from the dry forests of the region, and then process it and sell it to many businesses around the city of Chiclayo. Nataly has received an order from the city of Lima, but she does not have enough carob fruit to fulfill it. On the other hand, the fruit from the forests has run out so she has to buy it from the fruit pickers, who sell 30-35 Kg. bags. This is why Nataly is requesting her first loan of PEN 700 from Kiva partner, Edpyme Alternativa - so she can buy the carob fruit to produce more algarrobina. Nataly is a well known and beloved young woman among the neighbors of the region, who consider her a hardworking woman and mother. Her biggest dream is to continue growing as a business woman. In the photo, she shows us the kitchen in which she prepares the algarrobina, and the labels she applies to her products.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying carob fruit

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein has been working as a home painter since 2008, to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities, and to earn income to help satisfy the needs of his family. Working on a freelance basis, he manages part of the house projects in his town and its surroundings. With the help of the loan request of $1,200, he managed to expand his business by buying a Rapid car for easier transport to the houses on which he works.

loans.use: Buying a car for easier transport to painting jobs

loans.name: Ayme Yanina

texts.es:
Ayme tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres y hermano en el sector Huaca Partida del distrito de Pítipo, ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores desde hace dos años. Ella nos comenta que aprendió del negocio observando a su madre y luego empezó a criar sus propios animales. Ayme cria sus animales en la parte posterior de su casa y estos también buscan su propio alimento en los alrededores, ya que la zona en donde vive es zona rural y las casas están rodeadas de bosques secos y campos de cultivo.

Ayme cria aves de corral y cerdos para luego venderlos a los negociantes que usualmente recorren la zona donde vive. Ella está pensando en mejorar la calidad de la alimentacion de sus animales para que estos se desarrollen bien, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado.

Ayme es una joven responsable y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es hacerse conocida en el negocio y crecer poco a poco como empresaria.
texts.en:
Ayme is 21 years old, is single, and lives with her parents and brother in the Huaca Partida sector, District of Pítipo, about 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has raised small animals to sell for two years. She tells us she learned the business by watching her mother, then starting to raise her own animals. Ayme raises her animals in the back of her house, but they also forage for food around the property, as the area where Ayme lives is surrounded by dry forests and agricultural land. Ayme raises poultry and pigs to then sell to customers who usually visit the area where she lives. She is thinking of improving the quality of the feed she gives her animals so that they would develop better. This is why she is requesting her first loan of PEN 500 to Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa - so she can buy balanced feed for her animals. Ayme is a responsible and hardworking woman. Her dream is to become known as a business woman and to slowly grow as an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying balanced feed for animals

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
La señora Celestina G. V., tiene 47 años de edad vive en el Barrio Laureles Norte, es madre de tres hijos, todos son casados y le apoyan económicamente, así también recibe un apoyo de su esposo el cual es albañil. Ella se dedica a la venta ambulante de Cd y DVD.

Ella solicito un préstamo para el entechado del porche de su casa y embaldosarlo, de esta manera  poco a poco irá dándole forma a su humilde morada, asegurándola así también de los delincuentes que amenazan con el robo de su mercadería, debido a  que ella vive en una zona en donde los índices de delincuencia son altos, espera que se le apoye para idealizar este sueño y poder de esta manera mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Celestina Gonzáles V. is 47 years old, lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood, and has three children, all of whom are married and support her financially. Her husband, who works as a bricklayer, also helps her out. She sells CDs and DVDs door to door. She has requested a loan in order to finish the roof of, and tile her home's porch in order to give shape to her humble abode. This also ensures her safety, as there are many who threaten to steal her merchandise. She lives in a high-crime area and she hopes to receive the support she needs to realize her dreams and improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a roof for and tiling a room in her home

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en: Haidar is a 43-year-old married man and has three unemployed children. He has been working as a painter, specializing in home projects for the past 20 years. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his children's needs. Today, Haidar is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy new painting tools and supplies needed to meet the requirements of his clients and make a good income for his family.

loans.use: To buy new painting tools and supplies

loans.name: Adela Teodora

texts.es:
La señora Adela Teodora A. Montalván es una mujer luchadora, tiene 51 años, es casada, tiene 4 hijos de 13,16,20 y 26 años, se dedica día a día a la  preparación y venta de comida, dulces y gaseosas desde hace 3 años, con sus ingresos cubre los gastos de estudios y pasajes de sus hijos en edad escolar, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado comprar artefactos para su vivienda como: un refrigerador, una cocina, una licuadora. Dentro de los planes que Adela  tiene para el futuro es aperturar una bodega grande en su vivienda. 
El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido para la compra de una vitrina y un mostrador para vender sus dulces, Adela agradece el apoyo brindado a los inversionistas, ya que le ha sido de mucha ayuda para implementar su negocio y así mejorar  su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adela Teodora A. Montalván is a hardworking woman; she is 51 years old, is married, has four children - aged 13,16, 20, and 26 years old - and for the last four years has prepared food which she sells daily along with candy and soft drinks. With her income, she covers school and travel expenses for her school-age children and has been able to buy household items like a refrigerator, a stove, and a blender. One of Adela's plans is to open a convenience store in her house. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to buy a display case for the candy and a counter. Adela thanks the support borrowers receive and without which she would not have been able to start her business and improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a display case and counter

loans.name: Señor De Torrechayoc Ii Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal SEÑOR D. TORRECHAYOC II está formado por ocho mujeres y cuatro varones, trabajadores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, las socias viven la ciudad D. Urubamba del departamento del Cusco, urbe que se caracteriza por su clima caluroso, sus paisajes hermosos, su agricultura y su ganadería.

Mariela es socia del banco comunal Señor D. Torrechayoc, tiene 33 años D. edad, es conviviente y su esposo Walter le apoya en el gasto familiar. Mariela se dedica a la venta D. comestibles por mayor, ella es una mujer emprendedora que desD. que abrió la tienda D. abarrotes le va muy bien, Ya son dos años que la socia pertenece al banco comunal Señor D. Torrechayoc, el crédito que reciba es para comprar mas arroz, azúcar, fideos y huevos. 

Los otros socios como Edelmira, Sonia y luz Marina son profesoras, Albino y Nayda se dedican a la venta D. comestibles y Angela se dedica a la venta D. verduras.  

Los socios Militon e Inocencia son esposos que se dedican a la panadería pues alquilan un local para preparar sus panes. Los socios tenían su casa D. material D. adobe cerca al rió vilcanota. Por las precipitaciones fluviales que cayeron sobre la ciudad del cusco, el rió del vilcanota aumento su caudal D. tal forma que se desbordo llevando se consigo casas como la D. los socios Militon y Inocencia, ellos perdieron todos sus pertenencias D. su domicilio. Los socios continuaran con sus trabajos a pesar D. las adversidades del clima.

Otros socios están preocupados por que las ventas han disminuido debido a las fuertes lluvias que cayeron por tres días en la ciudad del Cusco pues sus compradores trabajan directamente con el turismo, el turismo ha decaído considerablemente.

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The communal bank called Senor D. Torrechayoc II is maD. up of 8 women and 4 men, all hardworkers who always look for opportunities to improve their lives and economic situation, and through their daily efforts ensure a better future for their children. The members live near Cusco, in the city of Urubamba, a region known for its warm climate, beautiful scenery and cattle farming.

Mariela is a member of the bank. She is 33 years old and lives with her husband Walter, who helps with the household costs. Mariela sells wholesale groceries. She is an enterprising woman and from the time she opened her small shop she has done well. She has been a member of the communal bank for 2 years now, and she will use her portion of the new loan to purchase rice, sugar, noodles and eggs. The other bank members, Edelmira, Sonia and Luz Marina are teachers. Albino and Nayda also work selling grocery items and Angela sells vegetables.

Two other members, Milton and Inocencia, work selling bakery goods which they prepare themselves from a shop they rent. They lived in adobe houses close to the Vilcanota river. Due to the torrential rains which have been falling over the city of Cusco, the Vilcanota river overflowed its banks, destroying homes like Milton and Inocencia had. They lost all of their possessions, but they continue in their work asiD. from the tremendous difficulties. Other members are worried because sales have decreased in the wake of the rain which fell for three days in Cusco. These members worked directly with tourists, and tourism has fallen considerably.

The members all appreciate the opportunities that the communal bank provides for them, and they have committed to comply with their respective payments on time.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The money from this loan will be distributed to various members of the communal bank.  Some members have small grocery stores, some teach, and some work with tourists.  All have suffered from the recent torrential rain in Cusco, Peru.

loans.name: Tulia

texts.es:
Tulia es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer.
Tulia es casada, tiene 50 años y 8 hijos, Tulia venD. ropa variada en la feria D. San Juan actividad que realiza los días domingos, además Tulia venD. la ropa a pedido a amigos y conocidos.
Tulia necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ropa variada.
Los sueños D. Tulia son mejorar su negocio y abrir una tienda D. ropa.
texts.en:
Tulia is a member of the communal bank called Florecer. She is 50 years old, and married with 8 children. Every Sunday, Tulia sells clothing in the central market of San Juan. She also sells clothing by request to friends and acquaintances. Tulia will use the loan to purchase a wiD. variety of clothing she can sell. Her dream is to continue to grow her business and one day be able to open her own clothing shop.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a wide variety of clothing which she resells in the central market, as well as to friends and acquaintances.

loans.name: Calixta

texts.es:
Calixta es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer.
Calixta es viuda, tiene 50 años y 2 hijos, Calixta vende frutas, canchas, verduras, en un terminal terrestre de la ciudad, actividad que realiza todos los días desde muy temprano. Además Calixta vende productos naturales.
Calixta necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicina natural.
Calixta sueña con mejorar su negocio y ahorrar lo suficiente para su vejez.
texts.en:
Calixta is a member of the communal bank called Florecer. She is a 50 year old widow with 2 children. Calixta sells fruits, vegetables and snacks in the central terminal of the city. She works every day from very early in the morning. She also sells a line of natural health products. Calixta will use the loan to purchase more natural medicines to sell. Her dream is to grow her business and save enough to retire.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more natural health products which she sells

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
La señora Eulalia es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 58 años, es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos independientes de 28 y 35 años, se dedica a la venta diaria de abarrotes desde hace 20 años, Eulalia nos cuenta que los préstamos le han sido de mucha ayuda, ya que ha desde hace 5 meses ha implementado otro negocio de venta de ropa y calzado, sus ingresos cubren los gastos de pago de servicios, alimentos, alquiler de local, con el esfuerzo de labor diaria ha logrado mejorar sus ventas y  su segundo negocio. El gran sueño de Eulalia es tener un negocio mucho más grande y con variedad de prendas de vestir.
El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido para la compra de mercadería escolar (blusas, camisas, uniformes). Eulalia agradece toda la ayuda que le han dado porque gracias a eso ha salido adelante, ha crecido y sigue creciendo junto con su familia y también  como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Eulalia, 58, is an enterprising woman. She lives with her life partner and has two, adult children, 28 and 35 years old. She has sold groceries for 20 years. Eulalia tells us that the loans have been very useful because five months ago she set up a clothing and shoe sales business. Her earnings cover utility, food, and rental costs. Her daily efforts have improved her sales and her second business. Eulalia's great wish is to have an even larger business with a wider selection of clothing articles. The recent loan granted will be used to buy school merchandise (blouses, shirts, uniforms). Eulalia is grateful for the help she has been given because, thanks to it, she has managed to get ahead, she's grown and continues to grow together with her ffamily and as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school merchandise (blouses, shirts, uniforms)

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer.
Irma es casada, tiene 38 años y 5 hijos, Irma tiene un puesto en el mercado de Carmen Alto en donde vende calzados y ropa variada, además Irma tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Irma necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatos y medias.
Los sueños de Irma son comprar un carro para ir a las ferias y ahorrar para los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the communal bank Florecer. Irma is 38, and married with 5 children. She has a stand in the Carmen Alto market where she sells shoes and assorted clothing. Besides this Irma has a grocery store in the house. She needs a loan of 1000 soles so the she can buy shoes and stockings. Irma’s dreams are to buy a car so that she can go to the fairs and save money for her children’s studies.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes and stockings

loans.name: Virtues Women Group

texts.en:
Here are small scale local entrepreneurs from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. These women have come to SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of SLL 2,000,000 in order to expand their businesses, make better sales and consequently improving on their standard of living.  

Marie J., second from right, is the leader of this group. She is 43 years old and married to a building contractor, and they have three children. For ten years, Marie has been selling cooked rice, vegetables and meat. With her share of the loan, she will buy cooking ingredients, such as rice, fish, meat, etc., in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients, such as rice, fish and meat

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer.
Rosa es separada, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Rosa tiene un puesto en un terminal terrestre de la ciudad en donde vende cigarros y hoja de coca (que es utilizado por los campesinos como medicina).
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cigarro.
Los sueños de Rosa son que sus hijos sean profesionales y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Florecer Communal Bank. Rosa is 33, separated, and has two children. Rosa has a stand at the city bus station where she sells cigarrettes and coca leaf (which is used as medicine by the country folk). Rosa needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy cigarrettes. Rosa’s dreams are that her children become professionals and that her business grows.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cigarrettes

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El señor Juan Carlos R. F. vive en el Barrio de Laureles sur  tiene 29 años de edad, trabaja en una empresa de la zona franca como supervisor desde hace 6 años , dentro de los principales anhelos del señor R. esta la culminación de la remodelación de su vivienda y así brindar mejores condiciones  a su futura familia. El solicita un préstamo principalmente para la instalación de 2 persianas en su cuarto y desea destinar una parte del dinero en la compra de carne para iniciar con un nuevo negocio de carnicería. Él espera que se le apoye económicamente a emprender su nuevo negocio, esto le dará la posibilidad de tener una fuente de ingresos más fuerte que lo beneficie para nuevos proyectos de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos R. F., 29, lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. He has worked as a supervisor for a company in the tax-free zone for 6 years. Among his dreams is to complete his home's remodel so that his future family will have better living conditions. He is asking for credit to install two Venetian blinds in his bedroom and he will also use part of the funds to buy meat to set up a new butcher shop business. He hopes that he will recieve economic support to undertake his new business; this will provide him with an opportunity to have a better source of income that will be of use for his future life projects.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install Venetian blinds in his bedroom.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela M. G., reside en el Municipio de Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Su grupo familiar junto al cual vive esta conformado por su esposo quien es jubilado, su hija y una nieta. Adela es una señora muy esforzada y trabajadora, quien se dedica a confeccionar ropa para mujeres y hombre, la cual sale a vender de manera ambulante por las colonias y cantones del Municipio de Ilopango. Este trabajo lo desempeña por las mañanas, y luego en las tardes se dedica a pelar frutas y colocarlas en pequeñas bolsas, las cuales comercializa a las afueras de su casa, lugar muy estratégico para este tipo de ventas ya que su vivienda esta ubicada en calle principal, lo cual le permite tener mayor visibilidad por parte de sus clientes. Adela solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar tela de diferentes colores y estampados para poder cocer mayor variedad de prendas de vestir. Así mismo desea poder comprar más fruta y aderezos para estas tales como: chile, sal y limón. Todo esto lo hace con la esperanza de poder mejorar sus ingresos diarios, ya que la pensión que su esposo obtienes es muy poca, razón por la cual ella debe trabajar muy duro para solventar los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Adela M. G. lives in the town of Ilopango, located in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her retired husband, their daughter and a granddaughter. Adela is a very hard-working lady who makes women's and men's clothing, which she sells as a street vendor in the neighborhoods of Ilopango. She does this job in the morning, and in the afternoon she peels fruit and puts it in little bags which she sells outside her house. This is a very good place for this type of business since her house is on a main street, which allows her to be more visible to her customers. Adela is asking for this loan so she can buy fabric in different colors and patterns to sew different types of clothing. She also wants to be able to buy more fruit and fruit seasonings like chili, salt and lemon. She does all this in the hope of improving her daily income. Her husband's pension is very low, which is why she has to work very hard to cover household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and fruit

loans.name: Yngrid

texts.es:
Yngrid es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer.
Yngrid es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, Ingrid vende ropa variada que reparte a amigos y familiares, además junto a su esposo tiene 2 carros que realizan transporte a la provincia de Vilcas.
Ingrid necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa variada.
Ingrid sueña con comprar mas carros y construir su departamento.
texts.en:
Yngrid, 24, is a member of the Florecer communal bank. Yngrid lives with her life partner and their son. Yngrid sells assorted clothing among her friends and relatives. In addition, together with her husband, she has two autos with which they provide transportation services in Vilcas province. Yngrid needs 1200 soles to buy assorted clothing. Yngrid dreams with buying more cars and to build her apartment.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted clothing.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer.
Luisa es viuda, tiene 58 años y 6 hijos, Luisa tiene un carro que alquila a su hijo para que realice taxi en la ciudad, además Luisa venD. leña en su casa.
Luisa necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la reparación D. su carro.
Los sueños D. Luisa son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Luisa, 58, is a member of the Florecer communal bank. She's a widow and has 6 children. Luisa has a car that she leases to her son, who uses it to proviD. taxi services in the city. In addition. Luisa sells firewood at home. Luisa needs 1000 new soles to pay for vehicle repairs. Luisa's dream is that her children complete their education and to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For auto repair.

loans.name: Monica Mariela

texts.es:
Mónica es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer.
Mónica es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, Mónica vende golosinas en la puerta de una escuela, además Mónica vende salchipapas de manera ambulatoria en una avenida concurrida, actividad que realiza por las noches.
Mónica necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas y platos descartables.
El sueño de Mónica son comprar una casa propia.
texts.en:
Mónica is a member of the Florecer communal bank. Mónica lives with her life partner, is 24 years old, and has one son. She sells sweets at the entrance gate of a school. In addition, Mónica wanders along a very busy avenue selling salchipapas (fried potatoes with sausage); this latter activity is at night. Mónica needs a 1400 sol loan to buy sweets and disposable plates. Mónica's dream is to buy her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets and disposable plates.

loans.name: Nathaniel M's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers of a primary school in Waterloo, about 26 miles from Freetown, the capital city. This school, established in 1986, is staffed with 19 teachers. The staff of this institution, like many other schools’ staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone in Waterloo, to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise be unable to accomplish with their mere salaries. Some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy furniture, land or house-building materials; others invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Fourty-two-year-old Nathaniel M. K. is the leader of this group of teachers.  He was born in Moyamba district, in southern Sierra Leone. He is married with 4 children. Nathaniel wants a loan in order to buy house building materials and pays school fees for his children.

loans.use: Buy house building material and pays school fees for his children

loans.name: Rodrigo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Rodrigo Antonio J. H. tiene 32 años, es casado y su esposa trabaja como  guarda de seguridad la empresa de C Y B, ellos tienen dos hijos y viven en el Barrio Laureles Norte este es un barrio conocido por los altos índice de delincuencia que atacan a la comunidad que habita allí.

Agradecen el apoyo que les ha brindado los fondos Kiva este sería su segundo préstamo y lo solicitan para realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda debido a que hay una pared que es de plycem y la desea reconstruir de bloque, esto le dará a la familia una mayor seguridad para todos, es gracias a los fondos de Kiva que el señor J. ha podido componer poco a poco su hogar.
texts.en:
Rodrigo Antonio J. H. is 32 and married. His wife works as a security guard for the C Y B company. They have two children, and they live in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. This neighborhood is known for the high levels of delinquency, which attacks the community that lives there. They are grateful for the help of the funds that Kiva has given them. This will be their second loan. They are asking for the loan to make improvements to their house. There is a wall of cement board that he wants to rebuild with concrete block. This will give the family better security for all. Thanks to the funds from Kiva, Mr. J. has been able to repair his house little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a cement block wall

loans.name: Zuly Maribel

texts.es:
Zuly es socia del Banco Comunal Guadalupe.
Zuly es soltera, tiene 22 años y 2 hijos, técnica en enfermería y trabaja en el hospital, Zuly vende salchipapas de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Magdalena, actividad que realiza todos los días por las noches.
Zuly necesita un préstamo de 1500 S. dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Zuly son sacar a sus hijos adelante
texts.en:
Zuly is a member of the Guadalupe Communal Bank. Zuly is 22, single, and has two children. She is a vocational nurse, and she works in the hospital. Zuly sells “salchipapas” (food made from fried sausages and fried potatoes) as a street vendor in the Magdalena market. She does this everyday in the evenings. Zuly needs a loan for 1,500 PEN to buy rice and sugar. Zuly’s dreams are to get her children ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina F. M. de 51 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo quien es jubilado, y sus dos hijos los cuales estudian bachillerato. La señora Marina, se dedica a la venta de ropa interior femenina, así mismo se encarga de mostrar catálogos de cosméticos como perfumes, esmaltes y otros más, los cuales comercializa de forma ambulantes por las calles de las colonias y municipios ubicados en Ilopango, así mismo comercializa su producto en el Centro de Gobierno de El Salvador, lugar en el cual es muy conocida, debido a que se dedica a este tipo de trabajo desde hace 15 años, negocio el cual le ha permitido seguir adelante y criar a sus dos hijos hasta la fecha. Marina solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar más ropa, y así mismo comprar blusas y shorts para dama. Marina posee el gran deseo de poder crecer como comerciante, y de esta manera alcanzar una mejor estabilidad económica la cual los prepare para un futuro, en el cual puedan contar con dinero ahorrado y poder vivir de esto junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Marina is 51 years old and lives in the City of Ilopango, located in the San Salvador department. She lives with her husband, who is retired, and two children, who are working on bachelor's degrees. Marina sells ladies' underwear by walking through the neighborhoods and streets of Ilopango. She also sells cosmetics, such as perfumes, nail polish, and other things from a catalog. She also sells in the El Salvador Government Center, an area where she is well known, as she has been doing this for 15 years. This business has helped her get ahead and allowed her to raise her children. She is asking for a loan to be able to buy more clothing, such as ladies' tops and shorts. Maria has a strong desire to grow her business so that she will have more financial stability, which will prepare them for the future, so that she and her husband can count on their savings to live from.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in clothing for resale

loans.name: Delia Tereza

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Guadalupe.
Delia es casada, tiene 34 años y 5 hijos, Delia vende raspadillas (refresco preparado con hielo y jugo de frutas) actividad que realiza ambulatoriamente en un triciclo en un parque. Además Delia vende Salchipapas por las tardes y noches.
Delia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de otra maquina de raspadilla.
Los sueños de Delia son que sus hijos salgan adelante y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the Guadalupe communal bank. She is 34, years old, married, with five children. Delia sells “raspadas” (shaved ice flavored with fruit juices) in the park, from a three-wheeled push cart. She also sells “Salchipapas” (sausage and potatoes) in the evenings. Delia needs a loan for 2,000 PEN ($725) to buy a new ice shaving machine. Delia’s dreams are for her children to come out ahead in life and for her to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a new ice shaving machine

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar es socia del Banco Comunal Guadalupe.
Pilar es casada, tiene 34 años y 5 hijos, Pilar vende golosinas de manera ambulatoria en la puerta de una escuela, actividad realiza de lunes a viernes, además los días domingos viaja a las ferias de la región en donde vende panes.
Pilar necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas.
El sueño de Pilar es salir adelante.
texts.en:
Pilar is a member of the Guadalupe Communal Bank. Pilar is 34, married, and has five children. Pilar sells sweets as a street vender in the doorway to a school. She does this Monday through Friday. On Sundays she travels to the fairs in the area and sells bread. Pilar needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy sweets. Pilar’s dream is to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras 2 Group

texts.es:
Este comité se encuentra en pleno desarrollo, con las actividades que las mismas realizan, se puede decir que las capacitaciones de las asesoras sirvieron bastante para que estas señoras hoy en día se sientan mas seguras para desempeñar una actividad que no este relacionado solamente con las labores de la casa.
Son señoras que trabajan en su mayoría como empleadas domesticas que, en temporadas anteriores al programa comité de mujeres no desarrollaban ninguna actividad comercial., por eso es que en estos días, al formar parte del programa de Comité de mujeres emprendedoras,  existe una actitud de sentido de pertenencia de las mismas para mantenerse al tanto de los requerimientos que les exige la fundación a modo  de que sigan siendo beneficiadas recibiendo un capital para satisfacer sus necesidades invirtiendo en pequeños negocios que les generara un ingreso adicional.

Las mismas están agradecidas por tan valiosa oportunidad que les brinda la Fundación , y esperan cada día capacitarse adquirir experiencias dentro del programa y cumplir sus obligaciones como socias.
Cada una realiza su trabajo con mucho esfuerzo y satisfacción ya esta actividad nos comentan las señoras sirven muchísimo para el sustento de la casa así como la señora Silvina A. quien se dedica ala venta de comestibles en una pequeño negocio que posee frente a su casa y cuando la venta disminuye en el local ella sale y visita casa por casa a sus clientes para ofrecer sus productos..
Se citan la actividad que realiza cada integrante:.

1
Silvina A.
Vta de Comestibles.
2
Ines M.
Empleada Domestica.
3
Mercedes A.         
Empleada Domestica
4
Marta G.
Empleada Domestica .
5
Dany O.
Empleada Domestica.
6
Salvadora C.
Costurera
7
Ariana G.
Empleada Domestica.
8
Matilde O.
Encargada de Casa.
9
Bernarda O.
Empleada Domestica..
10
Maria G.
Vta de Joyas .
11
Lucia G.
Empleada Domestica.
12
Lidia A.
Empleada Domestica.
13
Nancy C.
Elaboracion de Collares.
14
Maricela G.
Elaboracion de Cadenas.
15
Deisy E.
Vta de comestiblesV
texts.en:
This committee is very active with the work that the members are involved in. That is to say that abilities of the women serve them well in these days to make them feel confident to begin an activity that is not only related to housework. The majority of the women work as domestic servants, that in the past never led to any outside business by the women‘s committee. But in today’s world, by being part of a committee of entrepreneurial women, there is an attitude of feeling of their belonging, and of being able to fulfill the requirements demanded by the foundation. Thus they can continue receiving capital to satisfy the needs of their small businesses so that they will generate more income. These women are grateful to the foundation for giving them a valuable opportunity and every day they hope to have more experience in the program to fulfill their obligations as members. Each one does her work with a lot of determination and satisfaction since, as the women tell us, these businesses help them support their households. One such woman is Silvina A. who works selling foodstuffs in a small business that she has in front of her house. When business drops off in her stand, she goes out house to house to offer her products to her customers. Each business is listed here: Silvina A. Food sales. 2 Ines M. Domestic servant. 3 Mercedes A. Domestic servant. 4 Marta G. Domestic servant. 5 Dany O. Domestic servant. 6 Salvadora C. Seamstress 7 Ariana G. Domestic servant. 8 Matilde O. House manager. 9 Bernarda O. Domestic servant. 10 Maria G. Jewelry sales. 11 Lucia G. Domestic servant. 12 Lidia A. Domestic servant. 13 Nancy C. Making necklaces 14 Maricela G. Making chains 15 Deisy E. Food sales

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make food such as meat, vegetables, noodles, rice, bread  and more

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa Elena Z. Díaz tiene 33 años de edad y nació en la ciudad de Teustepe Boaco, tras las pocas posibilidades de trabajo en su ciudad natal decidió buscar nuevos horizontes en la capital, ella es casada y tienen dos niñas de las edades de 11 y 2 años de edad, el mayorcito estudia la primaria. Ellos trabajan en una zona franca como operadores de maquinas y de esta manera comparten los gastos del hogar.

Dentro de los gastos está el terminar la construcción de su hogar, de esta manera es que solicita este préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, esto beneficiaria de gran manera a la familia en la vivencia de criar a sus hijos en un lugar cómodo y seguro que ayude al buen desenvolvimiento de los niños hacia un futuro mejor, pero para realizar este fin primero desea invertir capital en la compra de mercadería para vender a su clientela, esto le traerá mejores oportunidades económicas que le aportaran a futuros planes que tenga programado.
texts.en:
Rosa Elena Z. Díaz is 33. She was born in the city of Teustepe Boaco. Because there are few work opportunities in her native city, she decided to look for new horizons in the capital. She is married, and they have two daughters, 11 and 2 years old. The oldest is in primary school. They work in a tax-free zone as machine operators. This way they share the household expenses. Among the expenses is finishing the construction on their house. She is asking for this loan to buy construction materials. This will greatly benefit the family in the house as they raise their children in a comfortable place. It surely helps the children develop well towards a better future. In order to do that she wants to use the loan to buy merchandise to sell to her customers. This will bring better economic opportunities that will contribute to her future plans.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
El señor Ignacio L. está agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudo a reparar el techo de su casa. 
Esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo poder terminar la construcción y elaborar la barda alrededor de su casa, ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejorar. Desea que su familia este mas segura cuando el no este en casa. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del ingreso que obtiene de su empleo en una agencia de trasportes en el departamento de jefe de turnos.
La persona que aparece en la foto es su esposa la señora Silvia Pacheco, ya que Don Ignacio se encontraba en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mr. Ignacio L. is thankful for the previous loan he received, which helped him repair the roof of his house. Today, he is once again requesting a loan, this time to finish construction of and to erect the wall around his house; currently, he does not have the money to make improvements to his home. He plans to pay for the loan with his income as a shift manager at a transportation agency. The person in the photo is Mr. L.' wife, Ms. Silvia Pacheco, as Mr. L. was at work when the photo was taken.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishing construction of and building a wall around his home

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilu es socia del Banco Comunal Guadalupe.
Marilu es soltera, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Marilu vende ponches (bebidas calientes con maca, quinua) de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Magdalena actividad que realiza por las noches.
Marilu necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, quinua.
Los sueños de Marilu son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y tener un negocio en su casa.
texts.en:
Marilu is a member of the Communal Bank "Guadalupe." Marilu is single, is 37 years old, and has two children. She has a stall at the market where she sells "ponches" (warm drinks with maca root or quinoa) at night. Marilu needs a loan of PEN 1,000 in order to buy sugar and quinoa. Marilu's biggest dream is that her children finish school and to have a business at home.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sugar and quinoa

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy es socia del Banco Comunal Guadalupe.
Lucy es casada, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo, Lucy junto a su esposo se dedican a la compra de ganado en las diferentes ferias y pueblos, animales que transportan a la ciudad de Lima en donde tienen un establecimiento de engorde de animales.
Lucy necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago de flete.
Los sueños de Lucy son que sus hijos sean profesionales y comprar otro terreno.
texts.en:
Lucy is member of the Communal Bank "Guadalupe." She is married, is 30 years old, and has one son. Lucy and her husband buy cattle that they then transport to the city of Lima where they run an operation to fatten the animals. Lucy needs a loan of PEN 1,000 to pay for the transportation of the animals. Lucy's dreams include her children becoming professionals, and buying more land.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying for transportation

loans.name: Maleyka

texts.en: Maleyka N. is a 48-year-old woman who sells products such as shampoo, toothpaste, and detergent. She is married and has three children. Her husband helps her with the business, which she started four years ago. Maleyka wishes to build her own store one day. To bring about her dream, she applied for a loan of 1600 AZN, which she will use to purchase more detergents to sell.

loans.use: purchase more detergents to increase profit

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
El señor Celso N. Solís es casado con hijos mayores, domiciliado en la compañía Almada de Caacupe. 
 El señor Celso es un hombre muy trabajador y tiene tres actividades es agricultor y ahora tiene plantación de poroto y maní y también tiene una olería(lugar donde se fabrica ladrillo). 
Solicita el crédito para  la compra y almacenamiento de  arcilla para la olería
  Agradece a la fundación paraguaya por el apoyo obtenido por que gracias al crédito puede producir mas ladrillos y aprovechar que ahora tiene buen precio en el mercado y también incrementara sus ingresos  a su unidad familiar
texts.en:
Mr. Celso N. Solís is married, has grown children and lives in the Almada de Caacupe village. Celso is a hardworking man: he is a farmer, he plants beans and peanuts, and he runs an "olería," a place where bricks are made from clay. He is asking for a loan to buy and store more clay for the olería. He thanks Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya for the support it has given him; thanks to this loan he will be able to produce more bricks and -- since the market is good for construction right now -- he will increase his family's income.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clay to make bricks

loans.name: Nicolasa Candelaria

texts.es:
La señora Nicolasa Candelaria L. D. tiene 51 años de edad y vive en el barrio Laureles Norte, ella es madre de 2 hijos mayores de edad y una hija la cual está bajo su responsabilidad. Se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en un conocido mercado de la capital. Su esposo trabaja como jefe de seguridad en el Ministerio de Transporte e Infraestructura.

La mayor aspiración de la familia está el terminar de criar a su hija y darle todos los estudios profesionales para un futuro prospero, así como también el culminar la construcción de la casa y mejorar el local del negocio para poner una tienda de ropa, para este último propósito es que solicitaron este préstamo, con el crédito compraran los materiales de construcción necesarios para remodelar el local en donde instalaran el nuevo negocio, ella espera se le brinde un apoyo, pues le beneficiaria económicamente a toda la familia en el mejoramiento continuo del nivel de vida.

Este es el segundo prestamo que tienen con Afodenic, en el pasado pudo realizar la compra de mercaderia, ahora que le ha sido factible es que estan planificando la apertura de la tienda, se hace una énfasis del progreso de la familia, gracias a los fondos Kiva.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nicolasa Candelaria L. D. is 51 years old, lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood, has two grown sons and a daughter who still lives at home. Nicolasa sells second-hand clothing in a popular market in the capital. Her husband works as security manager at the Transportation and Infrastructure Ministry. The family's highest aspiration is to finish raising their daughter and to give her every professional opportunity to ensure her success in the future. They also want to finish their home and to improve the appearance of the new clothing store. For this, they are requesting this loan: to buy construction materials to improve the store to which they will be moving their business. Nicolasa hopes the support for this will come through, since the whole family will benefit financially from the improvements. This is the second loan Nicolasa requests from Kiva partner Afodenic. The previous loan was used to buy supplies, and now that they're opening a new store, Nicolasa and her family's progress emphasizes the importance of Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials to open a new store

loans.name: Germina

texts.es:
Germina es socia del Banco Comunal Guadalupe.
Germina es casada, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, trabaja en el hospital regional, Germina tiene un puesto en el mercado Covadonga en donD. venD. verduras, además Germina se dedica a la agricultura D. verduras en la comunidad D. Llamocctachi. 
Germina necesita un préstamo D. 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. abonos.
Los sueños D. Germina son que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Germina is a member of the Guadalupe Communal Bank. Germina is 42, married, and has three children. She works in the regional hospital. Germina has a stand in the Covadonga market where she sells vegetables. Also, Germina grows vegetables in the Llamocctachi community. Germina needs a loan for 1,250 PEN to buy fertilizers. Germina’s dreams are for her children to become professional and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Heyling Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Heyling Carolina L. A., tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y su esposo es ebanista ellos viven en el humilde en el humilde Barrio San Ignacio, tienen 3 hijos, actualmente ellos se dedican a los estudios de primaria. La familia sobrevive de la agricultura desde hace 10 años.

Como toda familia Nicaragüense, anhela con mejorar las condiciones de vida de todos y dentro de los principales problemas a los que se ha enfrentado para culminar este sueño, ha sido la falta de un mejor manejo agronómico adecuado al cultivo, es para esto que solicita de este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de materiales agrícolas, tales como fertilizantes e insumos que garanticen una cosecha de calidad y la venta rápida de esta producción, en los años anteriores lo  manejaban, gracias al capital brindado por su esposo, pero este año la ventas han bajado y se les ha dificultado el reunir el dinero necesario para la compra, esto a futuro les daría el capital para la planificación e inversión en la diversificación de nuevas cosechas.
texts.en:
Heyling Carolina L. A. is 26 and married. Her husband is a cabinetmaker. They live in the humble San Ignacio neighborhood. They have three children; they are currently in primary school. The family has survived through farming for ten years. Like all Nicaraguan families, they long to improve their living conditions. One of the problems they have faced in fulfilling this dream has been the lack of better agronomic management, which would be good for the crops. That is why she is asking for this loan to buy agricultural materials like fertilizers and supplies that guarantee a quality harvest and rapid sale of this production. In previous years they managed thanks to money from her husband. But, this years sales have decreased, and it is difficult for them to get together enough money for the purchase. This will give them capital in the future to plan and invest in the diversification of new crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and supplies for their fields

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El señor Felix Gonzalez N. es casado y vive en el barrio Loma Guazu de la ciudad de Caacupe.

 El señor Felix es trabajador y tiene dos actividades a que se dedica por una parte tiene su moto taxi y por el otro trabaja como jardinero limpiando  patios baldíos o jardines a quienes soliciten su servicio de jardinería con desmalezadora.

  Solicita el crédito para la compra de una nueva desmalezadora  para poder satisfacer la demanda del mercado y por ende aumentar el ingreso de su unidad familiar.

 Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya el apoyo obtenido para su actividad  y mediante ello su negocio esta creciendo brindando sus servicios a la comunidad.
texts.en:
Felix Gonzalez N. is married and lives in the Loa Guazu neighborhood in the city of Caacupe. Felix is a hard-worker, and he works at two activities. One is his “moto taxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle), and the other is working as a gardener cleaning vacant lots or gardens for those requesting his gardening services with a weed whacker. He is requesting the loan to buy a new weed whacker to be able to satisfy the demand in the market. This will increase the family’s income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a weed whacker

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
El señor José Antonio S. C., tiene 38 años de edad es casado y con su esposa y sus 4 hijos habitan en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla su esposa aporta a los gastos del hogar debido a que es comerciante y él trabaja como transportista desde hace 3 años e inicio su negocio con su esfuerzo propio.

Dentro de los principales planes a futuro de la familia están el mejorar la infraestructura del hogar, para esto solicito un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción y así continuar con las remodelaciones del hogar. Ellos gozan del respeto de la comunidad por ser una familia unida que con sus propios meritos han logrado salir adelante, este préstamo les brindaría la posibilidad de vivir en un lugar más optimo y seguro para todos.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose is 38 years old, is married and with his wife he has four children. He lives in the “Juan Ramon Padilla” neighborhood. His wife helps with the household expenses as a businesswoman. Ramon has worked as a driver for the past three years and has taken the initiative to start his own business. His plans for his family’s future are to improve the structure of his home. He is asking for a loan to buy construction materials in order to continue remodeling his home. His family enjoys the respect of the community. They are a united family that has continued to progress. This loan will allow them the opportunity to live in a better home that is more secure for everyone.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction supplies.

loans.name: Cielo

texts.es:
A la señora Cielo A. tiene poco tiempo que acaba de adquirir su vivienda pero le está haciendo falta algunos detalles.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder elaborar la barda trasera de la casa, para la seguridad de su familia. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio de venta de productos de belleza por catálogo. Ya que los gastos familiares se encargara su esposo el señor Juan José Coazozon quien trabaja como policía de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo.  
La señora Cielo ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntual mente.
texts.en:
Cielo A. just got her house a short while ago, but it is missing some details. She is requesting a loan to be able to build a wall in the back of her house for her family’s safety. She plans to pay the loan with the earnings she gets from her business of selling beauty products by catalog. Her husband, Juan José Coazozon, pays the family expenses. He works as a policeman in the city of Nuevo Laredo. Cielo has had two loans with FVP, which she paid punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a back wall

loans.name: Sda Mayeberie Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers of the S.D.A Primary School, in Magburaka, northern Sierra Leone. This school, established by the Seven Days Adventist Mission in 1983, currently has 114 pupils. 

This is the first loan that S.D.A Primary School is accessing from Kiva through SMT. School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise be unable to accomplish with their mere salaries. Some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy furniture, land or house-building materials; others invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Fifty-four-year-old David C. K. is the headmaster at the school. He was born in Makump village, and is married with 7 children. David wants a loan in order to renovate his house and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: Renovate his house and pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
El Sr. Arnaldo M.  tiene 27 años de edad es soltero y vive con su madre en la ciudad de Carapeguá. 
    	Como proviene de una familia humilde y con ganas de estudiar y ser un profesional decidió emprender un pequeño negocio, empezó vendiendo ropas y calzados por la zona urbana de su ciudad, en poco tiempo logró juntar un poco de capital para empezar a comprar más variedad de artículos y llevar a vender por la capital del país Asunción donde ya tiene una buena clientela formada. 
Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo  pudo comprarse una motocicleta  la cual lo utiliza para realizar sus ventas y mantener la buena clientela.
       Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías (hamacas, frazadas, fajas y sábanas) puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos.
texts.en:
Mr. Arnaldo is 27 years old, is single and lives with his mother in Carapegúa City. Since he comes from a humble family and he wishes to study to become a professional, he decided to start a small business. He began selling clothes and shoes in the center of his city. In a short time he has been able to gather a little bit of capital to use to buy a larger variety of articles. He is now bringing these to sell in the capital city of his country, Asunción. He has a good client base in Asunción. Thanks to his hard work and effort, he has been able to buy a motorcycle. He uses this to help with his business and maintain his client base. He is asking for a loan to buy merchandise (hammocks, blankets, bedspreads and sheets) because he has had a lot of requests for these products.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bedspreads, sheets and hammocks.

loans.name: Verónica Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Verónica del Carmen S. R., vive en el Barrio Benjamín Zeledón es casada y su esposo es ejecutivo de ventas de la Nestlé, el señor le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen un hijo el cual cursa su tercer preescolar. Ella labora como recepcionista en la Alcaldía del municipio de Ticuantepe desde hace 3 años. Dentro de los principales  anhelos de la familia está, el construir su vivienda pero no han tenido los recursos necesarios para iniciar la construcción, todo se le ha dificultado debido a que cuando se caso no esperaba salir embarazada en tan poco tiempo, y a raíz de esto le han surgido gastos que no los tenía planeado.

Actualmente ellos habitan en un cuarto que les brindo su papa y hasta hace poco el mismo, le heredo unas tierras en donde ella planea edificar su hogar, para esto desea solicitar de este préstamo que de un comienzo a la construcción, con el préstamo planea comenzar a comprar los materiales de construcción. Agradecería se le brindara la oportunidad  de iniciar con este sueño que le apoye a la familia a ofrecerle a su hijo un lugar amplio, cómodo y seguro para habitar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Verónica lives in the Benjamín Zeledón neighborhood. She is married and her husband is a sales executive with Nestlé. Her husband helps with the household expenses. They have a son who is in his third year of preschool. For the past three years Verónica has been working as a receptionist for the city of Ticuantepe. One of the main desires she has for her family is to build their own home. Yet they don’t have the resources to start construction. It has been difficult because she didn’t plan on getting pregnant so soon. The consequences of the pregnancy are that they have acquired expenses for which they didn’t plan. Currently they live in a room that her father has let them use. Just recently they inherited land where they hope to build their house. With this loan they plan to begin construction. They will buy construction materials. They are thankful for the opportunity to realize their dreams. They appreciate your support of a family that wants to provide their child with a decent place that is comfortable and secure.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to buy a house.

loans.name: Jazmines De Los Lagos Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado “Jazmines de los lagos” y es conformado por 15 socios, pertenecientes a la población de Los lagos, ubicada en la ciudad de Angol, a una hora y media de Temuco. Ellos se dedican principalmente al comercio de frutas, venta de humitas, papas fritas, ropa, lencería, al trabajo de pintor (de casas, piezas, etc.), confección de vestuario y arreglos de bicicletas.

Viviana es la presidenta de este banco comunal, en la foto se ubica en la última fila a la izquierda y viste polera café. Ella hace confección y composturas de ropa y accesorios del hogar en su casa. Invertirá este préstamo en géneros, hilos, agujas y aceite para su máquina de cocer, para fabricar accesorios para el hogar, como por ejemplo juegos de baño y cortinas. Su sueño es tener un negocio en el centro de la ciudad, y su motivación es pagar sus estudios de trabajo social, que empezará este año. Para Viviana ha sido muy importante trabajar con Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha servido mucho la educación emprendedora que recibe y el trabajo en equipo para su desarrollo personal.

Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile) y posee una serie de balnearios lacustres y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
The “Jazmines de los lagos” (Lake Jasmines) Communal Bank consists of 15 members from the community of Los Lagos, located in the city of Angol, an hour and a half from Temuco. For the most part, the members sell fruit, humita (a type of corn cake), French fries, clothing, linens, but some of them paint (houses, rooms, etc.), make clothes, and repair bicycles. Viviana is president of this communal bank, and in the photo is in the last row to the left, wearing a brown t-shirt. She makes and alters garments and household furnishings. She will use this loan for fabric, thread, needles, and sewing-machine oil, to make furnishings, for example, bathroom sets and curtains. Her dream is to have a business in the center of town, motivated by the wish to cover the cost of studies in social work, which she will begin this year. Viviana has found her work with Fondo Esperanza to be significant, for its business education and team work have benefited her in her personal development. Temuco is the capital of the Araucania region. The city is located 670 km. south of Santiago (Chile’s capital), and offers lake resorts as well as interesting native flora and fauna. It should be mentioned that 50% of the country’s Mapuches (indigenous people) live in this region.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric, needles, thread, sewing-machine oil

loans.name: Olimpia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Olimpia del Carmen B. F., tiene 69 años de edad es soltera y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, todos le apoyan económicamente, ella se dedica al alquiler de una propiedad desde hace 30 años y dentro de los principales problemas que se le han presentado es la falta de capital para la reparación del techo de la vivienda, ella inicio con el alquiler de esta propiedad, gracias a l apoyo de su hijo mayor.

Ella solicita de este préstamo para la compra de láminas de zinc que den un inicio a las remodelaciones de su negocio, esto le aumentara la plusvalía de la casa alquilándola a un mejor precio y brindándole la oportunidad de mejorar sus niveles de vida.
texts.en:
Olimpia del Carmen B. F. is 69 years old. She is single and has three adult children who support her economically. She has been dedicated to renting property for thirty years and among the main problems that she has faced is the lack of capital to repair the roof of her house. She began renting this property, thanks to the support of her eldest son. She is requesting this loan to buy zinc sheets that will start the remodeling of her business. This will expand the value of the house allowing her to rent it for a better price and providing the opportunity to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase zinc sheets.

loans.name: María Leticia

texts.es:
María Leticia C. tiene 37 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijas que estudian, una de ellas tiene problemas de audición vive con su familia en la comunidad de Villa Lobos 1, Villa Nueva municipio de Guatemala.
Su sueño es poder construir su casa, y que sus dos hijas puedan tener un buen nivel de estudios, Doña Leticia tiene una tienda donde  vende productos de consumo diario mexicanos y nacionales, ella vende hace aproximadamente cuatro años, tiene clientes y ella les lleva el producto a las casas, pero la mayoria ya le buscan.
El prestamo lo usará para invertir en más mercaderia. Doña Leticia dice que el invertir el crédito en su negocio le ayudara a obtener mejores ganancias y de esa forma ayudar mas a su familia, porque al comprar el producto por mayor le dan un descuento considerable.
texts.en:
María Leticia C. is 37 years old, is married, and has two school-age daughters, one of which has hearing problems. Leticia lives with her family in the neighborhood of Villa Lobos 1, in the community of Villa Nueva in Guatemala. Leticia's dream is to be able to build her own house, and that her daughters will have a good education. Leticia sells comforters, Mexican products, and gold. She has been in this business for approximately four years and has many clients, some of which she visits at home, though most visit her. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy more products. Leticia says that reinvesting in her business will help her increase her profits, which will in in turn help her family because when she buys wholesale, the discount she obtains is considerable.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying more products

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
El señor Ignacio B. tiene 27 años de edad es soltero y vive con su madre en la ciudad de Carapeguá. 

Desde los 14 años empezó a salir a vender las colchas que su madre fabrica, al cabo de 6 años se independizó, trabajó  por cuenta propia, hoy día  lleva otros artículos de la zona a venderlos por las ciudades de Villa Elisa y Asunción, transportándose en su camioneta que gracias a este trabajo logró comprar además  servirle de un respaldo económico importante a su madre.
                  
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías (hamacas, frazadas y sábanas) puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos.
texts.en:
Mr. Ignacio B. is 27 years old, is single, and lives with his mother in the city of Carapeguá. At 14, he started selling the bed covers his mother makes. After six years, he started working on his own and today, he takes products from his region to sell in the cities of Villa Elisa and Asunción, driving himself in the pick-up truck he's been able to purchase thanks to this job and which serves as a financial back-up for his mother. Ignacio requests a loan to buy hammocks, blankets, and bed sheets, products for which he has received many orders.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying hammocks, bed sheets, bedspreads

loans.name: Inocencio

texts.es:
El Sr. Inocencio Ortíz es de la compañía Calixtro de la ciudad de Carapeguá, el mismo está casado y  es propietario de un establecimiento dedicado a la venta de leche y queso, actividad que realiza en compañía de su esposa e hijos.

 Cuenta con todas las comodidades para el desarrollo de su trabajo y es muy conocido por la zona gracias a la calidad de sus productos. Se acercó a  nuestra entidad para solicitar préstamo para la compra de animales vacunos de manera aumentar su nivel de producción y así satisfacer la demanda que actualmente tiene de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Inocencio Ortíz lives in the village of Calixtro near the city of Carapeguá. He is married and sells milk and cheese out of an establishment that he operates with the help of his wife and children. He has the ability to take his work to the next level, and is well known in the area thanks to the quality of his products. He visited Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya to request a loan to buy cows and in that way increase production and meet his customers' demand.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cows for milk production

loans.name: Johana Vanessa

texts.es:
Johana vanessa M. tiene 28 años de edad es casas tiene 1 hijo de 2 años y vive con su familia en la comunidad de Villa Nueva, su sueño es que su hijo sea un profesional y terminar de pagar su casa, doña Vanessa vende zapatos para dama y también vende productos de consumo diario  mexicanos y nacionales, hace aproximadamente 3 años inicio vendidendo a personas que ella conocía y poco a poco fue incrementando sus clientes y sus ganancias y ahora solicita un prestamos para poder invertirlo en zapatos ya que tiene muchos pedidos y la mercadería quqe tiene no le alcanza para poder proveer a sus clientes.
Doña Vanessa cree que este prestamo le ayudara en su vida personal y en su negocio ya que obtendrá mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Johana Vanessa M. is 28 years old, has a 2-year-old son, and lives with her family in the community of Villa Nueva. Her dream is for her child to become a professional, and for her to finish paying off her home. Vanessa has been selling women's shoes for approximately three years. She started selling shoes to people she knew, and slowly increased the number of customers and her profit. She is requesting a loan to buy shoes, as she has many outstanding orders and her current stock is too low to fulfill them. Vanessa believes this loan will help her personal as well as her professional life because her income will increase.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies

loans.name: Jorgelino

texts.es:
El Señor Jorge Lino A. es de la ciudad de Quiindy (districto de Carapegua), el mismo es propietario de un comercio dedicado a la reparación de heladeras, congeladores, instalaciones de acondicionadores de aire, brindando su servicio en dicha ciudad hace varios años con clientela formada. 

Accedió a un crédito con nuestra entidad que lo empleo para compra de herramientas  más sofisticadas con el fin de mejorar la calidad de su servicio.
texts.en:
Mr. Jorge Lino A. is from the city of Quiindy (Carapegua District), and has his own business repairing refrigerators and freezers, and installing air conditioning units. He has been providing service to the city for many years, and has a well developed clientele. He requested a loan from Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya to buy better tools and provide better quality of service.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying tools

loans.name: Los Dinamicos De San Isidro De Chicon Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal LOS DINAMICOS DE SAN ISIDRO DE CHICON está formado por 18 socios que son trabajadores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, las socias viven en la comunidad de San Isidro de Chicon de la ciudad de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco, urbe que se caracteriza por sus paisajes hermosos, su agricultura y su ganadería. La cuidad San Isidro de Chicon se encuentra ubicado a 10 minutos de la Ciudad de Urubamba. 

Francisca es socia del banco comunal los Dinámicos de San Isidro de Chicon, tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijas que depende todavía de ella (Elvis y Ofelia). Francisca se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, chanchos y patos, ella es una mujer emprendedora pues desde que recibió la capacitación de crianza de animales por parte de la municipalidad comenzó su negocio. Ya es un año que la socia pertenece al banco comunal y el crédito que reciba es para comprar mas cuyes y alimento para los animales.

Los otros socios se dedican a la crianza de animales menores, venta de comestibles, agricultura, venta de productos secos, construcción de casas y Raúl hacen servicios de transporte urbano.       

Los socios están preocupados por que las ventas han disminuido debido a que los compradores trabajaban directamente con el turismo. Las fuertes lluvias que cayeron por tres días en la ciudad del Cusco hicieron que turistas cancelaron sus reservaciones de viaja a la ciudad del Cusco. El turismo ha decaído considerablemente.  

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The “LOS DINAMICOS DE SAN ISIDRO DE CHICON” Community Bank is comprised of 18 members. They are workers that are looking every moment for a way to progress. With their daily efforts they hope to achieve a better future for their children. The members live in the San Isidro de Chicon Community near the city of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco. This area is known for its beautiful countryside, its agriculture and its ranches. The city of San Isidro de Chicon is located ten minutes from the city of Urubamba. Francisca is a member of the LOS DINAMICOS DE SAN ISIDRO DE CHICON Community Bank. She is 42 years old, is married and has two children (Elvis and Ofelia) that still depend on her for support. Francisca raises small animals such as guinea pigs, pigs and ducks. She is an enterprising woman. Since she has obtained her permit from the city to raise animals she has begun this business. This woman has been a member of the Community Bank for the past year. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more guinea pigs and for animal food. The other members also raise young animals or they sell groceries, work in agriculture, sell dry goods or build houses. Raul works as a driver in the city. The members are worried because sales are down because their buyers work directly in the tourist industry. The heavy rains that fell for three days in the city of Cusco caused tourists to cancel their reservations for trips to Cusco. Tourism has fallen quite a bit. The members are thankful for the opportunity that is available and promise to pay their individual payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Sandra Yanira

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Méndez tiene 45 años de edad es casada tiene 2 hijas una de 18 y la otra de 21, ellas ya terminaron sus estudios y veven con su familia.
La comunidad en la que vive es muy tranquila es urbana y esta ubicada en San Miguel Petapa. 
Su sueño es poder modificar su casa y alquilar dos locales para poder generar más ingresos.
Doña Sandra vende mercadería mexicana, abarrotes, cubrecamas y edredones. Ella inicio su negocio hace 6 años en la comunidad de Villa Nueva y ahora solicita este crédito para invertir en abarrotes y edredones los cuales comprará en Mexico.
Doña Sandra esta segura que otendrà considerables ganancias, ya que actualemente trabaja con capital propio, pero necesita mas para crecer, ya que ese es su sueño.
texts.en:
Sandra Méndez is 45 years old. She is married and has two daughters who are 18 and 21 years old. They have already finished their schooling and live with her family. The community in which they live is very peaceful, urban and is located in San Miguel Petapa. Her dream is to be able to remodel her house and rent two shop locations in order to be able to generate more income. Sandra sells Mexican merchandise, groceries, bedspreads and comforters. She began her business six years ago in the community of Villa Nueva and now is requesting this loan to invest in groceries and comforters which she will buy in Mexico.
