Sandra is sure that she will obtain considerable earnings since currently she works with her own money but needs more to grow as this is her dream.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Concepción

texts.es:
La Srta. Mariela Baéz es de la ciudad de Roque Gonzalez, soltera estudiante universitaria, está cursando el 6to.curso de la Carrera de Derecho en la Universidad  Nacional, es huérfana de padre, actualmente vive con su madre.

   Mariela manifiesta que desde muy joven empezó a trabajar ya que su madre tuvo que solventar sus gastos y la de sus hermanas, se dedicó a la actividad de vendedora ambulante realizando inicialmente en su ciudad de Carapegua, luego empezó a viajar con su  madre en la cuidad de Lambaré y actualmente ya cuenta con clientela formada en ambas ciudades con gran cantidad de pedidos lo que la llevó a la necesidad de contar con más capital.

  Solicitó el préstamo con nuestra entidad  para la compra de artículos de mercería.
texts.en:
Miss Mariela Baéz is from the city of Roque Gonzalez. She is single and a university student. She is in the sixth semester in Law School at the National University. She lost her father, and lives with her mother. Mariela developed very young when she began to work, since her mother had to take care of the expenses for her and her sisters. She worked as a street vendor starting first in her city, Carapegua. She then began to travel with her mother to another city, Lambaré, and she now has customers in both cities with many orders. Thus she needs to have more capital. She requested a loan from our agency to buy articles of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dresses, t-shirts, shirts, skirts, blouses, shoes, sneakers and more

loans.name: Asunción

texts.es:
El Sr. Asunción Servin es oriundo de la ciudad de Quiindy,  y actualmente vive en la ciudad de Carapegua tiene 61 años de edad, casado con dos hijos mayores de edad ya profesionales.
Empezó con el servicio de taxi a los 25 años como empleado de una de las paradas de taxi de la ciudad de Carapegua, con el transcurso de los años logró juntar un poco de capital para comprar su propio vehículo y poder  trabajar en forma independiente. Cabe destacar que su señora se dedica a la comercialización de leche y queso, que gracias a esto significa un ingreso más para el hogar. 
Solicita el préstamo para pago de chapería y pintura de su vehículo.
texts.en:
Asunción is a native of the city of Quiindy, and currently lives in the city of Carapegua. He is 61 years old, married, with two adult children who are professionals.

He began in the taxi service 25 years ago as an employee of one of the taxi stands in the city of Carapegua. Over the years, he managed to raise a little capital to buy his own vehicle and to be able to work for himself. Note that his wife sells milk and cheese, and thanks to this they have some extra income for their home.

He requests this loan to pay for bodywork and painting of his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reconditioning of vehicle (bodywork and painting)

loans.name: The Womens Bank To Build The Future Group

texts.en:
This group’s name translates as “The Womens Bank to Build the Future”. The group members live in Sarapiqui, Heredia, a rural region close to the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica. The group members will use this loan for general investments in productive activities such as the rearing and selling of chickens and the purchase and sale of colognes and perfumes.

Christina A. V. is the president of this group. She is always busy and engages in many economically productive activities such as curtain sewing, nail painting, selling retail products and poultry. This loan will be used for the purchase of chicks as well as feed for the rearing and sale of her poultry.

Christina aspires to open a store one day where she can offer a range of services and products to her clients. She says her only obstacle is financial and that she works with her husband as a team: when Christina needs to work, her husband watches their daughter and vice versa (he is a taxi driver and farmer).

Dinia Gisselle G. G. is a 33-year-old mother who lives with her family in Sarapiqui. She has a business selling men’s and women’s colognes and perfumes in her community. She started her business with an initial investment of 100,000 colons. Her husband´s work requires him to travel to Panama roughly every fifteen days. In Panama the prices for quality perfume and cologne products is much less than in Sarapiqui. For example, a name brand perfume that sells for 12,000 colons in Panama sells for 22,000 colons in Sarapiqui.

Dinia has been selling perfumes and colognes for five years. She spends her days traveling to homes and restaurants in Sarapiqui, offering products to potential clients. She collects orders from her clients which she passes on to her husband who makes the necessary purchases when he arrives in Panama. Dinia says her business is growing; she wants to expand operations as the income she earns contributes significantly to her family’s standard of living.

Dinia knows that she faces much competition in her community; there are many women selling similar products. As a result, she strives to provide superior service to her clients by bringing them all the products they request.

Sometimes, Dinia’s clients have trouble paying for an item in full. In these cases Dinia organizes flexible payment schedules to suit the needs of her client. She hopes to one day open a store where she could sell not only perfumes and colognes, but clothing and cosmetics as well.

Dinia hopes that “The Womens Bank to Build the Future” will expand and acquire more members from the community.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Valentina Del Carmen

texts.es: Valentina de 35 años es casada, tiene 2 niños que estudian la primaria, labora para el MINED en la Escuela Especial desde hace 15 años como maestra, donde atienden a niños con discapacidad y dificultad de aprendisaje.  Esta solicitando su 6to credito con el proposito de poder reparar el sistema electrico de su casa que se encuentra en mal estado, ademas desea poder instalar el agua potable dentro de su casa, pues actualmente tienen un puesto de agua donde llegan los vecinos cercanos a su casa que carecen de este servicio a abastecerse y cuando llega la gente en busca de agua ella se limita a hacer los quehaceres de su casa.  Refiere que si le da el dinero tratara de pintar el frente de su casa ya que la pintura que tiene se esta deteriorando.  El mayor sueño de Valentina es poder ver su casa bonita, y mejorandola poco a poco pues es la herencia que dejara a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Valentina is 35 years old, is married and has two children who are in elementary school. She has worked for MINED in the Special School for fifteen years as a teacher where she attends to children with disabilities and learning difficulties. She is requesting her sixth loan with the goal of being able to repair the electrical system in her house, which is in disrepair. Additionailly, she wishes to be able to install potable water inside her house as currently she has a water post where nearby neighbors who don't have water service come to get it and when people arrive in search of water she neglects her house chores. If she is given the money, she will try to paint the front of her house since the existing paint is deteriorating. Valentina's greatest dream is to be able to see her beautiful house and to improve it gradually since it is her children's inheritance.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the electrical system and potable water.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: Luis Manuel de 56 años de edad es casado, tiene 3 hijos mayores de su primer matrimonio Luisania de 38 años, Dolores de 28 y Luis de 25, todos trabajan y tienen  su familia formada.  Don Luis trabaja para el MINED en Tecolostote como maestro  desde hace 20 años.  Esta solicitando su 8vo credito a AFODENIC con el objetivo de poder reparar las paredes del cuarto de su casa que se encuentran en mal estado, y espera lograrlo con el apoyo de kiva.  El mayor sueño del profesor Luis Manuel es poder mejorar su casa poco a poco para vivir comodo cuando se jubile.
texts.en:
Luis Manuel is 56 years old, is married and has three adult children from his first marriage: Luisania who is 38 years old, Dolores who is 28 and Luis who is 25. All of them work and have their own families. Luis has worked for MINED in Tecolostote as a teacher for 20 years. He is requesting his eighth loan from AFODENIC with the goal of being able to repair the walls of the room of his house which is in disrepair and he hopes to achieve it with the support of Kiva. The greatest dream of professor Luis Manuel is to be able to improve his house gradually to live comfortably when he retires.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair walls.

loans.name: The Women's Bank To Build The Future (2) Group

texts.en:
This group’s name translates as “The Women’s Bank to Build the Future (2)”. The group members are sisters who live in Sarapiqui, Heredia, a rural region close to the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica. The women members will use this loan for general investments in productive activities such as the purchase and sale of catalogue items. 

Alis is a 24-year-old mother of two. When she is not working on housework and child care, she sells various products in her community. Two days a week she travels door to door, offering potential clients the opportunity to peruse a catalogue filled with a variety of products from car parts to underwear. After collecting orders, she goes to a distributor meeting for her specific catalogue company and purchases the items. Upon delivery, she is paid for her services.

This loan will be used by Alis to finance the purchase of catalogue items for resale. She says her kitchen products are the most popular. She would like to expand her business and find more clients. She has been involved in this business for about a year.

M. is a 22-year-old mother. She is involved in the same activity as her sister, Alis, only with a different catalogue company. M. will use this loan for the purchase of products to sell in her community and to finance travel expenses. A difference between M.’s business and that of her sister is that M. must travel to San Jose, the capital of Costa Rica, in order to purchase her products, about a two-hour journey each way by bus.

loans.use: To finance the purchase of catalogue items for resale

loans.name: Miurel Karina

texts.es: Miurel Karina de 21 años de edad es soltera, habita en casa de sus padres junto a sus hermanas, labora en el Hospital Asuncion desde hace 2 años como despachadora de farmacia.  Esta solicitando su primer credito a AFODENIC con el objetivo de terminar la construccion del porche de su casa, pues le faltan las verjas y el embaldozado.  Espera poder ser beneficiada con el fondo Kiva para terminar de acondicionar su casa, pues desea apoyar en lo que mas pueda a su familia.  El mayor sueño de Miurel es ir mejorando poco a poco su casa para vivir junto a su familia con las condiciones basicas que todo ser humano se merece.
texts.en:
Miurel Karina, 21, is single, living with her sisters in their parents' home. She has worked in Asuncion Hospital for 2 years as a pharmacy expediter. She is requesting her first loan through AFODENIC with the goal of completing the construction of the porch on her house, currently lacking railings and floor tiling. She hopes for the support of Kiva in order to fix up her house so she can live with her family in the basic condition deserved by any human being.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Complete porch contruction

loans.name: Bruno

texts.es: El Sr. Bruno C. es de la compañia Potrero de la ciudad de Carapeguá, el mismo se dedica a la producción y venta de productos artesanales siendo los artículos que produce sobrecamas y hamacas actividad que desarrolla en forma conjunta con su familia ya que recibe la cooperación de su esposa e hijos. Accedió a un crédito con nuestra entidad que lo utilizó para la compra de materia prima, especificamente hilo y telas  a modo de contar con mayor cantidad de mercaderías que pueda comercializar teniendo en cuenta que tenia o tiene varios pedidos que cubrir.
texts.en:
Señor Bruno C. is with the Potrero company in the city of Carapeguá, producing and selling handicrafts such as bedspreads and hammocks. The whole family enters into this activity, including his wife and children. He has been granted a loan through our organization to buy raw materials, specifically thread and fabrics so he would have a larger quantity of merchandise to sell, as he has several orders to fill.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Rito

texts.es: El señor Rito S. , es casado, desde temprana edad se ha dedicado a la actividad pecuaria y agricola siendo su principal fuente de ingreso, habita en el municipio de Nueva Guinea en la colonia Kurinwas junto a su familia la integran su conyuge y 4 hijos mayores los que apoyan el los quehaseres del hogar yde la finca, necesita financiamiento de su 4to credito para invertirlo en la retencion de terneros, por que no alcanzan el tamaño y peso para la comercializacion, con este credito dejara  que sus animales crezcan y asi obtener resultados que ayuden a solventar necesidades economicas del nucleo familiar,  se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy progresivo y trabajador, honesto y en su comunidad lo consideran como un gran lider.
texts.en:
Señor Rito S. is married; livestock and agriculture have provided his main income since he was young. He lives in the town of Nueva Guinea in the Kurinwas neighborhood with his family composed of his spouse and 4 grown children who help him with household and farm chores. He needs his fourth loan to keep his calves because they have not yet gained the size and weight necessary to be profitable. With this loan he can allow his animals to grow more and thus achieve the results that will help take care of the economic necessities of the nuclear family. He describes himself as a very progressive, hard-working, honest man, and he is looked to as a leader in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raise calves

loans.name: The Women’S Bank Of Hope (1) Group

texts.en:
This group’s name translates as “The Women’s Bank of Hope”. The group members live in Sarapiqui, Heredia, a rural region located near the humid Caribbean coast of Costa Rica. This loan will be used for general investments necessary to the growth of the members’ poultry businesses. Specifically, this loan will be used for the purchase of livestock and feed.

Juana Jesús C. L. is the treasurer of this group and is a 50-year-old mother of two. She has completed high school and some technical courses.

Juana is in the business of rearing and selling chickens and their eggs. She started her business with an initial investment of 100,000 colons. She focuses her energy on bringing her clients a high quality poultry product coupled with exceptional service because she knows this is what they value. Juana would like to secure more customers and keep the loyalty of her existing ones. She expects her group to display sincerity and responsibility as central values.

Juana has recently purchased two piglets. She intends to use this loan to purchase livestock and to maintain the good health of all her animals by ensuring regular weight and protecting them from parasites. She says the best way to accomplish this is by giving the animals proper vitamins and plenty of water.

Carmen D. B. is a 37-year-old mother of three. Her highest level of formal education attained is the completion of primary school.

Carmen has a business rearing and selling chickens which she sells from door to door in her community. She plans to use this loan to invest in the purchase of chicks and poultry feed. She says she ¨likes to stay busy, no time to rest.¨ She hopes to use this loan to increase her earnings and improve her standard of living.

A main obstacle for Carmen is transportation. The area in which she lives is very rural. It is one of the only regions in Costa Rica without electricity or running water. Buses do not pass by her house and the road leading to her door is too muddy for cars to drive on.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock and feed

loans.name: Claudia Guissel

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, específicamente en el mercado El Bisne, la señora Claudia T. se dedica con gran esfuerzo a su actividad de venta de alimentos siendo preparados por ella misma con el fin de ofertarlos para así obtener sus ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
Ella está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materia prima como lo es el aceite, arroz, frijoles, plátanos, entre otros. Con este crédito ella continuará elaborando los deliciosos platillos para su respectiva venta.
texts.en:
In the Chinandega department, in the El Bisne market, Señora Claudia T. works hard selling food that is always prepared by herself personally, in order to earn money to maintain her home. She is requesting this loan to purchase raw materials such as oil, rice, beans, and bananas among other things. With this loan she will continue to create her delicious dishes for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for food preparation

loans.name: Liberia Silvia

texts.es: La señora Liberia B. se ha dedicado desde hace 30 largos años a la actividad de pulpería atendiéndola ella misma y con el deseo de crecer en el negocio cada día más. Está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los productos para la pulpería. Ella comprará los productos comestibles como pan, galletas, golosinas y también productos como papel higiénico y otros. Espera que dicho crédito sea otorgado para continuar en su actividad de pulpería.
texts.en:
Señora Liberia B. has worked in her grocery shop for 30 long years, staffing it herself with the goal of increasing her business every day. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of stock for the shop. She will buy edibles such as bread, cookies, and sweets, and also products such as toilet paper. She hopes that this loan will be granted so she can maintain her grocery shop.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grocery stock

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
La Sra Diana R. vive en la compañía Itapé de la ciudad de Carapeguá, desde muy joven se dedicó al oficio de tejer artículos de sobrecamas de hilo,  este oficio lo aprendió de su madre que también se didica a lo mismo, de los ingresos que obtuvo pudo estudiar como así también ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Hoy día gracias a la gran demanda que recibe de sus vendedores vió la necesidad de contar con más capital para comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima por lo que se acercó hasta la Fundación Paraguaya para solicitar un préstamo que le ayudara a  solventar la necesidad que su negocio prescindía.
Solicitó el préstamo para la compra de hilo y color.
texts.en:
Diana R. lives in the Itapé community in the city of Carapeguá. She has been weaving bedspreads since she was very young. She learned this craft from her mother who also does this. From the income she received, she was able to go to school and also help with the household expenses. Now, thanks to the great demand she gets from her sellers, she sees the need to have more capital to buy a greater quantity of raw material. That is why she has come to the Paraguaya Foundation to request a loan. The loan will help her meet the needs of her business. She asked for the loan to buy thread and dye.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy thread and dye

loans.name: María Benita

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, la señora María Benita T. se ha dedicado a su actividad de venta de lácteos tales como leche, cuajada y crema ofrecida a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana donde son colocadas en un balde para exhibición a las personas.
Ella atraviesa una necesidad y es la que no posee los lácteos por lo que debe de adquirirlos lo más pronto posible para comercializarlos y así llevar a cabo el mantenimiento de su hogar. Es este el motivo por el cual solicita un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar el queso, la cuajada y crema.
texts.en:
In the department of Chinandega, Mrs. María Benita T. has been selling dairy products such as milk, milk curds, and cream. Every morning very early, she places her products in buckets for people to see. She does not have raw materials at the moment, so she needs to purchase them as soon as possible to continue selling her products and in that way support her family. This is why she is requesting a loan - to buy the raw materials (milk) in order to make cheese, cream, and milk curds.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying milk to make dairy products

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia P. B. is a 43-year-old mother of seven who lives in Sarpiqui, Heredia, a region located near the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica. She is part of a larger group of women called ¨The Women’s Bank of Hope¨ (Banco Mujer La Esperanza). Lidia had her youngest child when she was 14; her highest level of formal education attained is the completion of primary school. Lidia loves to cook and has completed courses in bread making, cooking, nutrition and other courses at the ¨National Institute for Learning¨.

This loan will be the first for Lidia from Fundacion Mujer. She will use the money to invest in her clothes-selling business. During the week, Lidia takes orders for various types of clothes (men’s, women’s, children’s) from members of her community. Sometimes she travels to the nearby banana plantation to collect orders from the plantation workers. She travels twice per month to San Jose, the capital of Costa Rica (two hours by bus), to purchase clothing to satisfy her list of orders. This loan will be used to fund the purchase of such clothing.

Lidia is a busy entrepreneur. Though this loan will be used specifically to develop her clothes-selling project, she has many others including bread making, animal rearing and sewing and has been working hard for the past five years. Life has been made difficult as a result of a hand injury she suffered a few years ago: she has trouble lifting objects with her left hand.

Lidia would like to earn enough from her productive activities in order to be able to invest in animal rearing. Specifically, she would like to rear and sell pigs and chickens.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.en:
Blanca Rosa S. C. is a 30-year-old mother of three from Sarapiqui, Heredia, located close to the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica. She has completed high school and taken some technical courses. Blanca is part of a group of women with the name Banco Mujer La Esperanza, which translates as “The Women’s Bank of Hope”.

Blanca is in the business of rearing and selling pigs and will use this loan to invest in the purchase of piglets and pig feed. As a result of the amount of time it will take in order for her pigs to grow to a profitable size, Blanca will not be required to make repayments right away.

The land Blanca and her family live on was allocated to them by the Costa Rican government’s Instituto de Desarollo Agrario which translates as “The Institute of Agrarian Development (IDA)”. Through IDA, the poorest citizens of the country were given land to live on and use for subsistence purposes such as farming and animal rearing. Many IDA land recipients have faced challenges in being able to effectively use their land due to a lack of agricultural knowledge and a lack of start up capital. Fundacion Mujer acts as an extension of the IDA program by providing much needed loans as startup capital for investment in various productive farm activities.

Blanca is conscious of her clients’ demands for a quality pork product and strives to satisfy those demands. She hopes to be able to purchase three piglets with this loan and animal feed.

In terms of sales, Blanca has two options: once the pigs are full grown, she might choose to butcher them and sell the individual parts (her husband does the butchering); or she can sell the pigs whole. Although Blanca can earn more by selling the pigs in parts, it is obviously much more labour intensive.

Blanca hopes to use this loan to expand her business, purchase more piglets and find more clients. She says her only obstacle is start up capital.

loans.use: To purchase three piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
María de los Ángeles T. es una dama muy trabajadora que se desempeña en la elaboración de alimentos como lo son los nacatamales, una de las comidas típicas en Nicaragua. Ella prepara dichos nacatamales todos los fines de semana y son varios los clientes que le compran el alimento ya que ella es muy excelente cocinera en el departamento de Chinandega.
Está solicitando un crédito para la compra de la carne de cerdo, leña, maíz, y demás ingredientes para los nacatamales. Espera que dicho crédito sea otorgado y de esta manera suplir las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles T. is a hard-working woman who prepares food, like nacatamales (typical Nicaraguan tamales wrapped in banana leaves). She prepares the nacatamales every weekend and several customers buy from her because she's an excellent cook in Chinandega department. She is asking for funding to buy pork, firewood, corn and other nacatamal ingredients. She hopes the loan will be approved so that she can meet her household's needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pork, firewood, corn and other ingredients.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria Teresa C. L. is a 38-year-old mother of five from Sarapiqui, Heredia, located near the Caribbean region of Costa Rica. Her highest level of formal education attained is the completion of primary school. Maria is a member of a group of women with the name Banco Mujer La Esperanza, which translates as “The Women’s Bank of Hope”. 

Maria’s entrepreneurial idea is the rearing and selling of pigs. She will use this loan to start her business by investing in animal feed and piglets and to make general investments conducive to maintaining the good health of her animals.

The land Maria and her family live on was allocated to them by the Costa Rican government’s Instituto de Desarollo Agrario which translates as “The Institute of Agrarian Development (IDA)”. Through the IDA, the poorest citizens of the country were given land to live on and use for subsistence purposes such as farming and animal rearing. Many IDA land recipients have faced challenges in being able to effectively use their land due to a lack of agricultural knowledge and a lack of startup capital. Fundacion Mujer acts as an extension of the IDA program by providing much needed loans as startup capital for investment in various productive activities.

As a result of the amount of time it will take in order for the pigs to grow to a profitable value, Maria will be not be required to make immediate repayments. This means she will only repay once, at the end of the loan term.

The values Maria expects to be displayed by the group are responsibility and punctuality. She hopes to expand her business in an effort to earn more income and provide a better standard of living for her children. Specifically, she would like to be able to finance their studies.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Muy comprometida con el bienestar de su vivienda e hijos, la señora María M. se dedica a trabajar en un centro de labores en el departamento de Chinandega, con el fin de llevar el sustento a su vivienda que hoy en día ha iniciado a reconstruirla para mayor seguridad de sus dos hijos.
Está solicitando un crédito para la compra de zinc, cemento, clavos, alfajillas y ladrillos con el propósito de utilizarlos para la reconstrucción de su vivienda que es el sueño que ella tiene y al hacerlo realidad beneficiará a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Committed to the wellbeing of her children and the security of her home, Mrs. María M. works at a labor center in the department of Chinandega, so that she can support her family and rebuild her home to make it safe for her two children. She requests a loan to buy zinc, cement, nails, wooden beams, and bricks to use in the construction of her house, which is one of her dreams. In making it a reality, she will benefit her children.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying building materials

loans.name: Maria Lourde

texts.es:
María P. se ha destacado como una dama muy trabajadora que desde hace diez años se ha destacado en la actividad de venta de reposterías las que las ofrece ambulantemente y dichas reposterías son puestas en una pana que ella carga a diario con el propósito de vender y así ganarse el pan de cada día.
Cada mañana cuando ella sale a vender va con la esperanza de tener un día exitoso, la razón por la que está solicitando el crédito es para invertirlo en la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de las reposterías y una vez realizadas ofrecerlas en su localidad.
texts.en:
María P. is noteworthy for being very hard-working; for the last 10 years she has sold pastries from a basket that she carries around daily to earn her daily sustenance. Every morning, when she goes out to sell, she hopes to have a successful day. The reason for the loan request is that she needs to buy the raw ingredients for her pasteris so that, once they are made, she can offer them for sale in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pastry raw ingredients.

loans.name: Marling Leonor

texts.es:
Marling L. es una dama muy trabajadora que ha sbido llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación compuesta por sus dos pequeños hijos en edad escolar a los que debe de brindarle las condiciones de vida necesarias para que ellos se desarrollen.
Ella está solicitando el crédito para invertir en el estudio de sus hijos, ella invertirá el dinero en el pago de la matricula del colegio y en la compra de utensilios escolares como lo son cuadernos, mochilas, lápices, entre otros. 
Al recibir el crédito, se contribuye con el mejoramiento del nivel de vida de sus pequeños y así algún día llegaran a ser grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Marling L. is a hardworking woman who has been able to provide for her family, which includes her two small, school-age children, for whom she must provide adequate conditions for their development. She is requesting a loan to invest in her children's education. She will use the loan proceeds to pay for school tuition and to buy school supplies such as notebooks, backpacks, pencils, among others. Receiving this loan means she will give a better life to her little ones and one day, they will become great professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying school supplies and paying tuition for her children

loans.name: Orlando Alberto

texts.es: Orlando Alberto es casado con la Sra. Karla Rodriguez con quien aun no tiene hijos, labora como auxiliar de contabilidad , habita junto a sus padres en la ciudad de Juigalpa de quienes esta muy pendiente y apoya con los gastos del hogar, esta solicitando su 2do credito a AFODENIC con el proposito de mejorar su casa cambiando el techo que se encuentra en mal estado, al mismo tiempo desea construir su cuarto para tener mayor privacidad, pues cuando llegue el momento de formar su familia podra brindarle las condiciones basicas y espera contar con el apoyo de kiva para lograr este objetivo.    Orlando se caracteriza por ser muy trabajador, responsable y honesto, es muy querido por sus compañeros de trabajo.
texts.en:
Orlando Alberto, who's employed as an accountant's assistant, is married to Karla Rodriguez; they don't have any children yet. He lives with his parents in Juigalpa. He cares for them and contributes to household expenses. He is requesting his second loan from AFODENIC to do some home repair, specifically replace the roof that's in poor state. He also wants to finish building a bedroom for more privacy so that, when the moment comes to form a family, he will be able to provide basic conditions for them. He hopes to have Kiva's support to reach this goal. Orlando is very hard-working, responsible and honest; he is held in high regard by his coworkers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To replace the roof and build a bedroom.

loans.name: Salomon De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
El señor Salomón O. se ha destacado por ser un padre ejemplar para sus hijos puesto que ha llevado el sustento y tiene mucha inclinación por el trabajo. Él ha iniciado a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda en Chinandega y para ello está solicitando el crédito con la finalidad de invertirlo en la compra de algunos materiales de construcción para mejorar dichas condiciones de la vivienda y también para suplir las necesidades de su hogar.
El señor Salomón espera ser beneficiado con el crédito para así continuar velando por el bienestar de su familia que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Salomón O. has distinguished himself for being an exemplary father to his children in that he has provided for them daily and is very dedicated to work. He has begun to make improvements to his home in Chinandega and is asking for funding to buy building materials and supplies to improve the conditions of his dwelling as well as to meet his household expenses. Salomón expects to have the loan granted so that he can continue to see to his beloved family's wellbeing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Walter Rolando

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, el señor Walter F. se destaca como una persona muy trabajador que ha sabido velar por el bienestar de su hogar compuesto por sus hijos y su cónyuge. El señor Walter ha iniciado la mejora de su vivienda porque había estado en malas condiciones y al haber iniciado dicha mejora está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los materiales de construcción tales como 20 hojas de zinc, 10 libras de clavos, 12alfajillas y 10clavadores.

Espera que el crédito le sea otorgado de manera rápida para realizar dicha obra y así continuar mejorando las condiciones de vida de su amada familia.
texts.en:
In Chinandega department, Walter F. is noted for being a very hard-working person who has seen to the wellbeing of his family, composed of his wife and children. Walter has begun to do some home improvements because his dwelling had been in poor condition. Having started this project, he asked for funding to buy building materials like: 20 sheets of zinc metal, 10 pounds of nails, 12 window or door frames, 10 nail drivers. He hopes the loan will be granted quickly so that he can do this project and continue improving his beloved family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Maria Vidal

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Vidal I. tiene 65 años de edad, vive en el barrio las Brisas de la ciudad de Nacaome, Maria se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia en la cual vende papel higienico, jabones, churros, venenos para zancudos, cloro, desinfectante de pisos etc.
en estos momentos la sra. Maria necesita el credito para surtir mas su negocio que es su unica fuente de ingresos. Maria es una mujer de edad y esta es la unica actividad que puede realizar para ganarse la vida.
texts.en:
Maria Vidal I., 65, lives in the Las Brisas neighborhood of Nacome. She sells popular consumption items in a small grocery store. She stocks toilet paper, soap, mosquito poison, chlorine bleach, floor disinfectant, etc. Maria needs funding to stock her store, which is her only source of income. Maria is a senior citizen and this is the only kind work that she is able to do to support herself.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soaps, beans, rice, sugar, tortillas, toilet paper and mosquito poison.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carminda

texts.es:
la señora Carminda García R. tiene 45 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos hijas que estan estudiando, cuando las ventas son muy buenas sus hijas le ayudan a la atencion de sus clientes.
Carminda se dedica a la venta de ropa, calzado, utiles escolares y ventiladores. tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad. su negocio lo abre de lunes a domingo.
esta solicitando el credito para surtir de calzado para la epoca escolar.
 
su mayor deseo es comprarse una casa porque donde vive renta desde hace 5 años.
texts.en:
Carminda García R. is 45 years old and single with two daughters in school. When business is good, her daughters help her serve her clients. Carminda sells clothing, footwear, school supplies, and fans. She has several years' experience in this area, and her business is open every day of the week. She is requesting the loan to stock footwear for the school year. Her dream is to buy her own home, since she has been renting for five years.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase shoes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Carapeguá  en la Compañía Espartillar distante a 7 km de la oficina de Carapeguá unas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa . 

Estas Señoras son activas muy trabajadoras y se dedican a las  actividades de tejido de artesanía como sobrecamas, fundas para almohadas, sobre mesas entre otros.Ellas buscando un poco mas de apoyo para fomentar a través del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida .

Necesitan de esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual.
Todas de dedican a la actividad del tejido:

texts.en:
A group of low-income women, who reside in Compañía Espartillar, Carapeguá, which is 7km away from the office in Carapeguá, heard about Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras’ program and decided to unite to get some information about the program. These women are active and very hard-working. They are weavers who make, among other items, bedspreads, pillow cases and tablecloths. They seek, through loans, to provide a bit more support for their households and to improve their quality of life. They require this credit transaction to invest in their various lines of work so that they can reach a level of growth that is sustainable and will help them grow both individually and as a group. They are all weavers: 1 Natividad O. WEAVER 2 Eva S. WEAVER 3 Ma- Calendaria P. WEAVER 4 Cecilia S. WEAVER 5 Leonora L. WEAVER 6 Ramona G. WEAVER 7 WEAVER 8 Cristina A. WEAVER 9 Luisa G. WEAVER 10 Benicia G. WEAVER 11 Catalina B. WEAVER 12 Matea C. WEAVER 13 WEAVER 14 Lucia S. WEAVER 15 Venancia G. WEAVER 16 Nilsa Guzmán WEAVER 17 Insolina F. WEAVER 18 Lilian Ramírez WEAVER 19 Tomasa S. WEAVER 20 María-Evangelista Espinoza WEAVER 21 Sara B. WEAVER

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various colored threads and fabric.

loans.name: Faustina Eva

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Faustina C. se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa la que es comercializada por ella misma todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

Ella atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en su negocio y para ello está solicitando un crédito que le permita la compra de la ropa tales como blusas, pañuelos, medias, camisas, calcetines, entre otros. 
Con dicho crédito se beneficiará grandemente porque mejorará las condiciones del negocio que tanto le ha costado surtir.
texts.en:
Faustina C. is a clothing merchant in León department; she sells daily from very early in the morning. She needs to invest in her business, so is asking for a loan that will allow her to buy clothing like: blouses, handkerchiefs, stockings, shirts, socks, etc. The loan will be of great benefit to her because it will improve the conditions of her business that has been so difficult to stock.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Gaby

texts.es:
Gaby C. H. es una mujer que lucha día a día por salir adelante, a sus 50 años es viuda y tiene 4 hijos, dos de ellos son independientes y los otros dos de 25 y 26 años están a su cargo, se dedica al servicio de alquiler de cabinas de internet, desde hace 10 años además alquila equipos de sonido desde hace 20 años y hace 2 meses, ha implementado un locutorio telefónico con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria.
Gaby ha podido comprar maquinas de mejor calidad (pc’s) y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos quienes estudian en la universidad. El gran sueño de Gaby, es comprarse una casa, ya que la vivienda en la cual  reside es alquilada.
El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido en recargas de línea para sus equipos del locutorio y un regalo de matrimonio para su hija. Gaby se encuentra muy agradecida por todo el apoyo brindado, porque le ha ayudado  a mejorar su calidad de vida y el de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gaby C. H. is a woman who fights day after day to get ahead. At fifty, she is a widow and has four children. Two of them are independent and the other two are 25 and 26 years old and responsible. For ten years, she has been dedicated to the service of renting internet booths, as well as renting sound equipment for twenty years and, two months ago, she started a telephone business from the effort of her daily work. Gaby has been able to buy better quality machines (PCs) and support the education of her children who are studying at university. Gaby's great dream is to buy herself a house since the house where she lives in is rented. The recent loan granted will be invested in online refills for her business and for a wedding gift for her daughter. Gaby is very thankful for all the support granted because it has helped her to improve her quality of life and that of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Online refills for her Internet business and for a wedding gift for her daughter.

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es:
la señora Emperatriz M. C. tiene 55 años de edad, es soltera y vive con una nieta,  tiene casa propia y esta ubicada en la aldea el Caimito San Lorenzo.
Sus hijos viven en los estados unidos.
Emperatriz se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa desde hace 8 años, en estos momentos esta solicitando el credito para surtir su negocio con calzado, como ser tenis para educacion fisica, zapatos para la escuela y colegio.
esta es la epoca escolar y muchas personas compran zapatos y tenis nuevos para sus hijos, las ventas de calzado suben mucho y desea estar preparada para cubrir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes. 
 
su mayor deseo es que su nieta se gradue de la universidad.
texts.en:
Emperatriz M. C., 55, is single and lives with a granddaughter. She has her own home located in the village of Caimito San Lorenzo. Her children live in the United States. Emperatriz has sold clothing for 8 years now. She is asking for funding to stock her business with shoes, in particular, athletic shoes for P.E. classes and school shoes. This is the beginning of a school term and many people buy new shoes and athletic shoes for their children. Shoe sales rise much and she wants to be prepared to cover all her customers' needs. Her greatest wish is that her granddaughter graduate from university.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La señora Delia es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan de Dios” desde hace 2 años, vive en el distrito y provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 04 hijos. Ella estudio hasta quinto de secundaria, se dedica a la venta de artesanía (tejido a mano).

Delia nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar lana, bayeta (tela), etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es agrandar su negocio.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones que dan las promotoras y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Delia, 36, has been a member of the "San Juan de Dios" communal bank for 2 years. She lives in the district and province of Lampa, Puno department. She lives with her life partner and has 4 children. She finished 10th grade. She is a textile merchant. Delia tells us that she used her first, 300 new sol, loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement to increase her capital. She is asking for a 1000 new sol loan to buy wool, baize (fabric), etc. Her wish for the future is to enlarge her business. What she likes best about her communal bank is the training sessions and the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool, baize (a type of flannel), etc.

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es:
l Sr. Eladio A.  es  de la localidad de Roque Gonzalez y se encuentra dentro de la Ciudad de Carapegua, tiene 39 años de edad, casado con tres hijos menores de edad.
Hace 10 años comenzó con  una pequeña despensa en su domicilio, además de eso se dedica al servicio de construcción de obras, gracias a este ingreso fue acrecentando su negocio que hoy día cuenta con una despensa bien surtida.
Su negocio está ubicado en una zona estratégica de la ciudad que  favorece la comercialización de sus productos.
Viendo la demanda actual de su negocio se acercó hasta nuestra institución para solicitar  préstamo para la compra de bebidas, embutidos, lácteos y panificados.
texts.en:
Eladio A., 39, is originally from Roque Gonzalez; he lives in the city of Carapegua. He is married and has three, minor children. Ten years ago he set up a small grocery store in his home. In addition to that, he also works in construction. Thanks to this income, he gradually enlarged his store and today it is a well-stocked store. His business is located in a strategic location in the city that is favorable for his sales. Seeing the high demand for his products, he called upon our institution to request funding to buy beverages, canned goods, dairy products and baked goods.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages, sugar, rice, dairy products, baked goods, canned goods.

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es:
la señora Rosa Angelica F. P. tiene 51 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Manuel Gutierrez, quienes son pareja desde hace mucho tiempo.  Su familia es cristiana protestante.
Sus hijos estan en la universidad y dependen de ellos. 
Rosa se dedica al comercio desde hace 10 años y don Manuel (su esposo) tiene un negocio de abarroteria. Les va muy bien en sus negocios. 
Rosa esta solicitando el credito para comprar calzado para escuelas y colegios, se aproxima la epoca escolar y las ventas son muy buenas. 
 
su anhelo es que su hijos se graduen de la universidad, sean buenos profesionales y hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Rosa Angelica F. P., 51, is married to Manuel Gutierrez; they have been a couple for a very long time. The family is Protestant. Their children are in the university and still depend upon them. Rosa has been a merchant for 10 years and her husband, Manuel, has a grocery store. They do well in their businesses. Rosa is asking for funding to buy school shoes; the new school term is near and sales are very good. Her dream is that her children graduate university, become good professionals and upstanding citizens.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school shoes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco  tiene 33 años de edad está casado con la Sra. Natalia Rojas  hace 8 años  y vive en casa propia en la  compañía Tajy Loma de la ciudad de Carapeguá, tienen 2 hijos en edad escolar.
       Él  empezó desde los 15  años a tejer  la tradicional sobrecama  que su padre llevaba a vender por la zona  de Luque,  hace más 20 años. Atrás  que su papá le dejo  totalmente a su cargo ya que el mismo no podía mas por su edad. 
Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo  pudieron comprarse dos motocicleta  la cual lo utiliza para realizar sus ventas, actualmente viaja con su Sra.  Llevan a vender los productos de las Artesanía de la zona ya con clientelas bien formada. 
         Solicita el préstamo para la compra de sobrecamas, sabanas y hamaca y otros.
texts.en:
Francisco, 33, has been married to Natalia Rojas for 8 years. He lives in his own house in Compañía Tajy Loma in the city of Carapeguá; they have two, school-age children. Since the age of 15, he has woven traditional bedspreads that his father would take to the Luque area to sell. A little over 20 years ago his father left him completely in charge because he, himself, could no longer work due to his advanced age. Thanks to his hard work and effort they were able to buy two motorcycles, which they use for their sales. Currently, he travels with his wife. They take the crafts throughout the zone where they have well-established regular customers. He is asking for funding to buy bedspreads, sheets, a hammock and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bedspreads, sheets, a hammock, etc.

loans.name: Gloria Mabel

texts.es:
La señora Gloria vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá,  empezó en el negocio de la venta de ropas hace 5 años  en vista que su negocio no empezaba a dar frutos en el local en donde se ubicó salió a ofrecer sus mercaderías por los negocios de los posibles compradores, en este caso resultó bastante bien  que le resultó con mucha ganancia, por el momento cuenta con mas de 50 clientes y precisa de mas capital para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Se acercó a la oficina de Carapeguá a solicitar dicho crédito
texts.en:
Ms Gloria lives in the city of Carapeguá. Five years ago she began her business of selling clothing. Since the business wasn’t doing well in the stand where she was located, she began to offer her merchandise by the businesses of possible buyers. This worked well and she made a good profit. Currently she has more than 50 customers and needs more capital so that she can purchase what her customers are asking for. She came to the office in Carapeguá to request this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise (t-shirts, pants, lingerie in general)

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro”, vive en "el distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y tiene 06 hijos. Ella  estudió hasta cuarto de primaria, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado (ovinos).

Elena nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar ovejas cara negra.

Su sueño para el futuro es aumentar sus ventas para así vivir mejor.

"Lo que mas me gusta son las capacitaciones que nos dan cada mes".
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the "San Pedro" communal bank. She lives in Acora district, Puno province and department. She is 47 years old, married and has 6 children. She finished 3rd grade. She raises sheep. Elena tells us that she used her first, 500 new sol, loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement to increase her capital. She will request a 1200 new sol loan to buy Blackface sheep. Her dream for the future is to increase her sales so that she can live better. "What I like best are the training sessions we have each month."

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Blackface sheep.

loans.name: Celestina Milena

texts.es:
La señora Celestina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Calceteras” desde hace 5 años atrás, del distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 03 hijos. Ella estudió primaria completa, se dedica a la venta de comida (viandas).

Celestina nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  víveres para la preparación de la comida como: arroz, fideos, papa, verduras, carne,  etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias porque son muy alegres
texts.en:
Celestina has been a member of the community bank "Las Calceteras" for five years. She lives in the district of Juliaca in the San Román province in the Puno department. Celestina is 33 years old, she has a live-in partner and has three children. She completed her primary education and she now dedicates herself to the sale of food. Celestina tells us that she used the first loan she requested from Movimiento Manuela Ramos in the amount of 300 nuevos soles (PEN) to increase her capital. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 nuevos soles (PEN) to buy food supplies such as rice, pastas, potatoes,vegetables, meat, etc. which she uses to prepare her food. Celestina's dream for the future is to have her own home. What Celestina enjoys most from her community bank are the meetings with other members because they are very cheerful.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, pastas, potatoes, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase soft drinks

loans.name: Esfuerzo Gracias A Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo El Almendrita está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras que se dedican a la comercialización de frutas y verduras. Ellas son de la comarca las Flores una zona rural de Masaya pero su centro de trabajo es en el mercado Mayoreo en Managua.

Maira del Socorro E. R. desde hace siete años inicio con la venta de frutas y verduras con la cual impulso a sus cinco hijos. Ella junto a su compañero de vida trabajan arduamente en dicho negocio actualmente desea invertir en la compra de cosechas de tamarindo y jocote que es la fruta que está en flota.

Patricia Centeno hace aproximadamente diez años inicio con el pequeño puesto de verduras el cual ha ido aumentado  y la señora Ángela del Socorro Hernández de 60 años la cual la mitad de su vida se ha dedicado a este comercio de compra de cosechas en Masaya la cual vende en Managua.
texts.en:
The group "El Amendrita" consists of three hard working women that dedicate themselves to the sale of fruits and vegetables. They are from the Las Flores region which is a rural zone of Masaya but their workplace is in the wholesale market in Managua. Maira del Socorro E. R. started her business of selling fruits and vegetables seven years ago with which she was able to raise her five children. Together with her life partner they work hard in their business. She currently wishes to invest in the purchase of tamarind and jocote (red mombin) harvests which are the fruits in season. Approximately ten years ago, Patricia Centeno started her small fruit stand which she has been expanding. Angela del Socorro is 60 years old and has spent half of her life dedicating herself to the business of purchasing harvests in Masaya which she sells in Managua.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruit and vegetable harvests that are in season.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio es un hombre bastante entusiasta y luchador de 27 años, es soltero, vive en una habitación alquilada en la selva central del Perú porque cree que es una zona donde hay más oportunidades laborales.

Sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar duro para alcanzar sus metas, por eso decidió estudiar lo que más le gusta, música, pues se dedica a tocar instrumentos como el arpa y el piano. Los contratos que más acepta son de arpista, pues tiene mayor demanda y es más rentable dentro del mercado del folklore. 
Paralelamente, en sus tiempos libres, trabaja transportando personas en su moto carro y gracias a las ganancias que obtiene con ambas actividades puede enviarles algo de dinero a su familia que se encuentran en su tierra natal; a su vez, también puede cubrir sus gastos personales y está ahorrando para comprar más instrumentos musicales porque en el futuro desea tener su propia orquesta; asimismo planea tener un negocio de venta de artefactos domésticos. 

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y manifiesta que pagará puntualmente cada cuota para no hacer quedar mal a su banco comunal, que está integrando por personas trabajadoras, unidas y reconocidas por su responsabilidad. Con el dinero que ahora solicita, planea implementar un negocio de compra y venta de instrumentos musicales de segundo uso, aprovechando que conoce a muchos músicos que necesitan de diferentes instrumentos.
texts.en:
Antonio is an enthusiastic and feisty 27-year-old man. He is single and lives in a rented room in Peru's central jungle because he believes it is an area with more opportunities for work. His parents raised him to work hard to reach his goals, so he decided to study what he loved most: music. He learned to play instruments such as the harp and piano. He is most often hired as a harpist, because there is higher demand and it is more profitable within the folklore market. On the side, he transports people on his motorcycle. With the earnings from both activities, he is able to send some money home to his family. He is able to cover his personal expenses and is saving to buy more musical instruments because in the future he wants to have his own orchestra. On top of that, he want to sell home appliances. This is his second loan with MFP and he has demonstrated that he will make each payment on time to remain on good terms with his communal bank, which is composed of hard-working people brought together by their responsibility. With the money he is requesting now, he plans to start a business buying and selling secondhand musical instruments, taking advantage of the fact that he knows many musicians who need different instruments.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in a new business

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora es una mujer alegre y amable, tiene 49 años, está casada con León, de 53 años, con quien tuvo 10 hijos; de los cuales sólo vive con Silvia de 19, Leo de 15 y Analí de 10 años.

Su vida no fue fácil y hasta ahora sigue luchando por salir adelante. Recuperada de una enfermedad que la mantuvo en cama varios meses, cuenta que le gusta mucho alimentar a sus animales, principalmente a los toros y vacas que cría para poder trabajar la chacra y elaborar ricos quesos.  A su vez, desde hace 34 años, junto a su esposo e hijos siembra papa y otras diferentes verduras muy solicitadas en el mercado. De esta actividad recibe buenas ganancias económicas que le permiten brindar una adecuada calidad de vida a su familia, sin preocupación alguna.
Con los años de experiencia que tiene, para más adelante desea sembrar en mayor cantidad en busca de productividad tanto en calidad y cantidad, también venderá sus quesos en un puesto de un mercado en la capital del país, Lima.            

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está convencida de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas porque invierte sólo lo necesario sin mal gastar el dinero, por lo que es muy admirada en su banco comunal. Con el dinero que ahora solicita piensa invertir en una compra de una lata de semilla de culantro y zanahoria, también de un saco de abono que esparcirá sobre sus sembríos para asegurar su producción.
texts.en:
Dora is a cheerful and friendly woman. She is 49 years old and married to Leon, who is 53. She has had 10 children with him. Of the ten, she only lives with Silvia, 19, Leo, 15, and Anali, 10. Her life hasn't been easy and she is still fighting to get ahead. Having recuperated from an illness that had her bedridden for several months, she tells us she likes to feed her animals, especially the bulls and cows she raises to work in the fields and make delicious cheeses. At the same time, for 34 years, with her husband and children, she has been planting potatoes and other vegetables that are in demand at the market. From this activity she receives good economic profit that allows her to offer an adequate quality of life to her family, without worries. With her years of experience, for the future she wishes to plant in higher quantity to seek productivity in quality as well as quantity. She will also sell her cheeses in a market stall in the country's capital, Lima. This is the third loan that she has had with MFP and she is convinced she can make her payments because she invests only what's neccesary without wasting the money. For this reason she is very admired in her communal bank. The money that she is asking for now she plans on investing in the purchase of a can of seed of cilantro and carrots, as well as in a bag of fertilizer which she will spread over her plantings to assure their production.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Iris Del Carmen

texts.es:
La cliente Iris del Carmen M. L. es confeccionista de ropa variada. Con una experiencia de 16 años en la industria de la confección. Ella Actualmente tiene 4 trabajadores 3 mujeres y un varón. Cuenta con un número de 10 maquinas, como activo fijo. Trabaja con empresas como MX uniformes y Publilogo las que le realizan pedidos mensuales a nuestra cliente, según el contrato que logran establecer con empresas privadas y estatales

Es soltera, madre de 2 Hijas que estudian en la universidad.

Este crédito lo solicitó para compra de insumos y poder cumplir con un pedido de 565 Blazer, 505 Blusas y 60 pantalones como son: entretela, hombrera, gruesones de botón, conos de hilo, seda de forro.

Es cliente A de CEPRODEL desde Febrero del 2002 con un buen record crediticio, se encuentra muy agradecida con nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Iris del Carmen M. L. is a tailor of many different types of clothes. She has sixteen years of experience as a tailor. Right now she manages four workers: three women and one man. She counts ten machines as fixed assets. She works with companies like MX uniforms and Publilogo, which place monthly orders from her according to the contract that they establish with private and state companies.

Iris is a single mother of two daughters who study in university.

Iris is requesting this loan to buy materials to complete her order of 454 blazers, 505 blouses and 60 pants. She needs to buy lining, shoulder pads, buttons, spools of thread, and silk lining.

Iris has been a client of CEPRODEL since February of 2002. She has a good loan record and is very grateful to this institution.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to make blazers, blouses and pants

loans.name: Edis

texts.es:
Edis es una mujer emprendedora D. 49 años, está casada con Serafín, D. 59 años; ambos viven junto a sus 2 hijos: Herman D. 27 y Luis D. 26 en su casa propia, la cual heredó D. sus suegros.
Cuando empezó a dedicarse a la repostería notó que con esas ganancias podía solventar los gastos familiares, comprar los alimentos diarios y cubrir la educación D. sus hijos, es por eso que se que esmero aún más en esa labor.
DesD. hace 3 años reparte empanadas D. carne (masa D. harina horneada con relleno D. carne) a las diferente fuentes D. soda y restaurantes, también decora tortas y pasteles que lleva a las ceremonias y eventos especiales.
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es elaborar las empanadas y distribuirlas con alegría, ya que considera que cuando sonríe venD. más. Por otro lado le disgusta tener que picar abundante cebolla – entre risas dice “son gajes del oficio, que se hace, salir adelante no más”.
Edis siempre busca progresar, por eso ansía instalar un puesto D. comida para no caminar mucho y vender los productos que prepara.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y conoce muy bien la metodología D. trabajo por eso le gusta compartir sus experiencias con las integrantes D. su banco comunal. Con los mil nuevos soles que ahora solicita comprará todos los insumos necesarios para preparar sus postres y bocadillos en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
At 49 years of age, Edis is an enterprising woman who is married to Serafin (age 59). They both live with their two children, Herman (age 27) and Luis (age 26), in their own home which they inherited from her in-laws.

When she began making pastries, Edis used her earnings to meet the family’s expenses, pay for the food they consumed on a daily basis, and cover her children’s education. For this reason, she took great care in performing her work.

For the past three years, Edis has been making empanadas (pastries filled with meat) and selling them to different soda fountains and restaurants. She also decorates cakes and desserts for ceremonies and special events. What she enjoys most about her job is preparing her empanadas and selling them with great joy. She believes she generates more sales when she has a smile on her face. On the other hand, the thing she hates most is having to chop onions. Laughingly she says, “it is part of the job, but I would rather not do it.” Edis always looks to progress in her business, so she plans to open a food stand so that she can sell her products without having to walk great distances.

This is her third loan with MFP. Edis knows the lending methodology very well and enjoys sharing her experiences with the other members of the Communal Bank. With her loan of 1000 soles, she plans to buy all the ingredients and supplies needed to prepare pastries and snacks in larger quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing pastries & snacks

loans.name: Kushka Puririsun Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal KUSHKA PURIRISUN está formado por 11 socios, inician 3 ciclo y son trabajadores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, las socias viven en la ciudad D. Urubamba del departamento del Cusco, ciudad que se caracteriza por sus paisajes hermosos, su agricultura y su ganadería. La cuidad Urubamba se encuentra ubicado a una hora y quince minutos D. la Ciudad del Cusco. Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta comida, comestibles y anticuchos, otros socios brindan servicios domésticos y transporte urbano. Los socios están preocupados por que las ventas han disminuido debido a que los compradores trabajaban directamente con el turismo. Las fuertes lluvias que cayeron por tres días en la ciudad del Cusco hicieron que turistas cancelaron sus reservaciones D. viaja a la ciudad del Cusco. El turismo ha decaído considerablemente.  

Patricia es socia del banco comunal los Kuska Puririsun, tiene 23 años D. edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos que depenD. todavía D. ella (Marco Antonio y Maria Fernanda). Patricia se dedica a la venta salchipapas y pollipapas en su carretilla y en la calle desD. las 3 p.m. hasta las 11 p.m. La socia Patricia requiere el préstamo para comprar pollos, papas y arroz. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
(Los socios que aparecen en los costados D. la fotografia pidieron permiso para no estar en el deseembolso).
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Kushka Puririsun” consists of eleven members who starting their third loan cycle. They are hard workers who look at each moment as an opportunity to get ahead. With great effort, they seek every day to proviD. a better future for their children. The members live in the City of Urubamba in the Department of Cusco. It is a city known for its beautiful landscapes, its agriculture, and its livestock. Urubamba is located an hour and fifteen minutes away from the City of Cusco. The members engage in different business activities such as selling food, groceries, and “anticuchos” (skewered meats). Other members proviD. housekeeping services and public transportation. They are concerned about their declining sales because their buyers are tied directly to tourism. Because of the heavy rains that hit the area for three consecutive days, many tourists canceled their travel reservations into Cusco. Tourism has declined significantly. Patricia is a member of the “Kushka Puririsun” Communal Bank. She is 23 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two dependent children (Marco Antonio and Maria Fernanda). Patricia sells “salchipapas” (sausages and fried potatoes) and “pollipapas” (chicken and fried potatoes) from a pushcart. She travels along the streets between 3pm and 11pm to sell her dishes. Patricia is requesting a loan to buy chicken, potatoes, and rice. The members, in general, are grateful for this opportunity provided to them. They promise to submit their payments on the established due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Esfuerzo Gracias A Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo Esfuerzo Gracias a Dios está integrado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y con el ferviente deseo de salir a delante. Una de ellas es María auxiliadora Bermúdez Martínez quien vende cosméticos de forma ambulante según comento ella inicio con pocos productos pero conforme su negocio fue creciendo y aumentando.

Las otras integrantes son Arcadia Gertrudis T. quien realiza costuras y reposterías, Marlin Ivonne R. T. tiene un taller de costura y Coralia del Socorro P. vende hielo y frescos naturales. Ellas invertirán el préstamo en el sus respectivos negocios para que este mejore y crezca.
texts.en:
The group “Esfuerzo Gracias a Dios” (Thankful for God’s Strenth) consists of four hardworking, determined women who have the fervent desire to succeed. One of these women is María Auxiliadora Bermúdez Martínez, who sells cosmetics as a traveling merchant. She says she started her business with few products but now it is growing and expanding.

The other members are Arcadia Gertrudis T. who sews and makes sweets, Marlin Ivonne R. T. who has a sewing workshop, and Coralia del Socorro P. who sells ice and natural refreshments. They will invest their loans in their respective businesses in order to grow and improve.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Doris Maria

texts.es: Doris de 29 años de edad es madre soltera de un niño de 2 añitos de edad, cuenta con el apoyo de su mamá que cuida del niño cuando se va al trabajo, trabaja para la alcaldia del Coral Chontales desde hace un año como asistente del Alcalde, actualmente està estudiando su segundo año en la Universidad URACCAN, ella es una mujer responsable honesta y muy trabajadora,con este prestamo ella pretende repellar y hecharle el piso a una habitaciòn, para tener mejor comodidad en el hogar, el sueño es seguir estudiando y culminar sus estudios para brindarle las condiciones basicas a su hijo y ayudar a su familia en lo que mas pueda ya que son de escasos recursos econòmicos.
texts.en:
Doris is 29 years old and a single mother of a two year old child. She has the support of her mother, who looks after her son while she is at work. Doris is employed by the City of Coral Chontales and has worked as the assistant to the Mayor for the past year. She is currently in her second year as a student at URACCAN (The University of the Autonomous Regions of the Caribbean Coast of Nicaragua). Doris is a responsible, honest, and hardworking woman.

With this loan she intends to install and seal a floor for a room in her home so that it will be more comfortable. Her dream is to continue her studies and complete her degree so that she can provide basic living conditions for her child and support her family. Doris tries to make the best that she can of her limited financial resources.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a floor in a room of her house

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre sin limitaciones, tiene 53 años, vive en su casa propia con la compañera de toda su vida – su esposa Lucía de 54 años. Está feliz pareja lamentablemente no pudo tener hijos. 

A 5 kilómetros de la ciudad están ubicados los terrenos agrícolas de Juan, donde siembra papa con la ayuda de su esposa. Paralelamente se dedica  a la crianza de ganado que vende vivo o su carne.  Lo que más le gusta de sus actividades es cuidar a sus toros porque los ve disfrutar de los campos llenos de pasto. Él recuerda que cuando se casó no tenía ningún bien, pero poco a poco obtuvo sus chacras, su casa, los animales que cría, permitiéndose tener una vida cómoda.
Por eso con los años de experiencia que tiene, para adelante desea sembrar en mayor cantidad para obtener mejores cosechas y comprar más animales.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y, como siempre, se compromete a ser puntual en cada pago porque considera que su palabra es más importante que los documentos de por medio. Por otro lado, también le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal ya que es muy activo.  Con el dinero solicitado tiene pensado comprar dos cabezas de ganado de raza, ensebarlos y revenderlos para obtener utilidades adicionales a la de sus cosechas. Cada animal está valorizado en 700 nuevos soles, por lo que necesita mil quinientos.
texts.en:
Juan is a gentleman without limitations. He is 53 years old and lives in his own home with his lifelong companion, his wife Lucia who is 54. Unfortunately, this happy couple was not able to have children.

Juan’s farmland is located five kilometers outside of the city, where he plants potatoes with the help of his wife. At the same they raise cattle, which they sell live or as meat. Of all his agricultural activities, Juan enjoys taking care of the cattle the most because he likes watching them indulge themselves in his pastures full of grass. Juan remembers that he was not any good at farming when he got married. Over time, after he bought a house, developed his farm, and started raising animals, he got to the point where he could start living comfortably. After gaining a few years of experience, he decided he wanted to plant more crops and acquire more animals.

Juan is receiving his fourth loan from MFP and, as always, promises to make his payments on time because he believes his word is more important than the documents involved. In addition, he enjoys working with his Communal Bank and is very active. With the money he requested, Juan intends to buy two heads of cattle of good breed. He will fatten and sell them for a profit, along with his crops. Each animal is valued at approximately 700 soles, but he will go ahead and request a loan of 1500 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two heads of cattle

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucía es una mujer emprendedora de 32 años, está felizmente casada con Johan (32), con quien tiene 3 hermosos hijos: Danitza de 12, Leonardo de 10 y Amelí de 4 años. Está familia vive en su casa propia ubicada en la selva central del Perú.
Cada viernes, desde tempranas horas, Lucía instala su carpa frente a los servicios higiénicos públicos ubicados en la feria que se desarrolla en su ciudad. En este espacio vende ropa, pero a la vez que está encargada del cuidado e ingreso a los sanitarios, labor que desarrolla hace dos años con la ayuda de su hija mayor y de su hermana. A ella le gusta conocer nuevos clientes y recomendar las prendas de acuerdo al tamaño y la edad pero, confiesa que a veces cuando no vende lo que espera se siente decepcionada, sin embargo sigue luchando, pues siempre vende algo sin que haya perdido la inversión, por eso considera rentable sus actividades, pues vive cómodamente gracias a las ganancias que percibe.       
Para su futuro desea incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que vende, ya que no desea tener una tienda ni un lugar estable porque considera que en las ferias es donde se obtiene mayores beneficios económicos.

Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y se muestra muy entusiasmada con el trabajo que desempeña en su banco comunal, donde los integrantes son bastante activos y comprensivos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita planea comprar ropa interior e implementos de limpieza, artículos más solicitados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lucía is an enterprising woman who is 32 years old and is happily married to Johan (32), with whom she has 3 beautiful children: Danitza, 12, Leonardo, 10, and Amelí, who is 4. This family lives in their own home located in the central jungle of Peru. Every Friday, from the early hours, Lucía sets up her tent in front of the public toilets located in the market that takes place in her city. From this space she sells clothing, but at the same time she is responsible for the care and entrance to the toilets, work that she has been doing for 2 years with the help of her oldest daughter and her sister. She likes to get to know her customers, and to recommend the styles that are suitable for their size and age but she admits that at times, when she does not have the sales she hoped for, she feels disappointed. Nonetheless, she continues to strive; she always sells something without having lost her investment. For this reason, she regards this activity as profitable, and she lives comfortably thanks to the profits she earns. For the future she hopes to increase the quantity of merchandise that she sells; she does not wish to have a store or a fixed place of business, because she considers that the markets are the place where she can get the most economic benefits. This is her third loan from MFP, and she displays a lot of enthusiasm with the work that she carries out for the communal bank, where the members are quite active and supportive. With the money she requests now she plans to buy underwear and cleaning accessories, which are items that are in high demand from her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise (buy underwear and cleaning accessories)

loans.name: Naisha

texts.es:
