Naisha es una joven muy alegre de 18 años, es madre de un pequeño de un año y vive con su madre Teófila de 53 años. Su casa es alquilada y está ubicada en la selva central del Perú.
Su deseo de brindarle lo mejor a su hijo, es lo que le motiva a diario a salir adelante a pesar de las adversidades que se le presentan. A su corta edad es consiente de que ser padre y madre es muy difícil y sacrificado, pero no quiere pasar sus días lamentándose por eso. Desde hace 6 meses, gracias a la ayuda de su madre, instaló un negocio de comestibles en el domicilio donde vive. Lo que más le gusta es atender y sugerir algunos productos a su clientela, pero lo que le disgusta despertarse temprano y dormir muy tarde. 
“Nada es imposible, por eso en el transcurso del año he pensado en ampliar mi bodega con productos novedosos y requeridos en el mercado” comenta; a la vez que afirma que la mejor decisión que tomó en su vida es emprender su propio negocio, ya que percibe ingresos económicos diarios y bastante rentables, pues logra vivir cómodamente, sin pasar necesidades.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, sus compañeros de grupo le explicaron en qué consiste el trabajo en su banco comunal, por lo que ella asegura que le agrada y será puntual en sus pagos como ellos. Con los setecientos soles que solicita piensa comprar varios sacos de menestras (garbanzo, lentejas, pallar y arbeja verde) para vender por kilos en su tienda.
texts.en:
Naisha is a happy 18 year old woman. She is the mother of a one year old baby and lives with her 53 year old mother Teófila. They live in a rented home which is located in Peru’s central jungle. Her desire to provide the best for her son is what motivates her to come out ahead daily, despite the difficulties she faces. Being so young, she knows how difficult it can be to be both a mother and a father, and that it involves great sacrifice, but she refuses to spend her days feeling sorry for herself. Six months ago she started a small grocery store in her home, thanks to her mother’s help. She enjoys helping her customers and suggesting products to them, but she doesn’t like having to get up early and go to bed late. “Nothing is impossible, so I plan to expand my shop this year and include new products for which there is a demand,” she says as she reiterates that starting her business was the best decision she has ever made in her life, now that she brings in a steady income daily, which allows her to live comfortably without missing any necessities. This is her first loan through MFP. Her friends in the group explained to her how a communal bank works, for which she is grateful and promises to make her payments on time, like the rest of the members. She will use the money from this loan of 700 PEN ($250) to buy sacs of dried beans (chick peas, lentils, grass peas) to sell by the kilogram in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Reynaldo Andrés

texts.es:
El señor Reynaldo Andrés G. C. vive con su esposa en el Barrio La Borgoña tiene 43 años de edad y su esposa trabaja como comerciante, tienen 3 hijos que estudian y apoyan en los trabajos agrícolas, ellos se dedican  a la agricultura desde hace 20 años y uno de los problemas que más los ha afectado a sido la multiplicación de plagas que amenaza con la buena cosecha, ellos comenzaron sus días en este rubro dado al apoyo financiero de su padre.

Dentro de los planes que tienen a futuro está la compra de una caponera. Este es un medio de transporte que moviliza pasajeros a cortas distancias. Pero dentro de las prioridades, esta la inversión de materiales agrícolas, que el brinden una mantenimiento correcto a las tierras, garantizando la venta y recuperación del capital invertido.
texts.en:
Reynaldo lives in the " La Borgoña" neighborhood along with his wife. He is 43 years old and his wife works as a salesperson. They have three kids who study in school and help with the farm work. They've been farming for 20 years and one of the things that has affected their harvest has been the blights. They began working in their given field with his father's financial backing. Their future plans include the purchase of a " caponera," a small three wheeled vehicle which is used to transport passengers for short distances, but their priority is investment in agricultural supplies that they need to properly manage the land, ensuring that they can recover their investment.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in agriculturel supplies

loans.name: Severino

texts.es:
Severino es un hombre discreto y trabajador que tiene 62 años, está casado con una adorable mujer, Antonieta de 54 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, sin embargo sólo viven con su última hija Analí de 15 años. 

Desde hace 40 años se dedica a la siembra de papa, arveja, habas y maíz, con la ayuda incondicional de su esposa. Lo que más lo motiva a seguir adelante en su oficio es la época de  cosecha porque luego de comercializar sus productos agrícolas recupera la inversión que realizó, obteniendo ganancias considerables con las que compra productos de primera necesidad para su hogar, por lo que considera bastante rentable su trabajo.
“Sembrando, sin descanso pude comprar mi casa, mis terrenos, educar a mis hijos”, menciona emocionado.    
Como es un hombre visionario, con el tiempo desea constituir una tienda de comestibles o según la demanda un negocio de fertilizantes, en un local que alquilará en la ciudad. 

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y es conciente de que siendo puntual en cada pago conseguirá sus objetivos, además le gusta motivar las actividades dentro de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará fertilizantes, insecticidas y plaguicidas para proteger sus sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
Severino is 62 years old and is a hard working, humble man. He is married to a wonderful woman, Antonieta, age 54. They have four children, but only their youngest daughter, Analí, age 15, lives with them. Together with the help of his wife, he has been cultivating potatoes, peas, beans, and corn for the past 40 years. What motivates him to continue his work is the harvest, because after selling his products, he is able to recover his investments and bring in a good income, which he uses to provide for his family's needs. He considers this to be a good reward for working. "Farming has allowed me to buy my home, my land, and provide for my children's education," he says excitedly. Like a visionary, he hopes to one day build a grocery store, or based on demand, perhaps open a fertilizer business in a location he rents in town. This will be his fourth loan through MFP and he knows that he will meet his objectives by paying on time. He also enjoys motivating others within his communal bank. He will use the money from this loan to invest in fertilizer, insecticide and fungicide in order to protect his potato crop.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Ada Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Ada Patricia S. C., tiene 34 años de edad  es casada y su esposo es electricista, ellos tienen 4 hijos y dentro de los principales planes esta la remodelación de su hogar para la mejora de las condiciones de vida de sus hijos y así poder brindarles un futuro mejor.

Ellos se dedican a la venta de ropa y zapatos nuevos y usados, dentro de los principales problemas que han tenido con el negocio, ha sido la irresponsabilidad de algunos de sus clientes que no le cancelan sus créditos, esto le obstaculiza  la inversión de un mayor inventario de mercadería o de una apertura de una tienda en donde ofertar sus productos,  ellos solicitan de un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, esto les brindaría la posibilidad de emprenderse hacia nuevos mercados, bajo nuevas medidas de pagos apra evitarse los problemas que poseen hoy en dia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ada Patricia S. C. is 34 years old and married. Her husband is an electrician. They have four children, and one of their short-term goals is remodeling their home to improve the quality of life of their children and be able to give them a better future.

They work selling new and used clothing and shoes, and one of their main problems with the business has been the irresponsibility of some of their customers who do not pay their debts. This prevents them from being able to invest in growing their inventory or opening a store in which to offer their products. They are asking for a loan to buy merchandise, as this will give them the opportunity to branch out in new markets, with new means to make their payments to avoid the problems they have today.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Hector Ramon

texts.es: Don Hector Ramòn de 44 años de edad es casado, tiene dos hijos el mayor de 16 años esta estudiando su quinto año de secundaria, el menor acaba de cumplir dos añitos de edad, trabaja en la empresa Formunica desde hace 2 años como ejecutivo de ventas, su esposa la Sra. Gloria Gutierrez, labora como docente en la Escuela Mauricio Cajina desde hace 22 años, ambos comparten los gastos familiares del hogar y los compromisos  adquiridos ya que son  una familia bien unida, està solicitando su primer crèdito a la Instituciòn, para poder construir una habitaciòn para su hijo mayor y brindarle mayor comodidad y privacidad, el sueño de Hector es  tener un porvenir mejor para sus hijos y cada dia que pasa estar bien con Dios y la Familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Hector Ramòn is 44 years old, married, and has two sons. The oldest is 16 years old and is in his fifth year of secondary school. The younger son just turned two years old.

He has worked for the Formunica company for two years as a sales executive. His wife, Mrs. Gloria Gutierrez, has worked as a teacher in the Mauricio Cajina school for 22 years. They both help with the expenses of the home and are a very united family. He is asking the Institution for his first loan to be able to build a bedroom for his older son to provide him greater comfort and privacy. Hecor's dream is to have a better future for his sons and to be approved of by God and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bedroom

loans.name: Arnulfo De Jesus

texts.es:
El Señor Arnulfo de Jesús B., labora como Higienista en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene tres  hijos a su cargo y estos  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado once   créditos con CEPRODEL durante ocho años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido dos créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: perlines, zinc, pintura y clavos pare el techo de su casa de habitación por lo que anteriormente este se encontraba en mal estado y esto hacia que el agua pasara en invierno.
Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Francisco dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Arnulfo de Jesús B. works as a dental hygienist in the Mercado Oriental de Managua (Eastern Market of Managua). He is married and has three school-age children under his care. He has received eleven loans from CEPRODEL over the past eight years. Thanks to CEPRODEL, during this time he has invested the funds from two loans in the improvement of his home. He is an excellent client. The funds from this loan will be invested in the purchase of construction materials, like wooden beams, zinc, paint, and nails, to repair the roof of his house, which is in poor condition and lets water through during the winter. The goal of this project is to provide better security and a better quality of life for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement and expansion

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
El Señor José David Pavón López, labora como Higienista en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene un   hijo a su cargo y este se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado once  créditos con CEPRODEL durante ocho  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido once créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra dos ventanas con su marco para el frente se su casa de habitación ya que esta solo contaban con las verjas.

Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

José David dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. José David Pavón López works as a janitor in the Eastern Market in Managua. He has one school-aged son under his care and is married. He has received eleven loans throuh CEPRODEL in the past eight years. In this time he invested eleven loans in the improvement of their home, thanks to the loans provided by CEPRODEL. He is an excellent client.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy two windows with frames for the front of his house since it now only has bars. He is doing this with the goal of providing greater security and quality of life for his children. José David said that the loans provided to him have been for home improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Mary Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Mary es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” desD. hace 2 años, vive en el distrito D. Acora, provincia y departamento D. Puno, tiene 60 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 06 hijos. Ella  estudio primaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado.

Mary nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  D. S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar una vaca lechera y un toro.

Su sueño para el futuro es aumentar sus ventas para así vivir mejor.

Lo que mas le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las reuniones que hay cada mes.
texts.en:
Mary has been a member of the San Pedro comunal bank for the past two years. She lives in the Acora district in the province and department of Puno. She is 60 years old, is married and has six children. She has an elementary school education and buys and sells livestock. Mary tells us that she used the money from her first loan, of 3,000 PEN, which she obtained though “Movimiento Manuela Ramos,” to increase her working capital. She is asking for this loan of 3000 PEN ($1,075) to invest in a dairy cow and a bull. Her hopes for the future are to increase her sales so that she can have a better life. What she likes best about her communal bank are the get together that they have each month.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a dairy cow and a bull

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
El Señor Roger García Martínez, trabaja en su centro de labores en uno de los mercados de Managua. Él tiene cinco  hijos a su cargo y cuatro de ellos  se encuentran en edad escolar por lo que debe de brindarles las condiciones necesarias para que ellos se desarrollen y es por esta razón que ha decidido invertir en el mejoramiento de su vivienda que por mucho tiempo ha estado en malas condiciones y es este el motivo por el cual espera confiadamente que su crédito sea otorgado porque desea llevar a cabo el mejoramiento de su vivienda para el bienestar de sus hijos.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, perlines, pintura y clavos para su casa de habitación con el único fin de beneficiar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señor Roger García Martínez works at a labor center in one of the markets in Managua. He has five children, and four of them are of school age. He would like to offer his children better conditions in which to develop and for this reason he has decided to invest in making improvements to his home that has been in a state of disrepair for a long time. For this reason he is confidently hoping that his loan will be funded and he will be able to make the necessary changes to his home and increase the wellbeing of his children. The loan that he is requested will be used to buy construction materials like zinc, timber, paint and nails for his home with the only goal being to increase the well being of his children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and expand his home

loans.name: Salvit

texts.es:
Salvit, es una mujer muy  dinámica, vive en el Distrito de Calleria, región Ucayali, tiene 35 años, es madre de un menor de edad, ella se dedica a administrar su bodega, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja como corredor de madera. Salvit forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres solidarias”, desde hace 2 años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que fue invertido en madera, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 700 soles, que será invertido en la compra de productos para abastecer su bodega.
La meta de Salvit es poner un restaurant  bien implementado y de esta manera brindar un servicio eficiente.
texts.en:
Salvit, 35, is a very dynamic woman. She lives in Callería district, Ucayali region. She has a child. She runs her grocery store. Her husband, who is a lumber merchant, supports her work efforts. Salvit has been a member of the 'Mujeres Solidarias" communal bank for two years. She used her first, 300 sol, loan to buy lumber. She now needs a 700 sol loan to buy stock items for her stores. Salvit's goal is to open a well-equipped restaurant so that she can provide efficient customer service.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Carlos García, labora como agente de seguridad en una universidad en Managua donde se esfuerza para llevar el sustento a sus cuatro  hijos a su que se encuentran en edad escolar.

El crédito está solicitándolo para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, hierro y cemento para la construcción de un muro en su casa de habitación ya que es de mucha necesidad para así brindarle mayor seguridad a sus hijos y contribuir al mejoramiento de su vivienda que tanto necesita de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Mr Carlos Garcia works as a security agent at the University of Managua. He works very hard to be able to support his four children that are currently enrolled in school. He is requesting this loan to be able to buy construction materials like rocks, sand, tools and cement so that he can build a wall in his home. This wall is needed to give increased security to his children and contribute to the improvement of his home for which he need your help.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and expand his home

loans.name: Santos Victoria

texts.es: Santos tiene 66 años, por lo que su actividad económica es el destace de cerdo. Ella tiene más de 5 años que se dedica a su negocio, ya que inicio dando apertura a su negocio, pero ella es muy inteligente pues le gustaba mucho y disfrutaba realizar cada tarea de esta actividad además tiene a sus 3 hijos a su cargo que alimentar diariamente poco a poco fue progresando hasta establecer su negocio en su vivienda. Ella enfrento desafíos como lo fue el incremento de ciertos productos pero este pequeño detalle no la detuvo a seguir con este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima para su actividad. Su deseo es seguir adelante y obtener la fama de ofrecer un excelente servicio.
texts.en:
Santos, 66, butchers pigs. She has been in this line of work for over 5 years. She began her work and, being quite intelligent, she enjoyed every aspect of her job very much. Besides, she has three children under her care whom she must feed every day. Gradually, she made progresss until she was able to set up her business in her home. She faced many challenges, like the rise in prices of certain products, but this small detail did not stop her from continuing with her business. The financing she is requesting will be used to buy raw materials for her activity. Her wish is to continue advancing and to become reknown for the excellent service she provides.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: El Malinche 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo El Malinche 2 está integrado por Alba Luz Sánchez quien comercializa cosméticos de forma ambulante desde hace cinco años en los cuales su negocio fue creciendo. Su compañera de grupo Sandra Dávila R. trabaja el piuter con el cual realiza retrateras, espejos, casuelas, pailas etc.

Mientras Patricia Lorena Pavón G.  vende nacatamales un plato típico a base de masa, ane de cerdo, arroz, papa, etc.…este platillo nicaragüense generalmente se desayuna el viernes, sábado o domingo.
texts.en:
Alba is a member of the group, “El Malinche 2.” She has been selling cosmetics on foot for the past five years, during which her business has been growing. Her associate, Sandra works with pewter, with which she makes picture frames, mirrors, pots, and pans, etc. Patricia sells “nacatamales,” which are a typical Nicaraguan food, consisting of pork, rice, potatoes, etc, wrapped in a corn flower dough. These are generally eaten for breakfast on Fridays, Saturdays, or Sundays.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Wilberto Antonio

texts.es: El joven Wilberto de 30 años de edad es soltero, vive en el municipio del Coral Chontales,  trabaja como Responsable  de Unidad Ambiental desde hace un año, a pesar que este cliente no tiene hijos ayuda a su madre y a su abuelita con los gastos del hogar ya que son de escasos recursos económicos,  está solicitando financiamiento de su primer  credito con el cual pretende pintar la casa donde el vive, el se caracteriza por ser un joven muy responsable, honesto y trabajador este cliente   desde  niño a aprendido a trabajar y a valorar lo que mas ama su familia,  actualmente esta estudiando una licenciatura en la Universidad  Martin Lutero,  su sueño es  llegar a ser un profesional que ayude a que nuestro pais salga de la pobreza y  tener estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia ya que son humildes.
texts.en:
Wilberto is 30 years old and single. He lives in the town of Coral Chontales. For the past year, Wilberto has worked as Head of Environmental Health. Even though he has no children, Wilberto helps his mother and grandmother with household expenses as the family has few economic means. This is Wilberto’s first loan, which he will use to paint his house. He is responsible, honest and industrious, and since childhood has learnt to work and hold family values in high regard. Wilberto is currently studying a degree at the Martin Lutero University. His dream is to become a professional, help his country to escape poverty, and have job security to maintain his family who are of scarce economic means.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To paint his house

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El Señor Francisco Javier López A., Labora como conductor en el Mercado Roberto Huembés de Managua, el tiene un  hijos a su cargo y este  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado dos créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido dos créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, cemento y azulejo parta la construcción de un baño ya que el que tenia anterior se encontraba en mal estado 
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Francisco dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Señor Francisco Javier López A. works as a driver at the Roberto Huembés market in Managua. He has one son who is of school age. He is married. He has had two loans with Ceprodel in two years. In this period of time, he has invested his two loans in improving his home, thanks to the financing offered to him by Ceprodel. He is an excellent client. He will invest the loan he is requesting in the purchase of construction materials like: sand, cement, and tiles to build a bathroom since the one he had previously was in bad shape. He is doing all of this to offer more safety and better living conditions to his children. Francisco said that the loans he has been offered have gone towards improving his home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and expand his home

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El Señor Julio Cesar R. A., labora como Comprador  en el Centro de Capacitación Profesional Nicaragüense Alemán CECNA, el tiene dos   hijos a su cargo y estos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado nueve  créditos con CEPRODEL durante ocho  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido nueve créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales eléctricos para el sistema eléctrico de su casa de habitación ya que el que tiene se encuentra en mal estado.

Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Julio Cesar dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Señor Julio Cesar R. A. works as a buyer at the Nicarguan German Professional Training Center (abbreviated CECNA in Spanish). He has two school-aged children and is married. He has had nine loans with Ceprodel in eight years. In this period of time, he has invested his nine loans in improving his home, thanks to the financing offered to him by Ceprodel. He is an excellent client. He will invest the requested loan in the purchase of electrical materials like an electrical system for his home since the one he has is in bad shape. He is doing all of this with the objective of offering more safety and better living conditions to his children. Julio Cesar said that the loans he has been offered have gone toward improving his home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and expand his home

loans.name: William Andres

texts.es:
El Señor William Andrés N., labora como Higienista en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene dos  hijos a su cargo y estos  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado cuatro  créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido dos créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales eléctricos como son alambres candelas y caja por lo que anteriormente sete se encontraba en mal estado por lo que ahora podrá contar con un mejor sistema eléctrico para su hogar. 

 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Francisco dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Señor William Andrés N. works as a janitor as the oriental market in Managua. He has two children who are of school age. He is married. He has had four loans with Ceprodel in three years. In this period of time, he has invested two loans in improving his home, thanks to the financing offered to him by Ceprodel. He is an excellent client. He will invest the requested loan in the purchase of electrical materials like an alarm, lights, and an electrical box because the ones he had previously were in bad shape. Now he will be able to have a better electrical system for his home. He is doing all of this with the objective of offering more safety and better living conditions to his children. Francisco said that the loans he has received have gone towards improving his home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and expand his home

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Freddy Ramón

texts.es:
Freddy Ramón G. T. es un señor de 33 años de edad el  cual vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en una comunidad llamada Caño Negro localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Desde hace 8 meses Don Freddy consiguió trabajo en un lugar donde se siembra piña pero comenta que su trabajo se encuentra bastante lejos de su casa y que se le ha dificultado  la manera de llegar hasta él, ya que los caminos no están en muy buen estado y además hay muy poco transporte público, además comenta que tiene una parcela, pero ha tenido que dejar  de darle mantenimiento ya que no ha tenido el suficiente tiempo para dedicarle puesto que llega muy tarde a su casa. 

Por lo cual don Freddy  ha decidido comprar una moto para poder transportarse mejor y así agilizar  la forma en la que viaja así también podrá  ahorrar y aprovechar más  el tiempo. Por lo tanto requiere un préstamo de ¢654.000 (seiscientos cincuenta y cuatro mil colones) para comprar la moto y así poder tener un vehículo propio que le permita seguir adelante  y facilitarle su modo de viajar.

Don Freddy forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Emcrecoba, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo pero  don Freddy destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito se puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Freddy Ramon Garcia T. is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the hamlet of Cano Negro situated in the canton of Los Chiles in Alajuela province. The hamlet is located in mountainous terrain and is very close to the northern border of Costa Rica. The area’s principal economic activities are farming and agriculture of which staple grains, sugar cane, and oranges constitute the main crops. Eight months ago, Freddy secured a job at a pineapple plantation. However, the plantation is located at some considerable distance from his home and Freddy finds it difficult to get to work due to the poor state of local roads and public transportation. Due to the time spent travelling to and from work, Freddy has been unable to tend to the allotment he owns. Therefore, Freddy has decided to buy a moped to solve his transportation problems and to save on money and time. He is asking for a loan of ¢654 (six hundred and fifty four Costa Rican Colons) to buy the moped and, thus, equip him with his own form of transport. Freddy forms part of the Community Lending facility Emcrecoba, one of 100 affiliated organisations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This is his first loan and Freddy expresses thanks for the opportunity to focus on productive activities that such organisations and loan facilitators provide him.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a moped

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
El Señor Ernesto S. Gutiérrez, labora como vigilante de seguridad en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, el tiene cinco   hijos a su cargo y tres de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado nueve  créditos con CEPRODEL durante nueve  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido dos créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: perlines, zinc, pintura y clavos pare el techo de su casa de habitación por lo que anteriormente este se encontraba en mal estado y esto hacia que el agua se metiera en su casa de habitación en invierno.
Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Ernesto dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
El Señor Ernesto S. Gutiérrez works as a security guard in the Mercado Oriental of Managua. He has five children in his care, and three of them are school age. He is married. He has had nine loans from CEPRODEL during nine years; during these years, thanks to financing by CEPRODEL, he invested the loans in the improvement of his residence. He is an excellent customer. The requested loan will be used to purchase construction materials such as roofing materials, corrugated metal roofing, paint, and nails for the roof of his house. The roof was in poor condition and leaked during the winter. The objective of all this is to give better security and living conditions to his children. Ernesto said that loans granted had been used to improve his residence.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home Improvement

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth B. S. es una joven de 22 años de edad la cual vive con su pequeño hijo en una comunidad llamada Caño Negro localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Hace poco Elizabeth consiguió trabajo en un hotel pero comenta que este  se encuentra  muy lejos de su casa y que se le dificulta la manera de llegar hasta él, ya que los caminos no están en muy buen estado y además hay muy poco transporte público. 

Por lo cual Elizabeth ha decidido comprar una moto para poder transportarse mejor y así agilizar  la forma en la que viaja así también podrá  ahorrar y aprovechar más  el tiempo. Por lo tanto requiere un préstamo de ¢654.000 (seiscientos cincuenta y cuatro mil colones) para comprar la moto y así poder tener un vehículo propio que le permita seguir adelante  y facilitarle su modo de viajar.

Elizabeth forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Emcrecoba, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo pero Elizabeth destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito se puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth B. S. is a young woman of 22 years. She lives with her small son in the hamlet of Caño Negro situated in the canton of Los Chiles in Alajuela province. The hamlet is located in mountainous terrain and is very near the northern border of Costa Rica. Farming and agriculture are the area’s main economic activities, with staple grains, sugar cane and oranges as the principal crops. Recently, Elizabeth managed to secure a job in a hotel, but reports that getting to and from work is difficult as a result of the hotel being of considerable distance from her house, local roads being in poor condition, and few public buses. To solve the issue of transport and to be able to save on time and money, Elizabeth has decided to buy a moped. Therefore, she needs a loan of ¢654 (six hundred and fifty four Costa Rican Colons) to buy the moped and to provide her own means of transport. Elizabeth is part of the Communal Credit lending company Emcrecoba, one of the 100 organisations affiliated with EDESA in Costa Rica. This is Elizabeth’s first loan. Elizabeth expresses thanks to these types of organisations and credit facilitators, as they make it possible for her to focus on more productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a moped

loans.name: Karla Tatiana

texts.es:
Karla Tatiana V. R. es una señora de 31 años de edad la  cual vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en una comunidad llamada Caño Negro localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Desde hace poco más de 2 meses que doña Karla trabaja en un hotel, dice que ahora tiene una fuente de ingreso con la cual ayudar  a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar  pero comenta que su trabajo se encuentra bastante lejos de su casa y que se le ha dificultado  la manera de llegar hasta él, ya que hay muy poco transporte público y su horario es rotativo por lo que a veces debe esperar mucho tiempo para encontrar transporte.

Por lo tanto doña Karla ha decidido comprar una moto para poder transportarse mejor y así agilizar  la forma en la que viaja con esto podrá  ahorrar y aprovechar más  el tiempo. Por lo cual requiere un préstamo de ¢654.000 (seiscientos cincuenta y cuatro mil colones) para comprar la moto y así poder tener un vehículo propio que le permita seguir adelante  y facilitarle su modo de viajar.

Doña Karla forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Emcrecoba, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Karla Tatiana V. R., 31, lives with her husband and their four children in a community called Caño Negro. It is located in Los Chiles in the Alajuela province. This area is in a mountainous region near the northern border of the country. The main economic activities are livestock breeding and agriculture, specifically the planting and harvesting of basic grains, sugar cane, and oranges. Karla has worked in a hotel for a little over two months. She says that she now has a source of income, which helps her husband with the household expenses. But, she says, her work is pretty far from her house. It is difficult for her to get there because there is very little public transportation and her schedule rotates. Sometimes she needs to wait a long time to find transportation. Therefore, Karla has decided to buy a motorcycle to be better able to get places. That way she will speed up the way she travels, and she will be able to save and take advantage of having more time. To do this she needs a loan for ¢654,000 (six hundred fifty four thousand colones) to buy the motorcycle. That way she will be able to have her own vehicle, which will allow her to get ahead and facilitate her form of travel. Karla is part of the Emcrecoba Communal Finance Institution, one the 100 organizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her second loan, and with the loan she hopes to continue growing on a personal and economic level. She also plans on actively participating in the loan organization in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de una motocicleta

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El Señor José Luis Z. Hernández, labora como Vigilante en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, el tiene tres   hijo a su cargo y estos  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado quince   créditos con CEPRODEL durante nueve  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los quince créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, perlines, pintura y clavos para el techo de su casa de habitación ya que el techo de la casa se encontraba en mal estado y en invierno el agua se  pasaba.

Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

José Luis dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sr. José Luis Z. Hernández works as a security guard at the Managua Wholesale Market. He is married and has three dependent children who are in school. José Luis has worked with CEPRODEL for nine years and has received fifteen loans during this time. The money was invested in home improvements. He is an excellent client.

This loan being requested will be used to buy construction materials such as zinc, crossbeams, paint, and nails to repair the roof of his house. Since his roof is in such bad condition, water began seeping through during the winter. José Luis says his objective is to provide greater security and better living conditions for his children. Therefore, all of his loans have been designated for home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof repairs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es: Ana Luisa de 26 años de edad es soltera, tiene un niño de 6 añitos de edad estudiando su primer grado de Educaciòn primaria, trabaja para el poder Judicial de Nueva Guinea desde hace 2 años como secretaria del Juzgado Local civil,  es una joven que se caracteriza por su deseo de superacion profesional y personal, sus compañeros de trabajo expresan que es trabajadora, responsable, muy reconocida en el municipio, su deseo en el futuro es seguir estudiando para ser una profesional con mucha experiencia, está solicitando su 2do credito con el cual pretende  construir una habitaciòn para tener privacidad y mejores condiciones para su hijo, pues desea que crezca en un ambiente agradable que le permita desarrollarse mejor.
texts.en:
Ana Luisa is 26 and single. She has a six year old son who is in first grade in primary school. She has worked for two years as a secretary in the civil court for the judicial power of New Guinea. This young woman is characterized by her desire to succeed professionally and personally. Her work colleagues say that she is hard-working, responsible, and very well-known in the municipality. Her wish for the future is to keep studying to be a professional with a lot of experience. She is requesting her second loan, which she plans on using to build a room to have privacy and better conditions for her son. She wants him to grow in a pleasant atmosphere, which will allow him to develop better.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Martin Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Martin Antonio B. M., labora como higienista en el Mercado de Mayoreo de Managua, el tiene cuatro  hijos a su cargo y tres de ellos  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado once créditos con CEPRODEL durante ocho  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los once créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, cemento, arena y mano de obra para reforzar las paredes de su casa de habitación, ya que estas actualmente están muy débiles.
Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Martin Antonio dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
El Señor Martin Antonio B. M. works as a hygienist in the Mercado de Mayoreo of Managua. He has four children in his care and three of them are school age. He is married. He has had eleven loans from CEPRODEL during eight years; during these years, thanks to financing by CEPRODEL, he has invested the eleven loans in the improvement of his residence. He is an excellent customer. The requested loan will be invested in construction materials such as corrugated metal roofing, cement, and sand and in labor to reinforce the walls of his house. The walls are currently very weak. The objective of all this is to give better security and better living conditions to his children. Martin Antonio said that loans granted had been used to improve his residence.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home Improvement

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nida's Group

texts.en:
Nida F. is from the city of Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 44 years old. Nida is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Nida is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Nida owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fish in the local community. Nida has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Nida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Vicentina's Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORILAZO”, el banco esta conformado por 16 miembros,  ellos viven en la ciudad del Cusco y se reúnen cada treinta días en el distrito de Santiago en la comunidad de Cachona. 

Los socios se dedican al comercio minorista, entre los miembros de este banco tenemos a los socios Gilberto y Crispin que se dedican a la construcción de casas; Los socias Yeni, Felicitas y Vicentina se dedican a la venta de choclo de manera ambulatoria, ellas están preocupadas porque el precio de los choclos ha subido debido a que no hay productos debido a que el caudal del rió vilcanota aumento y arraso la zona agrícola del Valle Sagrado de los Incas donde se cultiva el choclo y las socias Roman y Estefa venden comestible. 
La socia Delia tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene una hija llamada Carla pero también esta embarazada de 6 meses, ella empezó el negocio de crianza de gallinas ponedoras de huevos, ella tiene 20 gallinas que de aquí 3 meses pondrán cada una un huevo por día. Delia requiere el préstamo para implementar el corral de las gallinas comprara 5 calaminas, aumentara más gallinas y comprara alimento para aves. 

Nuestros socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Qorilazo” Communal Bank, which is comprised of 16 members. They live in the city of Cusco, and they meet every 30 days in the Santiago district in the Cachona community. The members devote themselves to the retail trade. Among the members of the bank we have Gilberto and Crispin; they work in house construction. Members Yeni, Felicitas, and Vincentina sell “choclo” (ears of corn) as street vendors. They are worried because the price of the choclos has risen. This is because there are no products due to the water level of the Vilcanota River. It rose and demolished the agricultural area of the Sacred Valley of the Incas. This is where choclo is grown and where the members Roman and Estefa sell food. Member Delia is 29 and in a common law marriage. She has a daughter named Carla, and she is six months pregnant. She started the business of raising egg laying hens. She has 20 hens. In three months each one will lay one egg a day. Delia needs the loan to set up a pen for the hens. She will buy five metal pieces, more hens, and food for the birds. Our members are grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and they promise to make their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To set up a pen for the hens, to buy five metal pieces, more hens, and food for the birds

loans.name: Cynthia Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señorita Cynthia Elizabeth M. tiene dos años dedicándose a su negocio de salón de belleza. 
Pero le está haciendo falta más inmobiliario  y reparaciones al local, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión es por eso que solicita un préstamo. 
En el negocio trabaja ella y su mama este es la fuente de ingresos para salir adelante.
Desean pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtienen del negocio.
texts.en:
Cynthia has been involved in her beauty salon business for the past two years. Now she needs more room and needs to make some repairs, but she doesn’t have the money, so she is asking for a loan. She and her mother work the business and this provides the income for them to move ahead. They will repay the loan with the income from their business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion and repairs

loans.name: La Ñusta Iii Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal ÑUSTA III está formado por 10 socios que son trabajadores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, las socias viven en la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, urbe que se caracteriza por sus paisajes hermosos, su agricultura y su ganadería. 

Los socios se dedican a la venta de verduras, venta de comestibles, venta de flores, venta de frutas y otros socios brindan servicios de construcción de casas y llamadas a celulares móviles de manera ambulante. 

Marisol tiene dos hijos y se dedica a la venta de flores en el mercado modelo de Calca, la socia esta preocupada porque en el mes de enero las lluvias constates hizo que el rió del vilcanota aumentara su caudal entonces derrumbo su casa y el rió arraso con todos sus pertenencias sin poder recuperar sus pertenencias dejando su casa en escombros, Marisol requiere el préstamo para la alimentación de sus hijos y para la matricula del colegio de sus hijos y seguirá sacando adelante a su familia a pesar de las adversidad del clima. 
 
Los otros socios están preocupados por que las ventas han disminuido debido a que los compradores que trabajaban directamente con el turismo dejaron de comprar. Las fuertes lluvias que cayeron por tres días en la ciudad del Cusco hicieron que turistas cancelaron sus reservaciones de viaja a la ciudad del Cusco.  

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "ÑUSTA III" is made up of 10 members who are hardworking and who are always looked for opportunities to get ahead. With their daily efforts they provide a better future for their children. The members live in the Calca province of the Cusco department, an area known for its beautiful countryside, its agriculture and its livestock activities. The members sell vegetables, food, flowers, fruit and some of the other members provide services including the construction of homes and cellular phone services sold on the street. Marisol has 2 children and she sells flowers in the Modelo Market in Calca. She is very worried because in the month of January the constant rain increased the flow of the Vilcanota river, flooding her house. All of her belongings washed away before she could retrieve them and her house was left in ruins. Marisol needs a loan to feed her children and to pay for the schooling of her children so that she can continue to advance her family in spite of the adversities of the weather. The other members are concerned because sales have diminished because the buyers who work directly in the area of tourism are no longer buying. The strong rains that fell for 3 days in the city of Cusco caused the tourists to cancel their reservations to travel to the city of Cusco. The members as a group are grateful for the opportunity provided with this loan, and each member is committed to making their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Mrs. Pak Uk Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Pak U. is a village bank president who has been selected by members of the TrapE. Angk village in the Takeo province. The village bank loan consists of twelve people who will use their loans for different purposes.

Mrs. Pak U. is 39 years old, and she owns a general store in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Phally Leng, is a farmer who owns two hectares of land where he cultivates rice to support his family. Unfortunately, the rice field has infertile soil, and they do not have enough money to improve it. Thus, in order to improve the condition of the family's standard of living, Mrs. Pak U. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer for the field. The remaining part of the loan will be used to buy groceries that she will resell. She is a mother of four children, one of whom helps the parents sell the groceries. Two of her children are enrolled in the local public school, and the youngest one is too young to study or work.

loans.name: Ana Ronila

texts.en:
Ana Ronila M. is one of the very good members of ASHI in San Pedro center. The inspiration of maintaining her excellent performance in ASHI since the time of her membership is drawn from the four most significant blessing she received from GOD. These are her four children whose age ranges are from 10 to 20 years old.  Despite of poverty and small family income, Ana and her family give love and respect to each other. While her husband manages and working in their small business which is a vehicle (particularly motorcycle) repair shop, at home Ana does the household chores and is taking care of their children. 

As her children grew old their family expenses also increases hence, Ana and her husband wanted to enhance their small business through a loan for a capital. Because Ana and her husband are just poor, no one in their village would trust them for a loan. With that, Ana joined ASHI and had found the answer to her problem. Since then, she made her business grow anyhow but not yet to the extent of achieving her dream of making it sustainable. Ana and her husband still want to buy more equipments and machines necessary for the business to improve their efficiency, to improve the quality of service they can give and be able to have more costumers. Therefore she still asks for a much larger amount of loan for its fulfillment. Proceeds of her business will be a great source of finances for Ana to be able to sustain the education of her children until they graduate from college. And by then, their lives will be different and they can have a better and well compensated kind of job.

loans.use: Will be used to purchase necessary equipments such as welding machine and others.

loans.name: Eugenia Beneranda

texts.es:
La Sra. Cárdenas O. Eugenia de52 años de edad vive con su esposo quien la ayuda en el negocio ellos tienen casa propia viven en Fonavi San Martin ellos también fueron afectados por el terremoto pero igual siguen adelante con todas sus ganas de superarse y ayudar a sus hijos.
La Sra. se dedica a la venta de donas y otros pasteles gracias a este trabajo a logrado darle educación a sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda cada día.
Ambos cónyuges gozan de buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos quienes manifiestan que son bien trabajadores y emprendedores.
Ellos desean que le apoyemos para invertir en su negocio en lo que respecta a la venta de insumos para la elaboración de las donas y pasteles.
Su sueño es terminar de mejorar su casa y de darles una carrera a sus hijos.
texts.en:
52 year old Cárdenas lives with her husband who helps her with her business. They have their own home and live in Fonavi San Martin. They were also affected by the earthquake, but they continue to move ahead with their desire to improve their lives and help their children. Cárdenas sells donuts and other pastries. Thanks to this job she has been able to pay for her children’s education and improve her home each day. They both have good references from their neighbors, who say that they are enterprising hard workers. They would like for us to help them invest in their business so that they can buy supplies for making the donuts and pastries. Their dreams are to improve their home and give their children good careers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pastry making supplies

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene S. is from the village of Ospital in Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Eugene is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Eugene owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells lotion, powder, umbrellas, baby oil, shampoo,and other personal products. She also sells fruit, such as mango, in the local community. Eugene has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Eugene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eugene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. Eugene is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Eugene's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rolan

texts.en:
Rolan O. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 27 years old. Rolan is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rolan owns & operates a  "trisikad" transportation service to local community members. A trisikad is a bicycle connected to a passenger coach that is used to transport passengers within the village. Rolan has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Rolan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rolan is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to expand his business. This will be Rolan's first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

loans.name: Mrs. Sinuon Chhat Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of sixteen people, each of whom will use their loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. Sinuon C., the village bank president, was selected by all of the members. They live in in Veay Chhneah Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small plot of land on which she grows rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Chan Doeurn Hav, is a furniture maker in Phnom Penh. This family does not earn much income, although they try to work hard in their businesses. 

Thus, to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sinuon C. decided to request a loan to buy some piglets for breeding. With the rest of the loan, she would like to buy pig food. She is a mother of two children who are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding

loans.name: Sally's Group

texts.en:
Sally R. is from the village of Capellan in Ilagan, Isabela. She is 29 years old. Sally is the leader of a 15-member loan group sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Sally R..

Sally is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Sally owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Sally has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Sally joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sally has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Sally is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Sally's sixth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn V. is one of the most excellent members of the ASHI Center. Despite poverty, she has able to balance her income over her family's expenses. With the income from her "tricycle" (a motorcycle with a sidecar for passengers) business, she repaid her loan on time as well as providing for the basic needs of her family. 

The tricycle that is the source of Marlyn’s family income was purchased by using an ASHI loan. Now that the tricycle’s condition is depreciating, Marlyn is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 to be spent for its maintenance. Her husband, who manages the vehicle, wants to replace some of its parts to improve its quality. 

Despite Marlyn’s financial insufficiency and because of her hard work, she hopes that by growing her business and increasing her profits, she will be able to lift her family up from poverty.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and other necessary materials to repair and maintain her tricycle

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:

To make a living, Emelyn makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Emelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Emelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Emelyn's second loan from HSPFI. loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim S. is 32 years of age and a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She is a widow and a mother caring for a young child. Her child is three years old and enrolled in the primary school. Her mother appears in the picture. Her mother assists her in cooking and caring for her child. 

To earn a living, Lim S. owns and operates a salon where she provides hairdressing and make-up to people who are going to parties in the village. Lim S. needs a loan that she will use, along with her savings, to buy a used motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Ngin

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngin D. is a humble villager living in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She is 43 years old and has established her own small family with other members. She is married to Sara, age 51, a battery charger, and they help each other to care for a teenage child. The child is studying in class 8A and also helps their parent’s business. 

Ngin D. owns a workshop in the local market where she sells foods and many soft drinks to market sellers, for which she earns a profit. Ngin D. always finds it hard traveling because she doesn't have a vehicle. Therefore, she has requested a loan to buy a new motorcycle which will allow her to saving money from taxi fees.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Konr

texts.en:
Mr. Konr V., age 52, is a construction foreman who has many employees to help provide his service. Konr V. is married and has a school-aged child. His wife, who appears in the photo, prepares clothes for industry. 

Konr V. has been very busy at his business because there are many people who order him to construct their buildings. However, he is still lacking the material for construction. Because he doesn’t have money, he decided to ask a loan from Kiva through HKL tto buy more material so he can supply the good services he provides.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Telesforo

texts.en:
Telesforo G. Sr. is from the village of Parog Parog in Solana, Cagayan. He is 54 years old. Telesforo is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Telesforo planting, harvesting, and selling rice. Telesforo has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month frp, these activities.

In 2009, Telesforo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Telesforo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from ASKI. Telesforo is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. This will be Telesforo's third loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy C. is from the village of Dicayas. She is 27 years old. Mary Joy is married and has 2 children. The elder is school-aged and the other one is an infant. To make a living, Mary Joy plants and harvests a variety of vegetables, raises pigs, and also provides "motorcycle for hire" transportation services to local community members. Mary Joy has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP monthly average from these activities.

In 2006, Mary Joy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets and construction materials for housing repair. Mary Joy is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. This will be Mary Joy's 8th loan from PMPC and her second from Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions and save for future needs. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Mr. Tha R., age 52, and his wife, Mrs. Phan Khorn, age 48, have been married for 30 years and have 8 children, four sons and four daughters. Four of them have full-time employment and other four are in school. The family lives in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Tha was not in the photo, but his wife was available instead.

Tha has been a construction worker for 20 years. He sometimes works in his village and sometimes in a nearby village. Because Tha’s children commute to work far away, they take a motor taxi very often. Taking a motor taxi a work is expensive for the family. Therefore, Tha is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for his children to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his children to drive to work.

loans.name: Phanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Phanny C. (shown in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Sokny Un, have been married since 1986. The have four children, a son who is attending school, and three daughters. One of their daughters is married and lives in separate home and two daughters weave silk at home. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Mrs. Phanny C. has been a silk weaver for more than twenty years. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Sokny Un has been a mason for more than seven years. 

Phanny has borrowed one previous Kiva loan. She now is requesting another loan of $250 to purchase silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Odina

texts.ru: Шеров Одина проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 57 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Двое сыновей в России на заработках. Сам Одина более 20 занимается животноводством. Он разводит крупно- рогатый скот. Одина закупает молодых бычков, откармливает и продает их по высокой цене. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Odina S. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 57 years old, married and has 6 children. His wife is a homemaker. Two of their sons are working in Russia. Odina has been involved in animal husbandry for over 20 years. He breeds cattle. Odina buys young bulls, raises them and sells them at a higher price. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sovin

texts.en:
Mr. Sovin P. (pictured here), 51, and his wife, Mrs. Nary Din, 45, live in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They have been married since 1979 and have 4 children: 2 sons and 2 daughters. Two are married and live in their own homes. One son is a mechanic and one daughter goes to school.

Sovin and his wife have been selling dessert for almost ten years. They sell their products at Phnom Penh market. Sovin previously requested a loan to purchase a motorbike for his daughter to drive to school. His daughter uses the motorbike every day. 

He is now asking for another loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for his son to drive to work. He will also use the loan to build a kitchen.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his son to drive to work and to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Chhouk

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhouk R. is a 35 year old, married woman. She currently lives with family members in the province of Kampong Chhnang. Chhouk R. was busy selling fish at the market when the photo was taken, so her husband is shown instead. 

To earn a living, Chhouk R. sells roasted fish that she buys in bulk from her wholesale suppliers. Typically she earns $8 per day. She also relies on the income from her husband’s watch sale trade. Chhouk R. is taking out her first loan to order more roasted fish from her suppliers. She will store the fish for a while and then resell it for income. 

Chhouk R. has five children; four are married and one is single.

loans.use: To buy more roasted fish for resale

loans.name: Kosim

texts.ru: Косимов Косим проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 45 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Косим имеет высшее образование.  Он более 20 лет занимается животноводством. Косим в основном откармливает и продает скот. До этого он преподавал в школе. Косим хочет увеличить количество скота. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Kosim K. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 45 years old, married and has 4 children. Kosim has a higher education. He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 20 years. Kosim mainly raises and sells livestock. Previously, he used to teach at a school. Kosim wants to increase the quantity of livestock. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Mrs Vicenta O. is from Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old and is married with 3 children. She operates a sari-sari (convenience) store but her main source of income comes from her piggery. She has been running her business for more than 4 years and earns approximately 7,400PHP a month.

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 20,000PHP.  She requested a new loan of 30,000PHP from PMPC. This is her 6th loan, the purpose of which is to expand her sari-sari store and to use in her piggery project. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia A. is from the village of Solinog, Calamba, Misamis Occidental.  She is 52 years old, married and has 5 adult children. Dionesia owns & operates a general store where she sells a variety of fish. Dionesia has been running her business for 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Dionesia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living conditions and her ability to engage in business activities. Dionesia successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Dionesia is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Dionesia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George M. W. is fifty-eight years, married and has four children. His business is located at Gatundu near Family Bank in Thika, Kenya and it is well known by the name Ituru Shoe Repair Shop. He makes shoes and sells them to the local people. He also engages in shoe repair and he has been in this business for the last twenty-five years.

He says that his major challenge has been too many people doing the same business as his, so customers are spoilt for choice. He is using his Kes 40,000 loan to purchase leather to make more shoes and for repairs to grow his business.

In future, he hopes to open a big shop for shoe supply. He also has a dream to give his children a good education. He is a very hardworking man.

loans.use: Leather

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine E. has been a member of ASHI for three years. She has had an opportunity through ASHI to find friends and confidants with her 5 women loan group.  The bond that hhas held them together, throughout their years in ASHI was established during their training and was strengthen even more by the problems they have encountered along their way. She is given guidance and support to the group due to the many challenges brought about by poverty. 

Josephine has been very busy building her small fish selling business which she put up using the loans she received through ASHI. She finds it interesting and exciting to attend and meet with her group at their weekly center meeting. Through ASHI and her co members, she has been able to gain the confidence to communicate with people. She applies her daily business, house to house, selling her fish all over their village and in the neighboring villages. Josephine feels exhausted upon arriving home at the end of the day after walking and hawking “fish, fish… who wants to buy fish?!”  But, after  seeing her family happy, especially her children, she feels relieved when they have food to eat and savings for their education, all earned out of her income. Josephine is requesting a larger loan to further increase her business and with the profit be able to sustain the education of her youngest 18 year old child through college.

loans.use: Will be used to purchase a large volume of fish to sell

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada P. is from the village of Senote. She is 47 years old. Diosdada is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Diosdada owns & operates a business "sari-sari" store venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Diosdada has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2005, Diosdada joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Diosdada has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Diosdada is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Diosdada from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. loans.name: Nahashon

texts.en:
Nahashon is 26 years old.  He has been operating a boda-boda (transports people and light goods in town using a bicycle) in the town of Naivasha since 2004.  

He wants to start another business where he repairs broken bicycles and so a friend advised him to join an existing KADET loan group. This will be his first loan. 

His future plans is to increase his bicycle repair business, sell spare parts and also start selling both motorcycles and bicycles.

loans.use: To open a bicycle repair shop

The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products, such as glasses, watches and other ready to wear (RTW) products, in the local community.
