Lilian como toda una mujer visionaria, con deseos de poder mejorar la vida de su familia, inicio su propio negocio, el cual es una venta de ropa para mujeres y niños, y así mismo comercializa productos de belleza como cremas y perfumes. Lilian solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor variedad de ropa y cosméticos, los cuales comercializa de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias de Soyapango. Todo esto lo hace con el anhelo de poder brindarles todo lo mejor a sus hijos, y de esta manera darles una vida digna, la cual este suplida con todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Lilian Roxana S. R., 30, lives in Soyapango with her husband, who is a professor at Universidad Nacional, and their three, minor children, who are students. Lilian, like so many visionary women, wanting to improve her family's life, started her own business, which consists in clothing sales for women and children, as well as the sale of beauty products, like creams and perfumes. Lilian is asking for funding to buy a variety of clothing and cosmetics which she sells throughout Soyapango's different neighborhoods. She does all this with the goal of providing the best for her children and therby giving them a dignified life, one that meets all their needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel H. R. D. G. D. 53 años D. edad, resiD. en el Municipio D. Soyapango. Vive junto a sus dos hijos, los cuales son mayores D. edad y se dedican a trabajar. La señora María Isabel posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, tales como pan, bebidas, y otros productos más. DesD. hace más D. 20 años que posee dicho negocio, el cual le permitió poder criar a sus hijos y poder brindarles estudios y todo lo necesario. María es una señora muy humilD. quien goza D. muy buenas referencias en el lugar D. vivienda, ya que sus vecinos aseguran que es una persona muy trabajadora, y con muy buenos valores. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos los cuales ya posee, y así mismo invertir en nuevos productos, lo cuales le permitan aumentar sus ventas y poder seguir creciendo en su negocio, ya que es esta la única fuente D. ingresos que ella posee para sus gastos personales.
texts.en:
María Isabel H. R. D. G., age 53, lives in the town of Soyapango. She lives near her two children, who are both working adults. María Isabel has a store where she sells perishable goods like bread, beverages and other products. She has had this business for more than 20 years, and it has permitted her to raise, educate and proviD. for her children. María is a very humble woman who has excellent personal references. Her neighbors assure us that she is a very hard-working woman with very good values. María is asking for a loan so she can buy more of the products she already carries and also invest in new products. This will allow her to increase her sales and begin growing her business, since it is her only source of income for covering personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perishable products

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is 32 years old; he is married with a child. His child is two years old. Christopher is a business man and he sells rechargeable phone cards at wholesale and retail prices to his customers. Christopher wishes to increase his sales. He hopes for a loan amount of NGN 60,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy skin creams and perfumes.

loans.name: Reina Aminta

texts.es: Reina Aminta Q. R. de 56 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su hijo el cual asiste a la universidad y a su pequeña hija de 7 años de edad, la cual estudia educación básica. Reina posee un comedor, el cual esta ubicado a las afueras de su hogar, lugar en el que se encarga de elaborar y vender la comida. Desde hace muchos años que posee este negocio, lo que le ha permitido contar con mucha clientela, la cual asegura que Reina es una mujer muy trabajadora, quien se esfuerza por realizar de la mejor manera su trabajo. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda compra: verduras, carne de pollo y de res, jugos, granos básicos y otros elementos más, los cuales son necesarios  para la elaboración de platillos. Reina es una mujer muy responsable quien trabaja mucho para poder brindarles todo lo necesario para sus hijo, ya que ella es madre soltera, lo que hace que cada día que pasa ella cuente con todos los deseos del mundo para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Reina is 56 years old and lives in Soyapango, located in the San Salvador department. She lives with her son, who attends the university, and her young seven year old daughter who attends school. Reina has an eatery collocated in her home, where she cooks and sells her food. She has run this business for many years and has many regular customers, which makes her a hard working woman who puts a lot of effort into her job. She is requesting this loan in order to buy vegetables, meats (chicken and beef), juices, basic grains, and other ingredients she needs to create her dishes. Reina is a very responsible woman who works to provide everything necessary to her children. She is a single mother who does whatever it takes to get ahead and achieve her world’s desires.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients for her business

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La Sra. Antonia tiene 50 años y  esta casada con el Sr. Carlos M. D. 52 años, cuentan con 4 hijos todos ellos trabajando actualmente.
 La familia se dedica actualmente a la venta en  D. ropas en su domicilio, actualmente cuenta con una buena cantidad D. clientes y la venta lo realiza saliendo a recorrer por los alrededores D. la ciudad.
Le gustaría  abrir en su domicilio un salón D. ventas D. ropas ya que le es incomodo recorrer, y por poseer varios clientes.
texts.en:
Antonia, age 50, is married to Carlos M., age 52. They have four children who are currently working. At present the family sells clothes. They have a good amount of customers, and they make sales by going to the outskirts of the city. She would like to open a place to sell clothes in her home because it is uncomfortable traveling to their various customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes like t-shirts, dresses, blouses, and others

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent owns a boutique where he sells clothes, like trousers and shirts. He is 28 years old and single without children. He hopes to get married very soon. Vincent hopes and aspires to grow and expand his business. He is requesting a loan amount of NGN 60,000 to purchase more clothes to sell and attract more profits. He has a good relationship with LAPO. He is itching for a significant expansion in his business. He says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 40-year-old woman; she is married to E. and they have two children. Her husband is a civil servant and they live in Sapele, Delta State. Mary sells baby items, clothes and sarongs to make a living. She has been in this business for 15 years. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She needs a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more baby things, clothes and sarongs to sell. Mary is a LAPO client. She is itching for a significant expansion in her business. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby items, clothes and sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres De Dios En Progreso 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Sonia is the coordinator of her group Mujeres de Dios en Progreso (Women of God in Progress), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, an area in the north of the Dominican Republic dependent on a fading tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple, wooden structure as a single mother with her three children.

Sonia is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing by purchasing a dozen pairs of pants, skirts, brassieres and panties in the main market in Santiago and then selling them for a profit in her village. She will use the profits to invest in her family by changing the walls from wood to cement block, an addition that can pay serious dividends on health and stability in a country where hurricanes are frequent and termites are ravenous. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase pants, skirts, brassiers and panties to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a posho mill.

loans.name: Mimasuyanday Group

texts.en: Isatu S., on the right of the photo, is the leader of this group of local entrepreneurs who named their group "Mimasuyanday". They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders for the first time to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person for the purpose of expanding their businesses. Twenty-three-year-old Isatu sells a wide variety of items – fish, soft drinks, bathing soaps, candles, glue, water, etc. She has been a businesswoman for 3 years now. Married to a soldier, they have 2 children; one is in primary school and the other is not of school age. Isatu wants this loan in order to expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items in large quantities.

loans.use: to buy fish, soft drinks, bathing soaps, candles, glue, water, etc.

loans.name: Shameness Group

texts.en: Kumba S., who is on the right of the photo, is the leader of this group of local entrepreneurs who named their group Shameness, a Krio word. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders for the first time to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person for the purpose of expanding their businesses. Fifty-six-year-old Kumba has been selling pepper, onions and palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) for 2 years now. Kumba was born in Kabala town, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a soldier and they have 3 children – all of whom are attending primary schools. Kumba wants this loan in order to expand her business by buying pepper, onions, and palm-oil in large quantities.

loans.use: To buy pepper, onions, and palm-oil in large quantities to sell.

loans.name: Groundnut Group

texts.en: Salamatu M. who is on the right of the photo, is the leader of this group of local entrepreneurs who named their group Groundnut, named after the business of the group’s leader. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders for the first time to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person for the purpose of expanding their businesses. Thirty-two-year-old Salamatu sells ground-nut/peanuts in retail. She has been a businesswoman for 7 years now. Salamatu, who was born in Kamakwe town, in northern Sierra Leone, is married to a soldier and they have 6 children; one is already grown-up and on his own, and the rest are still attending schools. Salamatu wants this loan in order to expand her business by buying ground-nuts in wholesale and then retailing them at the Makeni Teko Barracks.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts in wholesale to sell.

loans.name: People Yone Group

texts.en: Musu T., who is on the right of the photo, is the leader of this group of local entrepreneurs who named their group People Yone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders for the first time to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person for the purpose of expanding their businesses. Twenty-five-year-old Musu sells market-food – oil, onions, salt, fish, Maggie (used to give sauce a sweet taste), ground-nut/peanuts, pepper, sugar and many more items. She has been a businesswoman for 3 years now. Musu, who was born in a village named Maseka, in northern Sierra Leone, is married to a soldier and they have 3 children; one is in primary school, one in secondary school and the other is not of school age. Musu wants this loan in order to expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items in wholesale.

loans.use: To buy oil, onions, salt, fish, Maggie, ground-nut/peanuts, pepper, sugar and many more items to sell.

loans.name: Member Group

texts.en: Aminata K., who is on the left of the photo, is the leader of this group of local entrepreneurs who named their group “Member,” a Krio word meaning “Think”. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders for the first time to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person for the purpose of expanding their businesses. Forty-two-year-old Aminata sells cooked foofoo (a food made out of cassava roots). She has been a businesswoman for 4 years now. Aminata, who was born in Port Loko, in northern Sierra Leone, is married and has 4 children; two are in primary school and two are in secondary school. Aminata wants this loan in order to expand her business by buying bags of raw foofoo, and cooking ingredients like palm-oil, fish, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.use: To buy bags of raw foofoo, palm-oil, fish, margi, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Annick

texts.fr: Annick D. est âgée de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Depuis 4 ans elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Mboro et y a bénéficié de 8 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés à temps. Elle fait un petit commerce tissus et d'effets de toilettes. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale et la scolarisation des enfants.
texts.en:
Annick D. is 39 years old, she is married and the mother of 5 children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Mboro for the past 4 years and has received 8 loans from the organization, all of which were fully repaid on time. She has a small business selling cloth and toiletries. Her goal is to help her husband pay for the needs of their family and their children's tuition.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Exitosas 123 Group

texts.en:
Lucia is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Exitosas (Successful Women), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a town on the north coast reliant on a fading tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and five children.

Lucia is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing and making sheets and curtains. She will do so by purchasing brassieres and panties in the main market in Santiago as well as cloth to sew her sheets and curtains. She will use the profits to invest in her business by constructing a commercial venue as part of her home and to invest in her family by purchasing school supplies for her children. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase a dozen panties, brassieres, and cloth to sew curtains and sheets to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.fr: Anna F. est une femme de 49 ans, elle est divorcée et mère de 4 enfants en charge. Elle a une bonne expérience en matière de crédit pour en avoir bénéficié à 17 fois de suite. Elle fait de la porcherie et comme activité secondaire elle développe une petite unité de maraîchage. Son objectif est de prendre en charge ses enfants et de pouvoir faire face à leurs sollicitations.
texts.en:
Anna F. is a 49 year old woman, she is divorced and the mother of 4 children. She is experienced in loans, having benefitted from 17 loans in the past. She has a pigpen and as a secondary activity she has a small plot for farming. Her goal is to be able to take care of her children and their needs.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her capacity to invest in her business

loans.name: El Hadji

texts.fr: Monsieur El Hadj N.   est un célibataire âgé de 39 ans. Il s’active dans la restauration  et pratique également le métier de chauffeur. Il assistait son cousin dans sa pâtisserie et lorsque ce dernier s’émigra en Europe, Monsieur  N. hérita ce commerce de restauration. Ainsi comme il est membre  de U-IMCEC Bambey une ville située à 120 Kms de Dakar, Monsieur El Hadji N. souhaitait un financement de 400 000  FCFA  pour le business. Il compte ravitailler sa boutique d’alimentation en boissons, jus et des conserveries, acheter un mouton pour sa dibiterie et des poulets .
texts.en:
Mr. El Hadj N. is a single 39 year old man. His business is food service and also as a taxi driver. He assisted his cousin in his cousin's bakery and when his cousin emigrated to Europe, Mr. N. inherited this restaurant. As a member of U-IMCEC Bambey, in a city located 120 kilometers from Dakar, Mr. El Hadji N. is requesting a 400 000 FCFA loan for his business. He intends to use this loan to stock his store with drinks, juices and jams; additionally, he intend to purchase a sheep and chickens for grilled meats.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To restock his business

loans.name: Woly

texts.fr: Madame Woly F. est une commerçante âgée de 41 ans. Mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle compte une bonne expérience (20 ans)  dans son métier qu’elle a embrassé pour subvenir à ses besoins.  Cependant, comme elle est membre d’U-IMCEC Bambey, elle vient solliciter un financement de 100 000 FCFA pour les besoins de son commerce. Elle compte acheter des produits hivernaux  c’est-à-dire du mil, arachide, niébés, oseilles (bissap) et pain de singe.  Ainsi avec ce commerce, elle tient le seul moyen de disposer d’argent dans la campagne et de pouvoir honorer ses cotisations familiales et sociales.
texts.en:
Ms. Woly F., aged 41, is a merchant who is married and the mother of three children.  She has good experience (20 years) in her trade, which she has embraced in order to provide for herself.  However, since she is a member of U-IMCEC Bambey, she is here to requesting financing in the amount of 100,000 francs CFA for her business needs.  She intends to buy wintertime goods, that is, millet, peanuts, black-eyed peas, dried hibiscus flowers (bissap), and 'monkey bread' (the fruit of the baobab tree).  And so, with this business, she possesses the sole means for having money in the countryside and being able to keep her family and societal commitments.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying grains

loans.name: Justino Alonso

texts.es: Justino Alonso tiene 40 años, este hombre es una persona muy dedicada la venta de mercadería en general, no es el único trabajo que posee ya que además el labora en un lugar como mesero en el restaurante Tip- Top, el se levanta muy tempranos los días de semana para ofrecer su materia prima que es tan importante para ofrecer a ciertos clientes que obtiene. El necesita este capital de trabajo para la compra de sandalias, zapatillas, zapatos deportivos, vestidos, shorts, camisetas, ropa interior, pantalones y perfumes. El desea proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda y no tiene todas las condiciones necesarias.
texts.en:
Justino Alonso is 40 years old. He is very dedicated to selling general merchandise. This is not the only work he has. He also works as a waiter in the Tip-Top restaurant. He gets up early during the week to offer his raw material, which is so important to sell to certain of his customers. He needs this working capital to buy sandals, shoes, tennis shoes, dresses, shorts, t-shirts, underwear, pants and perfume. He wants to make improvements on his home, and he does not have all of the necessary conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: Élisabeth T. est une femme de 51 ans, elle est mariée et a une bonne expérience en matière de crédit pour en avoir bénéficié à 17 fois de suite. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MBORO depuis 8 ans et demi. Elle fait de l'élevage de porcs et de moutons et ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Élisabeth T. is a 51-year-old woman who is married.  She has a good credit history from having benefited from seventeen consecutive loans.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de MBORO for 8½ years.  Élisabeth raises pigs and sheep, and her profits enable her to take part in improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintaining her commercial work

loans.name: God Dae Group

texts.en: Mariama K. who is on the right of the photo, is the leader of this group of local entrepreneurs who named their group God Dae. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders for the first time to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person for the purpose of expanding their businesses. Thirty-two-year-old Mariama sells head-ties, bowls, dishes and women’s clothes. She has been in this business for 2 years now. Mariama was born in Bo City, in southern Sierra Leone. She is married to a soldier and they have 2 children, one in primary school and the other in secondary school. Mariama wants this loan in order to expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items in wholesale.

loans.use: To buy head-ties, bowls, dishes and women’s clothes to sell.

loans.name: Esmirna 4-5 Group

texts.en:
Greysy is the coordinator of her group, Esmirna, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their child.

Greysy is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a beauty salon by investing in a line of hair products (including shampoos, rinses and dyes) to sell in her salon as well as in an iron for straightening hair. She will use the profits to invest in her home by continuing construction to complete her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase hair products and a hair iron.

loans.name: Simone Mbasse

texts.fr: Simone Mbasse T. est une femme de 52 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Depuis 8 ans et demi elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MBORO et a 17 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Avec son nouveau prêt elle va développer un petit commerce de produits divers tels que des effets vestimentaires et de toilette. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille et d'assurer en partie la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Simone Mbasse T. is a 52-year-old woman who is married and the mother of six children.  For 8½ years, she has been a member of Banc Villageois de MBORO and has benefited from seventeen consecutive loans.  With her new loan, she is going to develop a small business involving a variety of goods, such as toiletries and clothing-related accessories.  Her goal is to take part in providing for the family and making sure her children have schooling. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Advancing her commercial work

loans.name: Lineth

texts.es: Lineth de 35 años de edad, vive en el barrio Linda Vista de Nueva Guinea, es madre soltera de un niño de 11 años estudiando  6to grado de educaciòn primaria,  labora como secretaria adminsitrativa de la corte suprema de Justicia desde hace  3 años y tres meses, esta solicitando su 3er crèdito con el fondo kiva para terminar la construccion de una tapia y un anexo, el cual le permitira brindarle mejores comodidades a su familia,  recientemente acaba de terminar de estudiar un post grado en la Universidad Uraccan, se caracteriza por ser muy responsable, honesta y con mucho deseos de superaciòn personal y profesional,  el sueño de Lineth es tener trabajo y que su hijo estudie para que sea un hombre de bien y que sea util a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Lineth, age 35, lives in the Linda Vista neighborhood of New Guinea. She is the single mother of an 11 year old son who is in sixth grade. She has worked as an administrative secretary to the Supreme Court of Justice for three years and three months. She is requesting her third loan from Kiva to finish building a wall and an annex, which will give her family better amenities. She recently finished her post graduate studies in the Uraccan University. She is characterized as being very responsible, honest, and having a lot of desire for personal and professional success. Lineth’s dream is to have work and that her son studies so that he can become an upstanding citizen and useful to society.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall and an annex

loans.name: Iris Amelia

texts.es: Iris Amelia de 35 años de edad es soltera,  trabaja para el poder Judicial de Nueva Guinea desde hace 3 años y medio como responsable de recursos Humanos, està solicitando su segundo crèdito con el cual pretende construir una habitaciòn con mejores condiciones para tener  mayor comodidad en el hogar, y espera seguir siendo beneficiada con el fondo kiva.  Viaja todos los fines de semana a pasar con su familia en el Almendro Rio San Juan, es una mujer profesional con alto espiritu de superacion profesional y laboral, es muy responsable, honesta y de buenas costumbres y  muy querida por sus amigos, compañeros de trabajo y su familia, ella se siente agradecida con AFODENIC por la atenciòn que se le a brindado.
texts.en:
Iris Amelia is 35 and single. She has worked for the Judicial Authority of New Guinea for three and a half years. She is in charge of Human Resources. She is requesting her second loan to build a room with better conditions to make her home more comfortable. She hopes to continue to receive the benefit of a loan from Kiva. Every weekend she travels to the Almendro Rio San Juan to spend time with her family. She is a professional woman with a great spirit for professional self-improvement. She is very responsible, honest, and has good habits. She is very dear to her friends, colleagues, and family. She is grateful to Afodenic for the attention that they have given her.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Marie Madeleine

texts.fr: Marie Madeleine N. est une femme de 59 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois depuis 8 ans et demi et y a bénéficié de 17 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés sans difficulté. Elle fait un petit commerce d'effets vestimentaires et de toilette. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari admis à la retraite depuis plus de 5ans dans la prise de la famille, et d'assurer partiellement le payement de la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Marie Madeleine N. is 59 years old, married and the mother of six children. She has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” loan group for the past 8 ½ years, and has always managed well and repaid her 17 previous loans without any problems. She runs a small shop retailing articles of clothing and toiletries. Her objective is to assist her husband, retired for over five years, in providing family support, and to pay a portion of her children’s tuition fees.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her commercial activity

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Doña Sofia de 60 años de edad habita en la Comarca La Peña, jurisdiccion de Tecolostote-San Lorenzo, junto a su familia compuesta por su esposo el Sr. Carlos Lopez con quien procreo 4 hijos, los que tienen la edad de 16, 19, 21 y años, los cuales estudian y ayudan con los quehaceres de la casa. Tiene mas de 20 años de trabajar en el campo sembrando hortalizas las cuales comercializa para el sustento familiar.  Esta solicitando su 1er credito con el objetivo de mejorar su casa, levantando paredes minifalda (mitad pared y mitad madera), puesto que la casa es toda de madera y con la humedad se le esta dañando y desea hacer esto para brindar mayor seguridad a su familia.  Cuenta con el apoyo de toda su familia para este proyecto, pues juntos trabajan para salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Sofia, 60, lives in La Peña, Tecolostote-San Lorenzo, with her family, which is made up of her husband and four children, who are 16, 19 and 21 years old; all are students and help with household chores. She has been a vegetable farmer for over 20 years. She sells her product to earn income tu support her family. She is asking for her first loan to make some home improvements, specifically to build walls that will be half wood and half block because the house is currently all wood and the humidity is damaging it. She hopes to make these improvement to offer better security to her family. Her family support her in this effort because they all work together to get ahead and improve family life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build three walls.

loans.name: Jose Bernardo

texts.es:
el señor Jose Bernardo Z. G. tiene 35 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Yorleny Sanchez y tienen 3 hijos.
Juntos comenzaron un negocio de venta de golosinas pero como el lugar es muy transitado decidieron poner  una pulperia. 
fue una buena idea ya que estan teniendo muchas ventas y con esta actividad generan ingresos para darles educacion a sus hijos.
Jose esta solicitando el credito para poder surtir un poco mas su negocio y asi tener mas equipada su pulperia y tener mejores ventas y mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Jose Bernardo Z. G. is 35 years old. He is married to Yorleny Sanchez, and the couple has 3 children. Together, they started a business selling snacks. Finding that the location was frequented by many people, they decided to open a general store. It was a good idea, and they have had high levels of sales. Through this activity, they are generating enough income to provide their children with an education. Jose is requesting this loan in order to expand the store's inventory a little more, so that the general store will be better-equipped and generate higher sales and more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing soft drinks, juices, water, fruits, vegetables, fried snacks, beans, shortening, oil, rice and sugar

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es: Jose Miguel de 35 años de edad es casado, tiene 3 niños, el mayor Willi de 16 años estudia la secundaria, y los menores de 8 y 6 años estudian la primaria, su esposa Fanny trabaja como vendedora en la tienda Novia Linda para obtener ingresos adicionales que le permitan apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.  En su familia el es conocido por Miguel, y trabaja como carpintero de su propio taller ubicado en su casa desde hace mas de 20 años, en donde elabora muebles de todo tipo.  Esta solicitando su 1er credito a esta institucion para mejorar la vivienda en que vive levantando 3 paredes, pues actualmente habitan en un pequeño cuarto de madera, por lo que solicita el apoyo de Kiva para bridarle a su familia mayor seguridad y comodidad.  El mayor sueño que tiene es que sus hijos estudien y sean hombres de bien y poder brindarles las condiciones de vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Jose Miguel is 35 years old, and is married with 3 children. The oldest, Willi, is 16 years old and studies at secondary school. The younger ones, 8 and 6, study at primary school. Jose Miguel's wife Fanny works as a sales assistant in the shop Novia Linda to obtain additional earnings which permit her to support her husband with the household costs. In his family he is known as Miguel, and has worked for over 20 years as a carpenter in his own workshop located in his house, where he makes all type of furniture. He is seeking his first loan from this institution to improve his home, constructing 3 walls. He actually lives in a small wooden room, for which he is seeking Kiva's support to give his family better security and comfort. Jose's biggest dream is that his children study and be good men, and that he can grant them the standard of living that they deserve.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build 3 concrete walls

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Doña Elena de 46 años de edad,  habita en la comarca El Caracol junto a su familia compuesta por su esposo el señor Armando Guerra y sus 6 hijos, el mayor de 26 años, otro de 22 años, de 19 años, de 16 años, de 13 años y el menor de 10 años, de estos solamente los 2 menores estan estudiando la primaria, los mayores apoyan con trabajo productivo de la finca. Esta solicitando su 3er credito esperando ser beneficiada con kiva para compra  de terneros de desarrollo, los cuales pretende engordar para comercializarlos cuando obtengan un buen peso, y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias que le permitan el sosten familiar. Doña Elena desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la actividad ganadera, lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia, su voluntad y anhelo es aprovechar su propiedad, ya que con el poco ganado propio no le aprovecha a capacidad sus recursos de su finca
texts.en:
Elena is 46 years old, and lives in the El Caracol area together with her family, composed of her husband Armando Guerra and their 6 children. The oldest is 26, and the others are 22, 19, 16. 13 and 10. Of these, only the 2 youngest are studying at primary school - the older ones support the family by working on the farm. Elena is seeking her third loan, hoping to be favoured by Kiva to purchase calves to raise, which she will fatten to sell when they reach a good weight. In this way she will obtain better earnings that permit her to sustain her family. Since Elena was very young she has dedicated herself to farming activities, which have allowed her to improve her family's situation. Her will and yearning is to make the most of her property, as with the little she earns she doesn't make the most of the farm's resources.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves to raise

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia A. esta casada con el señor Eugenio Maldonado con quien tiene varios hijos, todos mayores de edad.
Lucia anteriormente se dedicaba a la  venta de empanadas en forma ambulante en la parte central. Un día decidió fabricarlas ella misma, fue así que recurrió a la Fundación Paraguaya para solicitar un prestamos y para la compra de una amasadora manual y una fritadora a gas. Todo le fue a la perfección, en la actualidad Lucia fabrica sus empanadas en su casa y por la demanda que tiene ya no es necesario que ella salga a vender en forma ambulante.
En un futuro próximo quiere seguir ampliando su clientela fabricando mas y mas empanadas.
texts.en:
Lucia A. is married to Eugenio Maldonado, with whom she has several children, all grown up. Lucia used to sell empanadas on foot in the central part of the city. One day she decided to make them herself, so she resorted to Fundación Paraguaya to seek a loan to purchase a manual kneading machine and a gas fryer. Everything went well for her, and Lucia now makes her empanadas in her house, and with the demand that she has it's not necessary that she leaves to sell them on foot. In the future she wants to continue increasing her customers and making more and more empanadas.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat, flour, eggs, and a kneading machine

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alcidiades Enrique

texts.es: Don Alcidiades de 49 años de edad,  habita en la comarca El Caracol junto a sus 2 hijos, el mayor de 21 años y el menor de 18 años, quienes lo apoyan con trabajo productivo de la finca. Esta solicitando su 4to credito esperando contar con el apoyo kiva para compra  de terneros de desarrollo, los cuales pretende engordar para comercializarlos cuando obtengan un buen peso, y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias que le permitan el sosten familiar. Alcidiades cuenta con la experiencia necesaria pues labora en la actividad agropecuaria desde hace mas de 30 años. El mayor sumitido sacar adelante a su familia, su mayor sueño es lograr incrementar su hato ganadero para obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan dejarle un buen patrimonio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alcidiades is 49 years old, and lives in the region of El Caracol together with his 2 children. The oldest is 21 and the younger is 18, and they support him by working on the farm. He is seeking his fourth loan, hoping to count on the support of Kiva to purchase calves to raise, which he will fatten to sell once they reach a good weight. In this way he will obtain better earnings which permit him to sustain his family. Alcidiades has the necessary experience for farming, as he has worked in agriculture for more than 30 years. He has improved his family's life, and his biggest dream is to achieve expanding his farm to obtain better profits which permit him to give good wealth to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves to raise

loans.name: Nicolas Migdonio

texts.es: Don Nicolas de 44  años de edad, vive en union libre con la Sra. Maribel Lumbi, habitan junto a sus padres y hermanos en la Comarca Boca Azul del municipio de Muelle de los Bueyes, quienes le ayudan con el cuido de la finca y el ganado. Don Nicolas esta solicitando su 6to credito a AFODENIC con el objetivo de comprar terneros para engordarlos y desarrollarlos y posteriormente comerciarlizarlos a un mejor precio que le permita obtener mejores ganancias que le permita el sustento familiar. Cuenta con la experiencia necesaria para esta actividad, pues tiene mas de 31 años de trabajar con ganado.  Espera contar con el apoyo de kiva para lograr establecer esta compra.  Su mayor sueño es lograr incrementar su hato ganadero para obtener mejores ganancias, pues es el patrimonio de su familia.
texts.en:
Don Nicolas is 44 years old and in a common law marriage with Sra. Maribel Lumbi. They live with his parents and siblings in the area called Boca Azul in the town of Muelle de los Bueyes. Nicolas and his family help each other with looking after the farm and raising cattle.

He is requesting his sixth loan from AFODENIC in order to buy calves to fatten and raise so that he can sell them later at a higher price. This helps him to improve his income for supporting his family. Nicolas has the necessary experience because he has been working with cattle for more than 31 years. He hopes to have the support of Kiva in successfully completing this acquisition. His greatest wish is to increase his cattle herd so that he can improve his earnings and provide an inheritance for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Eveling

texts.es:
La señora Eveling G. R., vive en el humilde Barrio La Primavera, tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera de una hija de que tiene bajo su cargo, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas por el día y en la noche tiene una fritanga, vende cosmeticos por encargo, ella es una mujer activa que no cuenta con la ayuda de nadie y tiene el firme objetivo de formar a su hija y ofreserle los estudios necesarios para que tenga las herramientas para valerse por sus propios méritos. 

Dentro de las mayores aspiraciones que tiene la señora esta la edificación de su hogar y conseguir un buen punto de venta que le brinde una mejor estabilidad económica, ella solicita de un prestamo que le ayude a realizar compras para un mayor inventario de mercaderia que pueda ofertar entre sus clientes y ayudarle a la mejora continua a su económia doméstica.
texts.en:
Eveling G. R., 55, lives in the humble, La Primavera neighborhood. She is a single mother of a daughter, who is under her care. She sells fruit during the day and fried food at night. She also sells catalogue cosmetics. She is an active woman who doesn't have anyone to help her but has the firm goal in mind to raise her daughter and offer her the necessary education so that she will have the tools needed to succeed on her own merits. Among her greatest wishes is to build her house and get a good sales location so that she will have better economic stability. She is requesting financing to buy more stock inventory so that she will have a wider variety of products to offer her customers and, thereby, improved family finances.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy herbicide

loans.name: Amalia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora Amalia A. Se dedica a Trabajar arduamente en el  Departamento de León en la actividad de cocinera. a traviesa la necesidad de invertir en el mejoramiento de su vivienda , ya que ha estado en malas condiciones y es madre soltera con 3 hijos que mantener. 
Solicita el crédito para realizar la compra de materiales de construcción tales como: laminas de zinc, hierro, bloque, bolsa de cemento entre otros. Con este crédito le brindará a sus hijos un techo digno donde vivir.
texts.en:
Amalia A. lives in León department and works as a cook. She needs to invest in some home improvements because her dwelling is in poor condition and she's a single mother with three children to support. She asks for funding to buy building materials and supplies like: zinc metal sheeting, iron, concrete blocks, a sack of cement, etc. This loan will allow her to provide her children with a proper place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Santos Marcos

texts.es: Santos Marcos de 39  años de edad, es casado con la Sra. Miriam Gonzalez Vargas, habitan junto a sus padres y sus hermanos en la Comarca Boca Azul del municipio de Muelle de los Bueyes, quienes le ayudan en la actividad agropecuaria. Santos desde la edad de 14 años empezo su vida como pequeño productor y ha logrado mejorar su estilo de vida. Esta solicitando a AFODENIC financiamiento de su 7mo credito para la compra de terneros de desarrollo, con el objetivo de engordarlos y poderlos vender en buen precio y lograr obtener mejores ganancias que le permita el sustento familiar e ir tratando de superar la crisis economica que estamos afrentando. Su mayor sueño es lograr incrementar su hato ganadero para obtener mejores ganancias, pues es el patrimonio de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos Marcos is 39, and married to Mrs. Miriam Gonzalez Vargas. They live together with their parents and brothers and sisters in the Boca Azul region of the Muelle de los Bueyes town. The family helps him with the farming. When Santos was 14, he started as a small producer, and he has been able to improve his quality of life. He is asking AFODENIC for financing with a 7 month loan to buy young beef cows. He will fatten them up and sell them at a good price to succeed in getting better income to support his family, and to continue trying to overcome the economic crisis that we are currently facing. His biggest dream is to be able to increase his herd of cattle to obtain more income, since that is the family’s patrimony.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy young cattle to fatten up

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha Lorena tiene 46 años, es una persona responsable. Ella se dedica a una pulpería, por lo que tiene más de 10 años de realizar esta labor. Ella realizo muchos sacrificios para mejorar sus ingresos ya comenzó con muy poco capital porque no tenía el apoyo de su familia, algunas veces dejaba a sus hijos solos porque salía al mercado en busca de los diferentes productos. Pero gracias a su duro trabajo logro preparar a sus 2 hijos que laboran de manera independiente. Ella solicita este crédito para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas en general, gaseosas, refrescos naturales entre otros productos. Su deseo es obtener una gran fama en su negocio y que su pulpería sea mucho más grande.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena, 46, is a responsible person. She has had a small grocery store for over 10 years. Her business started thanks to many personal sacrifices because, in order to improve her earnings, she started off with very little capital; she had no help from her family. Sometimes she had to leave her children unattended when she'd go to market in search of various products. However, thanks to all her hard work, she succeeded in raising her two children so that they could work independently. She is asking for funding to buy basic stock items for her store: grains, soft-drinks, fruit juices, etc. Her wish is to be well-known for her work and that her store become much larger.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory for her store.

loans.name: Atilano

texts.es:
El señor Atilano esta casado con la señora Silvia Noguera con quien tiene 5 hijos, Gloria de 33 años, Maria de 32 años, Norma de 30 años, Juan de 23 años y Marcelo de 20 años.
Cuando Atilano tenia 18 años de edad su madre le pidió para que le repare su radio, entonces don Atilano se puso a experimentar por la citada radio, hasta que pudo solucionar el desperfecto. Fue así que desidio estudiar electrónica que le llevo 3 años de estudio, al terminar los mismo desidio abrir su propio local de reparación de televisores y radios.
Desde entonces tiene una buena cantidad de cliente.
Atilano Hemosilla decidió comprar un vehículo para el traslado de los televisores, radios y otros artículos de electrónica que repara a los domicilios de los diferentes clientes
En un futuro próximo Atilano quiere seguir ampliando su clientela y continuar perfeccionándose con sus 61 años.
texts.en:
Atilano is married to Silvia Noguera. They have five children: Gloria, 33, Maria, 32, Norma, 30, Juan, 23, and Marcelo, 20. When Atilano was 18 years old, his mother asked him to repair her radio. Atilano started to tinker with the radio until he was able to figure out how to repair it. This led him to study electronics; it took him three years. When he finished his training, he opened a radio and television repair shop. Since then, he has had a good number of customers. Atilano H. decided to buy a vehicle to transport the television sets, radios and other electric appliances that he repairs, to his customers' homes. In the future, Atilano wants to continue to expand his customer base and continue, even at the age of 61, to self improve.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a vehicle.

loans.name: Arturo's Group

texts.en:
Arturo is the coordinator of his group Unidos Venceremos (United We Will Succeed), and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. His group is located in La Romana, a town famous for sugarcane and tourism, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home here in a simple structure with his wife and two children.

Arturo is excited to be taking his fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loans and grown his business. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business selling sandals on the beach by purchasing more merchandise to sell. He will use the profits to invest in his home by purchasing a computer for his children to learn on as well as backpacks and notebooks for school for his children. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase sandals to sell.

loans.name: Ivania Vaneska

texts.es: La joven Ivania tiene la edad de 28 años,  ha sido una mujer esforzada, para salir adelante en sus estudios, es casada, y tiene una niña de un año de edad, que cuida su mama,  su esposo trabaja como cobrador en la empresa Café Soluble. Ella trabaja en un banco desempeñándose como cajera, tiene un año laborando a la institución pero su salario es bajo y trabaja hasta los fines de semana en los comerciales nuevo en la capital en donde gana esas extras, lo cual abecés no logra estar mas tiempo con su familia y la otra dificultad es que sale muy tarde y va con miedo en la ruta por la delincuencia que asecha.  Sus planes es lograr un asenso y poder obtener otro puesto que le genere ganar mejor para poder lograr terminar de hacer las mejoras a su pequeña casa que junto con su esposo han logrado construir, este préstamo lo solicito por que tiene la necesidad de poder hacer el baño y  no cuenta con el dinero en efectivo, para la obra es por eso solicito Afodenic quien esta dando la oportunidad para que realice estas mejora. Lo cual estoy contenta por hacer el baño para una mejor privacidad y higiene en mi casa. Para esto comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para y piso para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Ivania is 28 years old and has worked hard to get ahead in her studies. She is married and has a one year old daughter, who her mother helps care for. Her husband works as a collector for the Café Soluble plant. She works as a teller in a bank. She has been doing this for one year, but her salary is low. She also works with the new businesses in the capital city on the weekends, where she can earn a little extra, but this limits the time she is able to spend with her family. She also gets off of work very late and she is often afraid when traveling home, because of the crime along her route. Her plans are to move into another position that will provide better income, which will allow her to complete the improvements to her small home, which she and her husband have managed to build. She requested this loan because she needs to complete her bathroom and she doesn’t have the money for the labor. This is why she reached out to Afodenic, who is providing the opportunity to make these improvements. “I am happy to be able to complete the bathroom in order to have better privacy and a more hygienic home.” She has already purchased building materials, such as stone, sand, cement, iron, and flooring to begin the work.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials and lobor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy cloth

loans.name: Edith Xiomara

texts.es:
La señora Edith Xiomara L. C., de 44 años de edad, vive en la Unidad de Proposito, es casada y su marido es ejecutivo de ventas y le apoya económicamente, ellos tienen 4 hijos.

Ella tiene una pulperia desde hace 3 años, pero dentro de las dificultades que le han golpeado su economía han sido las bajas ventas, ella para esto desea invertir en nuevos productos de consumo en masa que le pueden abrir nuevas oportunidades de mercado y mejorias a la economia del hogar. Dentro de las aspiraciones de la familia estan la preparación educativa de sus hijos para esto ella espera que se le brinde un apoyo, pues con el prestamo podría adquirir mejores ingresos que le permitirian mejores comodidades y el capital necesario para emprenderse a nuevos proyectos.
texts.en:
Sra. Edith Xiomara L. C. is 44 years old, married, and lives in Unidad de Proposito. Her husband is a sales executive and helps to financially support their four children.

Edith has been managing her store for the past three years, but her sales have been poor as of late because of the difficulties with the economy. For this reason, she wants to invest in a large quantity of new consumer products so that she can create new opportunities for her business and improve her household finances. Among the aspirations she has for her family is to prepare her children by providing them with an education. She hopes to support them in this endeavor and believes the loan will help her acquire more income by improving her facilities and supplying needed capital to pursue new projects.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La Señora  Julia C. S. es propietaria de una comidería en el mercado la terminal de León, donde vende los platillo tales como gallo pinto, tacos, manuelita, carne asada y bebidas diversas.
 
Está  solicitando el crédito para la compra al por mayor de granos básicos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar aceite  para la elaboración de los exquisito platillos  de comida que ella sabe preparar.
texts.en:
Julia C. S. owns an eatery in León's terminal where she sells prepared dishes, like: gallo pinto (rice & beans), tacos, manuelita (sweet, cheese-filled turnover), grilled meat, assorted beverages. She is asking for funding to buy ingredients like: rice, beans, cooking oil, etc. for the preparation of the delicious meals she knows how to make.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the preparation of her meals.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Maria ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora, y madre de familia, de once hijos, todos mayores,  tiene 65 años de edad, y aun sigue cosiendo sus costura que aprendió desde su juventud y ha sido su fuente de ingreso para apoyar a su familia, su esposo es comerciante tiene una pequeña pulpería al lado de casa y ha sido quien aporto el dinero para iniciar su trabajo, así como junto lograron hacer su casa. Y han ayudado a sus hijos. Lleva treinta años en el trabajo de la costura, y ha captado muchos clientes, ya que hace diferentes trabajo como vestidos, trajes formales, sabana, fundas, entre otro trabajo, venta de cosmético  de la Avon. Que se venden por ser buenos y accesibles. Con este préstamo  quiere comprar telas variadas, hilos, Ciper, botones. Para poder hacer sus costuras y encargos de uniforme, pero también va  a comprar uniformes escolares hecho ya que esta muy retrasada con los encargo por que no pudo ingresar ante la solicitud y los estudiante ya entraron al colegio. Todos sus créditos lo ah  invertido en su negocio de venta de cosméticos como en su costura. Todo gracias a los financiamientos que Afodenic ha otorgado
texts.en:
Doña Maria is 65 years old and a hardworking woman and mother of eleven adult children. She learned how to sew as a young girl and turned this skill into a source of income to support her family. Her husband is a merchant who manages a small grocery store next to their house. The money he earned enabled her to start her business, and together, they have been able to make a home for themselves.

Maria has been sewing for a living for thirty years and has attracted many customers because of the different items that she produces such as suits, formal dresses, bed sheets, pillowcases, and other articles. In addition, she sells Avon cosmetics. Her sales have been good and this job is very accessible.

With this loan, she will buy different fabrics, threads, zippers, and buttons for making dresses and fulfilling orders for uniforms. She will also buy ready-made school uniforms because she got behind on her orders because she did not have the money to complete them before the students returned to school. All of her previous loans have been invested in her cosmetics and sewing businesses. She thanks AFODENIC for providing this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, threads, zippers, and buttons

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Aidee  Ninfa Giménez quien invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras.

La Sra. Maria D. la Cruz P. se dedica a la venta D. bebidas, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. bebidas al por mayor, logrando D. ese modo ofrecer mayor variedad D. bebidas frescas a sus clientes.

La Sra. Aidee Ninfa Giménez se dedica a la venta D. comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. ingredientes para la elaboración D. los comestibles, logrando obtener mayor variedad D. minutas  que ofrecer a su clientela.

La Sra. Juana D. la Cruz O. se dedica a la venta D. Frutas, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. Frutas en general, obteniendo así mayor variedad D. frutas para ofrecer a sus clientes.

La Sra. Irma Concepción M. se dedica a la venta D. Producto D. Limpieza, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. insumo para la elaboración D. los productos D. limpieza, logrando D. ese modo ofrecer mayor  variedad D. productos D. limpieza a sus clientes.

La Sra. Gloria Ramona M. se dedica a la venta D. comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. ingredientes para la elaboración D. los comestible, logrando ofrecer variedad y calidad D. minutas a sus clientes.

La Sra. Yenny Elizabeth B. se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. esos productos en general, logrando D. ese modo  ofrecer buena calidad y variedad D. cosméticos a su clientela.

La Sra. Izabel B. se dedica a la venta D. helados,  invirtió el dinero en la compra D. Helados al por mayor, logrando ofrecer  buenos y variados sabores D. helados a sus clientes.

La Sra. Angelica Maria I. se dedica a la venta D. gas, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. gas al por mayor, logrando ofrecer calidad D. gas a su clientela

La Sra. Gloria Graciela C. es costurera, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. materiales para su trabajo ( telas, hilos, tijeras, etc.) logrando ofrecer buena variedad D.  prendas  a sus clientes.

La Sra. Lucia B. se dedica ala venta D. bebidas en general,  invirtió el dinero en la compra D. bebidas en general, logrando D. ese modo ofrecer mayor variedad D. bebidas frescas a sus clientes.

La Sra. Maria Lourdes B. se dedica a la venta D. Comestibles, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. ingredientes para la elaboración D. los comestibles, logrando D. eso modo ofrecer una buena variedad D. minutas a sus clientes.

La Sra. Aurora A. es costurera, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. elementos para su trabajo (telas, goma, hilos, accesorios, etc.) ofreciendo  calidad y variedad D. prendas a su clientela.

La Sra. Emilce Elizabeth S. posee una despensa, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. mercaderías en general ( embutidos, panificados, bebidas, lácteos, etc.),logrando ofrecer una  buena variedad D. mercaderías a sus clientes.

La Sra. Nancy Petrona B. se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. vestir, invirtió el  dinero en la compra D. prendas D. vestir, logrando ofrecer D. ese modo buena variedad D. prendas D. vestir a sus clientes.

La Sra. Cristina Marisol N. se dedica a la venta D. bebidas              en general, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. bebidas en general, logrando así ofrecer una buena variedad D. bebidas frescas a sus clientes. 

La Sra. Verónica Aguilera D. O. posee un kiosco, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. mercadería en general (lácteos, comestibles, bebidas, panificados, etc.) logrando ofrecer una buena variedad D. mercaderías a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group started when Sra. Aidee Ninfa Giménez contacted her friends and invited them to organize a committee to join the Women’s Entrepreneurship Program.

Sra. Maria D. la Cruz P. sells beverages and will use her loan to buy more beverages in bulk so that she can offer a greater variety of cold drinks to her customers.

Sra. Aidee Ninfa Giménez sells prepared foods and will use her loan to buy ingredients for preparing her dishes and offering customers a wider variety of items on her menu.

Sra. Juana D. la Cruz O. sells fruit and will use her loan to buy more fruit and proviD. her customers with a wider variety.

Sra. Irma Concepción M. sells cleaning products and will use her loan to buy the supplies needed to make these products. She also hopes to offer her customers with a wider variety of cleaning products.

Sra. Gloria Ramona M. sells prepared foods and will use her loan to buy ingredients for preparing her dishes and offering customers a wider variety of items on her menu.

Sra. Yenny Elizabeth B. sells cosmetics and will use her loan to buy more of these products so that she offer her customers a wider variety of cosmetics that are of good quality.

Sra. Izabel B. sells ice cream and will use her loan to buy ice cream at wholesale with hopes of providing her customers a good product in a variety of flavors.

Sra. Angelica Maria I. sells gas and will use her loan to buy more gas at wholesale prices and continue offering this product to her customers.

Sra. Gloria Graciela C. is a seamstress and will use her loan to buy materials (fabric, thread, scissors, etc.) needed for her work. She hopes to offer her customers a variety of garments.

Sra. Lucia B. sells beverages and will use her loan to buy more of them so that she can offer her customers a variety of cold drinks.

Sra. Maria Lourdes B. sells prepared foods and will use her loan to buy ingredients for preparing her dishes and offering customers a wider variety of items on her menu.

Sra. Aurora A. is a seamstress and will use her loan to buy materials (fabric, elastic, thread, accessories, etc.) needed for her work. She hopes to offer her customers a variety of garments.

Sra. Emilce Elizabeth S. has a convenience store and will use her loan to buy general merchandise (sausages, baked goods, beverages, dairy products, etc.) so that she can offer a wider variety of products to her customers.

Sra. Nancy Petrona B. sells clothing and will user her loan to buy more inventory so that she can offer her customers a wider selection.

Sra. Cristina Marisol N. sells beverages and will use her loan to buy more of them so that she can offer her customers a variety of cold drinks.

Sra. Verónica Aguilera D. O. has a kiosk from which she sells general merchandise (dairy products, snacks, beverages, baked goods, etc.). She will use her loan to buy more of these products so that she can offer her customers a wider variety.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Encuentro Con Jesus 5 Group

texts.en:
Angela is the coordinator of her group Encuentro con Jesus (Encounter with Jesus), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Los Alcarrizzos, a dusty industrial town north of the capital, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their child.

Angela is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and excited at the prospect of growing her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling jewelry, which she makes from low quality silver into simple designs for her clients. She will use the profits to invest in education for her child as well as saving for when she can one day own her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy materials with which to make jewelry

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La Señora Martha Lorena A. se dedica  a la venta de cosméticos en el Mercado la estación de León. Todos los días inicia abriendo el negocio a las 6:00 de la mañana  es una mujer muy trabajadora, ejemplar ya que  es el sustento de su familia.
Solicita el crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de cosméticos tales como: shampo, jabón, pinturas de uña, colonias, cremas entre otros.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena A. sells cosmetics in León's La Estacion market. She starts her workday every day at 6am; she is a very hard-working woman, exemplary since she is her family's only source of support. She is asking for funding to buy cosmetics such as: shampoo, soap, nail polish, colognes, creams, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Melania Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Melania es una mujer trabajadora lleva muchos años trabajando como domestica para poder ayudar a los gastos básicos de su hogar. Tiene 45 años de edad y sus planes es poder terminar de hacer un cuarto que comenzó pero por falta de dinero no lo logro terminar el cual tiene cerrado con hojas de zinc, parte de la construcción ya que su objetivo con el préstamo que le dieron era terminar el cuarto pero no le alcanzo lo cual espera hacerlo con esta nueva solicitud. Su esposo es mecánico, pero su salario es bajo y tiene que apoyar a sus  dos hijos que tienen estudiando. Para comenzar la obra comprara: arena, cemento, cuartones, y zinc para terminar el cuarto y poder estar en mejores condiciones. Sus planes a futuro es poder poner un pequeño negocio en donde pueda estar en su casa ya que su trabajo es cansado y gana poco.
texts.en:
Sra. Melania has been working hard for many years as a housekeeper so that she can help with the basic household expenses. She is 45 years old and has plans of finishing a room that she started. However, she ran out of money and was not able to finish it and enclose it with sheets of zinc. Her previous loan was to cover part of the construction costs of this room, so she hopes to complete the job with this new request.

Melania’s husband is a mechanic, but his salary is low and is only enough to support their two children who are in school. In order to restart the construction work, she will buy materials such as sand, cement, joists, and zinc needed to finish the room and provide better living conditions. In the future, she hopes to start a small home business because her current job is tiring and pays very little.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction supplies needed to finish a room

loans.name: San Cristobal De Aparquilla Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN CRISTOBAL D. APARQUILLA”, el banco esta conformado por 13 miembros,  ellos viven en la comunidad D. Aparquilla D. la provincia D. Anta del departamento del Cusco y se reúnen cada treinta días en el salón comunal D. la comunidad D. Aparquilla.
    
Los socios se dedican al comercio minorista, entre los miembros D. este banco tenemos a las socias Cirila y Juana que se dedican a la venta D. hortalizas; Las socias Melchora, Julia y Ysabel se dedican a la venta D. animales menores; Herminia venD. comestibles, Fermín venD. pasto (comida para los animales) y Marina venD. granos, ellos están preocupadas porque no venden sus productos porque el puente que da paso para la comunidad D. Izcuchaca fue movido por el caudal del rió que aumento durante varios días por lo tanto no pueden llevar sus productos a vender a la diferentes ciudades del Cusco, pero los socios se las ingenian para vender sus productos entonces abrieron un camino alterno para la ciudad del Cusco. 

La socia Cirila tiene 62 años D. edad, es conviviente, tiene seis hijos, ella a pesar D. no contar estudios superiores se la ingenio para abrir un pequeño negocio D. compra y venta D. hortalizas. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio comprando semillas. La socia Cirila y varios compañeros del banco comunal que tienen chacras fueron inundados por las fuertes lluvias que cayeron en la ciudad Aparquilla pues perdieron todos sus cultivos y ahora requieren el préstamo para reparar los daños que causaron las lluvias.   

Nuestros socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
This group of 13 belongs to the community bank San Cristobal D. Aparquilla. They live in Aparquilla Anta, Cusco, and meet once a month at the community center in Aparquilla. Each group member works in retail. Cirila and Juana sell vegetables. Melchora, Julia and Ysabel deal sell small animals. Herminia sells groceries, and Fermin sells animal feed. Marina sells grain. The group is concerned that their sales will be affected by a bridge to Izcuchaca that gave way during recent floods. For a while, they couldn't sell their products in other cities in Cusco. They got creative, though, and sold more products by finding an alternate route to the city of Cusco itself. One group member is Cirila, a 62-year-old married woman with children. Although she doesn't have much formal education, she was able to open a small business buying and selling vegetables. She will use her portion of this loan to buy seeds. Flooding has damaged a number of farms belonging to group members, including Cirila's. They've lost their crops and need to repair rain damage. The group really appreciates this opportunity, and pledge to repay their loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seeds to replace lost crops

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Sebastiana Rojas quien invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.

La sra. Francisca C. posee una despensa, invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías en general ( panificados, lácteos, bebidas.

La sra. Carmen R. I. se dedica a la venta de Lencería, invirtió el dinero en la compra de prendas intimas, logrando obtener mayor variedad de prendas que ofrecer a su clientela.

La sra. Limpia N. se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza, invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumo para la elaboración de los productos de limpieza, obteniendo así mayor variedad de productos de limpieza que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La sra. Nilda C. se dedica a la venta de CD, invirtió el dinero en la compra de esa mercadería, logrando ofrecer mayor  variedad de esa mercadería a sus clientes.

La sra. Nadia Gómez se dedica a la venta de prendas intimas, invirtió el dinero en la compra de prendas intimas en general, logrando ofrecer variedad y calidad de lencería a sus clientes.

La sra. Maria G. posee un copetín, invirtió el dinero en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de los comestible, logrando de ese modo ofrecer buena variedad de minutas a sus clientes.

La sra. Antonia V. posee una ferretería,  invirtió el dinero en la compra de  mercaderias en general y en materiales para su trabajo  ofrciendo asi un buen servicio y buenos precios a sus clientes.

La sra. Ruth N. se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, invirtió el dinero en la compra de productos en general, logrando ofrecer calidad y variedad de cosméticos a su clientela.

La sra. Sonia P. es peluquera , invirtió el dinero en la compra de materiales para su trabajo, logrando ofrecer un buen servicio para sus clientes.

La sra. Bernarda Aguera se dedica la venta de  prendas de vestir invirtió el dinero en la compra de Prendas de vestir  en general, logrando asi  ofrecer buena variedad de prendas  de vestir a sus clientes.

La sra. Norma R. M.  es manicurista, invirtio el dinero en la compra de materiales para su trabajo, logrando de eso modo ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes.

La sra. Lucia R. se dedica a la venta de helados, invirtio el dinero en la compra de helados al por mayor, logrando ofreciendo  calidad y variedad de helados a su clientela.

La sra. Nancy Servin se dedica a la venta de lenceria, invirtio el dinero en la compra de esa prendas en general,logrando ofrecer una  buena variedad de prendas intimas a sus clientes.

La sra. Zunilda P. se dedica a la venta de Comestible , invirtio el  dinero en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboracion de los comestibles, logrando de ese modo buena variedad de minutas que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La sra. Claudia P. posee una despensa, invirtio el dinero en la compra de esas mercaderias en general ( bebidas, lacteos, panificados, etc.), logrando asi ofrecer una buena variedad de mercederias a sus clientes. 

La sra. Ana C. es costurera, invirtio el dinero en la compra de materiales para su trabajo ( tela, hilo, goma) logrando ofrecer una buena variedad de prendas a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The point person for starting this committee was señora Sebastiana Rojas, who invited and organized her friends to start Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee of Enterprising Women). Sra. Francisca C. owns a grocery. She invested the money in the purchase of general merchandise (baked goods, dairy products and beverages). Sra. Carmen R. I. makes her living selling lingerie. She invested the money in the purchase of undergarments, allowing her a greater variety of undergarments to offer to her customers. Sra. Limpia N. makes her living selling cleaning products. She invested the money in the purchase of ingredients to make the cleaning products, thus obtaining a greater variety of cleaning products to offer to her customers. Sra. Nilda C. makes her living selling CDs. She invested the money in the purchase of more merchandise, allowing her to offer a greater variety of that merchandise to her customers. Sra. Nadia Gómez makes her living selling undergarments. She invested to money in the purchase of general undergarments, allowing her to offer a greater variety and quality of lingerie to her customers. Sra. Maria G. owns a snack bar. She invested the money in the purchase of ingredients to make the dishes, thus being able to to offer a considerable variety of snacks to her customers. Sra. Antonia V. owns a hardware store. She invested the money in the purchase of general merchandise and materials for her work, thus being able to offer quality service and good prices to her customers. Sra. Ruth N. makes her living selling cosmetics. She invested the money in the purchase of general products, allowing her to offer a variety of quality cosmetics to her customers. Sra. Sonia P. is a hairdresser. She invested the money in the purchase of materials for her job, allowing her to offer better service to her clients. Sra. Bernarda Aguera makes her living selling clothing. She invested the money in the purchase of general garments, allowing her to offer a considerable variety of garments to her customers. Sra. Norma R. M. is a manicurist. She invested the money in the purchase of materials for her work, thus being able to offer quality service to her customers. Sra. Lucia R. makes her living selling ice cream. She invested the money in the purchase of wholesale ice cream, allowing her to offer a variety of quality ice cream to her customers. Sra. Nancy Servin makes her living selling lingerie. She invested the money in the purchase of this type of garment, allowing her to offer a considerable variety of undergarments to her customers. Sra. Zunilda P. makes her living selling snacks. She invested the money in the purchase of ingredients to make her snacks, thus being able to offer a greater variety of snacks to her customers. Sra. Claudia P. owns a grocery. She invested the money in the purchase of general merchandise (beverages, dairy products, bakery products etc.), thus offering a considerable variety of merchandise to her clients. Sra. Ana C. is a seamstress. She invested the money in the purchase of materials for her work (fabric, thread, elastics) allowing her to offer a considerable variety of garments to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as noodles, sugar, bakery products, dairy products, oil and other items.

loans.name: Virgen Asunta Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”, ellos viven en la comunidad de Hospitalpampa de la provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco y se reúnen cada treinta días en la casa de la señora Dagmar en la comunidad de Hospitalpampa. El banco comunal “Virgen Asunta” esta conformado por 10 miembros,  
    
Los socios se dedican al comercio minorista, entre los miembros de este banco tenemos a las socias Gerónima que se dedica a la venta de leña; La socia Teresa se dedica al procesamiento y venta de yogurt; El socio Silvestre se dedica a la construcción de casas; La socia Marylin compra y venta de granos, ellos están preocupadas porque no venden sus productos debido a las fuertes lluvias que cayeron durante varios días, las lluvias aumentaron el caudal del rió provocando que el rió moviera el puente que da paso para la ciudad del Cusco de la comunidad de Izcuchaca por lo tanto no hay paso. Los socios no pueden llevar sus productos a vender a las diferentes ciudades del Cusco, pero los socios se las ingenian para vender sus productos entonces abrieron un camino alterno para la ciudad del Cusco. 

La socia Dagmar tiene 44 años de edad, es casada, es natural de la ciudad de Calca, tiene cinco hijos, ella actualmente vive en la comunidad de Hospitalpampa, Ella es una madre trabajadora que se las ingenio para abrir un pequeño negocio de compra y venta de comestibles. La socia Dagmar requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio comprando más azúcar, arroz, fideos, gaseosas y muchos productos más. 

Nuestros socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "Virgen Asunta." They live in the community of Hospitalpampa in Anta province, Department of Cusco. They meet every thirty days at the home of señora Dagmar in the community of Hospitalpampa. The communal bank “Virgen Asunta” is made up of 10 members. The members make their livings in retail trade. Among the members of this bank we have Gerónima, who makes her living selling firewood; Teresa who makes her living processing and selling yogurt; Silvestre who makes his living building houses; and Marylin buys and sells grains. They are worried because they aren't able to sell their products due to the heavy rains that lasted for several days. The rains raised the water level of the river, which moved the bridge over which they cross from the community of Izcuchaca into the city of Cusco; therefore, there is no way across. The members cannot bring their products to sell in the different cities of the Department of Cusco, but they managed to sell their products once an alternate route to the city of Cusco was opened. The member Dagmar is 44 years old, is married and comes from the city of Calca. She has five children and currently lives in the community of Hospitalpampa. She is a working mother who managed to open a small business buying and selling foodstuffs. Sra. Dagmar needs the loan to increase her business's capital and purchase more sugar, rice, noodles, sodas and many other products. Our members are grateful for the opportunity provided and promise to make good on the various payments in the established time periods.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member, Dagmar, needs to loan to increase her business's capital by buying more sugar, rice, noodles, sodas and many other products.

loans.name: Aïcha

texts.fr: Aïcha BÂ est une femme de 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MBORO depuis 2 ans et a eu 4 bonnes expériences avec le crédit. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de développer un petit commerce de tissus et d'huile de palme. Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et au payement de la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Aïcha BÂ is 40 years old, married and a mother of four children. She has been a member of the MBORO “Banc Villageois” loan group for the past two years and had four positive loan experiences. Her new loan will enable her to start a small business selling fabrics and palm-nut oil. Her aim is to help improve her family’s living conditions and pay for her children’s education.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her business

loans.name: Divina Luz 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Yocasta is the coordinator of her group, Divina Luz (Divine Light), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her longterm partner and their three children.

Yocasta is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and she is excited about the opportunity to continue growing her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling empanadas (stuffed bread or pastry) by purchasing the necessary ingredients including cooking oil, meats, cheeses and flour.

Yocasta will use the profits to invest in the education of her children and in her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making more empanadas
